story:
A studio co-operative run by artists for artists: Creating a place to conceive new ideas, practices and processes, experiment, and develop as artists.

My initiative for this concept expounds from my own interdisciplinary art and studio practice. My passion is to use various mediums to explore and convey my ideas in an innovative and imaginative manner.  Along with the use of a diverse assortment of materials comes the need for an assortment of distinctive tools to execute these ideas. 

As head of the co-operative, I will work to supply the artist with the space and tools required to explore new mediums through workshops. This will enable each member to make knowledgeable decisions based on personal exploration in new materials, broaden their horizons, and be innovative and unique in their art practice.  Every artist wants to do something no one else is doing and be the best, both technically and philosophically, they can be.  This space will be the breeding grounds for such personal discoveries, innovation, and ingeniously resourceful work production.

The cooperative environment allows us to help one another, technically and critically, create new, original contemporary works of art in an ever growing and changing discipline. 

My tools, my space, for all of us.

I have been an artist as long as I can remember. I studied at the Nova Scotia University of Art & Design, graduating with BFA major in studio fine arts, minor in drawing. While teaching continuing education classes and shop tech studio supervision at the University, I realized my passion for teaching others. My campaign for Open Studio Co-Op reflects these principles in my art making practice and process, following my credo, "I can only keep what I have by giving it away".

This space will reflect just that; open and welcoming to all. In the emerging art scene of Nanaimo, further encouragement of the arts is needed. It will be a chance for artists to explore new materials under professional and experienced guidance. The studio will be a way to learn, share, and contribute to our community. 

Renovation costs

My overhead for renovations will be moderately low as my rental fees for the space will be waved during the renovation period, and I am in possession of the tools required for the project.  My requirements are minimal:

  • lumber for construction of tables, easels, storage boxes, and counters……………………………………………………........…Estimated $300
  • paint, stain, and urethane for walls, floors, exterior, and x5 gallons………………………………………………………….........Estimated $150
  • cement for entrance display unit/cash counter.........Estimated $50
  • miscellaneous:  shop vacuum, sandpaper, dust masks, work gloves, cleaning supplies, and hardware/fasteners..........….Estimated $250
  • clear tarp curtain to separate wood-shop from painting studio……………………………………………………………….....Estimated $50
  • Mishap, unexpected, safety………………………………..Estimated $200
  • Damage Deposit…………………………………………………………………$250
  • Dumpster rental fee………………………………………………  Quoted $325
  • Alarm installation fee…………………………………………… ..Quoted $180
  • Register Business Licence………………………………………................$125

Total Renovation Cost $1880

Tool and Material required prior to opening

Welding studio

  • 10lbs spool flux coated welding wire $64.99, 2 pair welding gloves $15.99, ear-plugs box $10.99, safety goggles $14.99, 5pk grinding discs $11.99, 10pk cut off wheels $11.99, titanium drill bits $49.99, welding shield curtain $120, large vice $59.99, 1lbs ball-peen hammer $24.99, (2)12” sliding clamps $68.99, adjustable vice clamp $14.99, vice grip pliers $14.99, wire brush $3.99, portable work table $34.99

Total $523.86

Wood shop

  • Cordless drill $129.99, jig saw $99.99, ban-saw $479.99, drill press $149.99, wood carving chisels $54.99, large drill bits $39.99, hammers (standard) $9.99, sanding pads (3)2.99, sand paper $9.99, safety glasses $4.99, dust masks box $12.99

Total $1001.87

Sculpture studio

  • Angle grinder $69.99, diamond wheel $19.99, cold chisels $39.99, bench grinder $89.99

Total$219.96

Grand Total: $3625.69

There are no other spaces like this in Nanaimo for the growing and thriving arts community. My proposed studio is located in the same building as a locally-owned art supply store that I not only currently work for, but also renovated to its current state. (To view this: www.ironoxideartsupplies.com) My intention is for us to help one another build a sustainable small business venture.

I will be offering classes in the following disciplines:

Introduction to welding, practice and process

Intermediate welding, fabrication guildlines

Introduction to wood shop, methods, and materials

Introduction to mixed-materials 3D fabrication

Introduction to mold-making, waste molds

Intermediate mold-making, two part production molds

Advanced mold making, two part rubber molds, blanket method

Besides these classes, I wish to encourage more women to explore the world of welding and other fabrications by offering classes directed towards their needs. 

I realize that not everyone can make a financial contribution, but this type of endeavour can also be successful through material and tool donations, as well as spreading the word about the possibilities of this innovative venture. Please spread the word through social media and to your local community.

story:
The Saysay Project: 
The Arrival of the 12th Poblador
a Filipino American Art Exhibit

May 11 - May 25, 2014
Pico House, El Pueblo De Los Angeles Historical Monument 

In celebration of the Los Angeles Asian Pacific Heritage Month, FilAM ARTS and the El Pueblo De Los Angeles Historical Monument presents the Saysay Project art exhibit: The Arrival of the 12th Poblador.  This will be the first Filipino American exhibit at this historic location, exploring the narratives of Filipino presence and contributions to Los Angeles. 

According to the City of L.A.'s historical accounts, Alta California Governor Felipe de Neve selected 12 pobladores (townsfolk)  to settle in El Pueblo de Nuestra Señora la Reina de Los Ángeles de Porciúncula, or today it is known as Los Angeles. One of them was Antonio Miranda Rodriguez, who is said to be of Asian descent.  However during los pobladores travels, Rodriguez's daughter became ill with smallpox, thus suspending his journey.


To be showcased are historical photographs and art work depicting the eventual arrival of Filipino Americans and their contributions to Los Angeles culture, including the intersection of Mexican and Filipino narratives through the Galleon Trade starting in the 16th Century, to the Farm Workers movement in the 20th Century. 

Your generous contribution will go towards the installation of this exhibition that includes visual art, historical photographs, and videos; as well as towards the documentation of Filipino American narratives in video format. 

The exhibit is scheduled to open on Sunday, May 11th. We are open to the public and admission is free. 

There will be a SPECIAL PREVIEW NIGHT AND RECEPTION open to Friend Level Supporters ($25) and higher on:

Date: Friday, May 9th

*NEW*  Time: 6:00pm - 9:00pm

Place: Pico House, El Pueblo de Los Angeles Historical Monument

424 N Main St, Los Angeles, CA 90012


What is FilAM ARTS?

Embracing the value of KAPWA (shared being), the Association for the Advancement of Filipino American Arts and Culture’s (also known as FilAm ARTS) mission is to facilitate community synergy and transformation by advancing the arts and diverse cultural heritage of Filipinos through arts services, presentation, and education.

With five public programs - the Annual Festival of Philippine Arts & Culture, the statewide Pilipino Artists Network, the arts education program - Eskuwela Kultura, the Buy Pinoy Campaign, and the Saysay Project, FilAm ARTS believes in the power of the arts to overcome language barriers and build community through cultural diversity.

For more information please visit filamarts.org 

For more information on El Pueblo Historical Monument and their 4 museums which are free to the public please visit their Facebook  page

story:
(eng / ita / fr)

This is a PHOTOGRAPHIC / VIDEO project, a collection of stories told by citizens of the world.

We collect stories in our life, most of the time unconsciously. People talking to us, at the office, at the shop, during a hair cut. Anecdotes, swiftly wiped by the irresistible time. Our brain records, analyses, interprets, outputs and conclude. We build our personality through accumulation of appropriate, striking stories.

We are Alice and Christophe.

* Alice is a professional photographer who works in the field of photography and video, and in the musical artistic scene in Italy. She is a traveller, a transnomadic photographer who loves going around the world for making pictures, trying to find the beauty in the life of the others and in the world itself. Her artistic work is displayed on fullfamelife.wordpress.com.

*Christophe is a traveller on the road for the last 10 years. He also developed along his initiatic quest a keen interest in photography and cinema. Some of  his work, photographic and video, are displayed on the blog kristosproductions.wordpress.com.

*** During our adventures, we have accumulated dozens of stories, fruit of meetings with locals and other travellers. These stories are part of our life because we live them as a traveller. But to our relatives and friends, they are pieces of dream, which take them, temporarily, into another reality.

(** this the handmade t-shirt!)

** We have the project of collecting stories from people all over the world, from January 2014, and compiled them in a book and a short movie. All kind of people, from students to lawyers, from gangsters to shopkeepers, from clerks to wild honey pickers; from street cleaners to circus artists; from atheists to believers; from different religions and cultures. 

Everybody has stories to tell, stemming from fairy tales or from personal lived experiences. They stay, there, somewhere in their subconscious memories, dormant, ready to surge and bounce up to the surface of consciousness. We want to make contribute these 'tellers' to our story collecting, share it with you and make you travel with us. We planned to collect stories for a period of six months. You will travel through our project by receiving news update and some of the collected stories on thestorycollectorproject.com and The Story Collector on Facebook and the Twitter Page.

*** We need for the realization of The Story Collector Project  a fund raising.

5,000 EUR are claimed to cover partial costs of our trip.  and the publishing of a book containing stories and fine art portraits of the tellers. You will then receive a reward.

Our philosophy is to prepare you for a practical, invigorating experience of traveling. We would be so glad to be responsible for your big leaving adventure, discovering the world with your own perception and willpower. If you are already experienced traveller, you will enjoy our project as a keen aware amateur.

Further exhibitions with pictures and videos of story collection, as well as The Story Collector Project limited edition of the book for sale and a short movie, are planned for beginning 2015. 

We would require your help and generosity at above latest point. 


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*** Questo è un progetto di fotografia e video, una raccolta di storie raccontate dai cittadini del mondo.***

Nella nostra vita continuiamo a collezionare storie, la maggior parte inconsciamente. Le persone ci parlano, in ufficio, in un negozio, dal parrucchiere. Aneddoti, cancellati dal passare del tempo. Il nostro cervello registra, interpreta, digerisce e trae le sue conclusioni. Costruiamo la nostra personalità attraverso il sedimentarsi di casuali storie sorprendenti.

Siamo Alice e Christophe.

Alice e' una fotografa professionista, che lavora nel campo della fotografia e del video, e per lungo tempo ha lavorato sulla scena musicale italiana. E' una viaggiatrice, una fotografa transnomadica che ama girare il mondo e scovare la bellezza nelle vite degli altri e nel mondo stesso. I suoi lavori si possono vedere su fullfamelife.wordpress.com.

Christophe e' un viaggiatore on the road che ha girato il mondo negli ultimi 10 anni. Ha sviluppato, lungo questo cammino, un vivo interesse per la fotografia e per il cinema. Alcuni dei suoi lavori di foto e video sono nel suo blog kristosproductions.wordpress.com

Durante le nostre avventure abbiamo accumulato decine di storie, frutto di incontri con gente del posto e con altri viaggiatori. Queste storie sono parte della nostra vita perché le viviamo come esploratori. Ma per parenti e amici esse diventano un pezzettino di sogno, che li trasporta, temporaneamente, in un'altra realtà.

Il nostro progetto e' quello di raccogliere storie dalle persone di tutto il mondo per farne un libro e un cortometraggio. Tutte le tipologie di persone, dagli studenti agli avvocati, dai gangster ai cassieri dei supermercati, dai commessi ai raccoglitori di miele selvatico, dagli spazzini ai boscaioli, dagli ascetici ai credenti. Di ogni cultura e religione. Ciascuna persona ha una storia da racconta, avvenimenti di vista vissuta o favole. Le storie sono racchiuse da qualche parte nel subconscio della memoria, dormienti, pronte a riemergere alla superficie della coscienza. Vogliamo contribuire al ricordo di queste storie nei nostri “narratori”, per collezionarle, condividerle e farvi sognare. Abbiamo pensato di collezionare storie per un periodo di 6 mesi. Viaggerete con noi attraverso questo progetto, ricevendo news e aggiornamenti su thestorycollectorproject.com, The Story Collector su Facebook e la Twitter Page.

Per la realizzazione del The Story Collector Project abbiamo iniziato una raccolta di fondi. Cerchiamo 5000€ per coprire parzialmente i costi del viaggio e la pubblicazione di un libro contenente le storie e i ritratti dei narratori. La vostra donazione potrà essere fatta facilmente attraverso questa piattaforma di crowdfunding e riceverete la vostra ricompensa a seconda della donazione effettuata.

La nostra filosofia e' di prepararvi per un'esperienza pratica e rinvigorente di viaggio. Saremmo felici di essere i responsabili della vostra Grande Avventura, per scoprire il mondo attraverso i vostri sensi e volontà. Se siete già esperti viaggiatori amerete il nostro progetto, se siete amanti dei viaggi lo seguirete con attenzione.Prevediamo, per il futuro, di fare ulteriori esposizioni di foto e video della nostra collezione di storie e un libro, ed anche un cortometraggio.

Per questo facciamo appello alla vostra generosità.

---------------------------

***Ceci est un projet photographique et vidéo, une collection d'histoires racontées par des citoyens du monde.***
Nous collectons des histoires au cours de notre vie, la plupart du temps inconsciemment. Des personnes qui nous parlent, au bureau, chez l'épicier, pendant une coupe de cheveux. Des anedoctes, rapidement balayés par les vagues irresistibles du temps. Notre cerveau enregistre, analyse, interprète, transforme et conclue. Nous construisons notre personalité à travers l'accumulation d'histoires marquantes et appropriées.

Alice est une photographe professionnelle. Elle a voyagé autour du monde pour faire des photos artistiques avec une seule idée en tête: la vie des autres. Son travail est visible sur le blog fullframelife.wordpress.com.

Christophe est sur la route depuis les 10 dernières années. Il a également développé au cours de sa quête initiatique un interêt aigu pour la photographie et le cinéma. Quelqu'uns de ses travaux sont exposés sur le blog suivant: kristosproductions.wordpress.com.

Nous avons eu l'occasion d'accumuler des dizaines d'histoires, fruist de rencontres avec des locaux et d'autres voyageurs. Ces histoires font partie de notre vie parce que nous les avons vécu comme un voyageur. Mais pour nos familles, nos amis, elles sont des morceaux de rêve, qui les emmènent, temporairement, dans une autre réalité.

Nous avons le projet de collecter une histoire auprès de citoyens du monde et les compiler dans un livre une vidéo, documentaire et court métrage. Tous les profils sont envisagés, de l'étudiant au juriste, du gangster à l'épicier, de l'employé de bureau au ramasseur de miel sauvage; de l'artiste au bȗcheron; croyant et non croyant; de religions et cultures différentes.

Chacun a une histoire à raconter, une anedocte vécue ou un mythe. Ces histoires restent, quelque part dans leur mémoires subconscientes, latentes, prêtes à resurgir et rebondir à la surface de la conscience. Nous souhaitons faire participer les diseurs à notre TSCP, partager avec vous et vous faire voyager avec nous. Nous avons prévu de collecter des histoires pour 6 mois. Vous voyagerez à travers notre projet en recevant des nouvelles mises à jour et quelque unes des histoires sur le blog thestorycollectorproject.com et The Story Collector sur Facebook et Twitter page.

(**work in progress t-shirt!)

Nous avons besoin pour la réalisation du TSCP une levée de fonds. 5,000 eur sont nécessaires pour couvrir partiellement les coȗts de notre projet et de la publication du livre contenant les histoires et portraits artistiques des conteurs. Vous recevrez ensuite une récompense qui dépendra du montant de la donation.

Notre philosophie est de vous préparer pour une experience pratique et vivifiante de voyage. Nous serions tellement satisfait d'être responsable de votre grande aventure, à la découverte du monde avec votre propre perception et motivation. Si vous êtes déjà un voyageur experimenté, vous apprécierez notre projet en qualité d'amateur éclairé. Des expositions ultérieures avec photos et vidéos des histoires collectées, ainsi qu'une édition limitée du livre en vente et un projet de court métrage, sont prévues pour début 2015. 

Nous aurons recours à votre générosité a ce moment là.


(Alice Bettolo + Christophe Pelissier)

Queste storie sono parte della nostra vita perché le viviamo come esploratori. Ma per parenti e amici esse diventano un pezzettino di sogno, che li trasporta, temporaneamente, in un'altra realtà.


Il nostro progetto e' quello di raccogliere storie dalle persone di tutto il mondo per farne un libro e un cortometraggio. Tutte le tipologie di persone, dagli studenti agli avvocati, dai gangster ai cassieri dei supermercati, dai commessi ai raccoglitori di miele selvatico, dagli spazzini ai boscaioli, dagli ascetici ai credenti. Di ogni cultura e religione. Ciascuna persona ha una storia da racconta, avvenimenti di vista vissuta o favole. Le storie sono racchiuse da qualche parte nel subconscio della memoria, dormienti, pronte a riemergere alla superficie della coscienza. Vogliamo contribuire al ricordo di queste storie nei nostri “narratori”, per collezionarle, condividerle e farvi sognare. Abbiamo pensato di collezionare storie per un periodo di 6 mesi. Viaggerete con noi attraverso questo progetto, ricevendo news e aggiornamenti su thestorycollectorproject.com, The Story Collector su Facebook e la Twitter Page.Per la realizzazione del The Story Collector Project abbiamo iniziato una raccolta di fondi. Cerchiamo 5000€ per coprire parzialmente i costi del viaggio e la pubblicazione di un libro contenente le storie e i ritratti dei narratori. La vostra donazione potrà essere fatta facilmente attraverso questa piattaforma di crowdfunding e riceverete la vostra ricompensa a seconda della donazione effettuata.La nostra filosofia e' di prepararvi per un'esperienza pratica e rinvigorente di viaggio. Saremmo felici di essere i responsabili della vostra Grande Avventura, per scoprire il mondo attraverso i vostri sensi e volontà. Se siete già esperti viaggiatori amerete il nostro progetto, se siete amanti dei viaggi lo seguirete con attenzione.Prevediamo, per il futuro, di fare ulteriori esposizioni di foto e video della nostra collezione di storie e un libro, ed anche un cortometraggio.


Per questo facciamo appello alla vostra generosità.
---------------------------
***Ceci est un projet photographique et vidéo, une collection d'histoires racontées par des citoyens du monde.***





Nous
collectons des histoires au cours de notre vie, la plupart du temps
inconsciemment. Des personnes qui nous parlent, au bureau, chez
l'épicier, pendant une coupe de cheveux. Des anedoctes, rapidement
balayés
par les vagues irresistibles du temps. Notre cerveau enregistre,
analyse, interprète,
transforme et conclue. Nous construisons notre personalité à
travers l'accumulation d'histoires marquantes et appropriées.


Alice
est une photographe professionnelle. Elle a voyagé
autour du monde pour faire des photos artistiques avec une seule idée
en tête: la vie des autres.
Son travail est visible sur le blog  fullframelife.wordpress.com.
Christophe
est sur la route depuis les 10 dernières
années. Il
a également développé
au cours de sa quête
initiatique un interêt aigu
pour la photographie et le cinéma.
Quelqu'uns de ses travaux sont exposés
sur le blog suivant:  kristosproductions.wordpress.com.
Nous
avons eu l'occasion d'accumuler des dizaines d'histoires, fruist de
rencontres avec des locaux et d'autres voyageurs. Ces histoires font
partie de notre vie parce que nous les avons vécu
comme un voyageur. Mais pour nos familles, nos amis, elles sont des
morceaux de rêve, qui les
emmènent, temporairement,
dans une autre réalité.
Nous
avons le projet de collecter une histoire auprès
de citoyens du monde et les compiler dans un livre une vidéo,
documentaire et court métrage.
Tous les profils sont envisagés,
de l'étudiant au juriste, du
gangster à l'épicier,
de l'employé de bureau au
ramasseur de miel sauvage; de l'artiste au bȗcheron;
croyant et non croyant; de religions et cultures différentes.
Chacun
a une histoire à raconter,
une anedocte vécue ou un
mythe. Ces histoires restent, quelque part dans leur mémoires
subconscientes, latentes, prêtes
à resurgir et rebondir à
la surface de la conscience. Nous souhaitons faire participer les
diseurs à notre TSCP,
partager avec vous et vous faire voyager avec nous. Nous avons prévu
de collecter des histoires pour 6 mois. Vous voyagerez à
travers notre projet en recevant des nouvelles mises à
jour et quelque unes des histoires sur le blog
thestorycollectorproject.com et The Story Collector sur
Facebook et Twitter page.


(**work in progress t-shirt!)

Nous
avons besoin pour la réalisation
du TSCP une levée de fonds.
5,000 eur sont nécessaires pour
couvrir partiellement les coȗts
de notre projet et de la publication du livre contenant les histoires
et portraits artistiques des conteurs. Vous recevrez ensuite une
récompense qui dépendra
du montant de la donation.
Notre
philosophie est de vous préparer
pour une experience pratique et vivifiante de voyage. Nous serions
tellement satisfait d'être
responsable de votre grande aventure, à
la découverte
du monde avec votre propre perception et motivation. Si vous êtes
déjà
un voyageur experimenté,
vous apprécierez
notre projet en qualité
d'amateur éclairé.
Des expositions ultérieures
avec photos et vidéos
des histoires collectées,
ainsi qu'une édition
limitée
du livre en vente et un projet de court métrage,
sont prévues
pour début
2015. 
Nous aurons recours à
votre générosité
a ce moment là.








(Alice Bettolo + Christophe Pelissier)

story:
Amanda Zins.  Artist.

Vividly colored, heavily textured, more often than not iridescent and metallic abstracts. I've been known to dabble in photography and jewelry making as well, though painting is my true passion.

Biography

Amanda Zins was born in the early 70's on the east side of post-riot Detroit. An early interest in all things creative augmented by ample time at home due to illness, fueled a prolific experimentation with many visual media.Fire stoked by city wide recognition and display through the Bates Academy for the Gifted and Talented and a scholarship offer from the Art Institute of Chicago, Amanda continued to work despite chronic and pervasive interruptions caused by an acute blood disorder.Channeling the anxieties, depressions and occasional rage that is a psychological dance partner with her disease , she has managed to create striking imagery on canvas, in photography, and mixed media that represent both victim of circumstance and vision of triumph. 

Having survived two near-death experiences (survival being the crucial element of the “near” part), my creations are not some wanton stab at a vague concept of immortality or some token “gift” that will last when my body is no longer capable of doing so. They are not simply expressions, they are statements of defiance, and catharsis of that which has no cure; not an opposite reaction to the untamed physical energies that pressure me, and certainly not an equal one. They are a deflection of a type of energy that I need doctors and drugs to control. The energy in my art is captured by me alone and is the only prescription that I am allowed to write myself. I hope you can read my handwriting.

My Goal:

To be able to purchase items needed to participate in art fairs year round.  I need a pop-up tent, some tables, a credit card set up, lighting, things you need to run a small business that's generally held outdoors.

I know with the holidays upon us, money is likely a bit tight for everyone.  I'll keep this short, and if I don't reach my goal, I'll run it again after the holidays.

story:
HELP SAVE AN HISTORIC SAN FRANCISCO MURAL

In 1984, more than 30 artists and activists came together to form the project PLACA, to demonstrate - in visual terms - our opposition  to our government's wars of intervention in Central America and our solidarity and respect for the people from these nations, who were arriving in San Francisco's Mission District by the thousands as exiles from these wars. 

PLACA transformed the neglected Balmy Alley, in the heart of the Mission, into an incredible outdoor art environment. Our mural, "Culture Contains the Seed of Resistance that Blossoms into the Flower of Liberation," is the LAST REMAINING COMPLETE MURAL from 1984. Here is what the mural looked like shortly after it was completed nearly 30 years ago:


Each year the mural is viewed by thousands of people from around the world, and photos of it have been published in many books and magazines. But it is in desperate need of restoration. Here is what it looks like today:

We are preparing to restore the mural, otherwise it will have to be removed. We can't let that happen. We will be using new materials that will preserve it for much longer than was previously possible, but we need your help to cover our expenses. Please donate if you can, and/or get the word out to your friends.

Thank you! ¡Gracias!

Miranda Bergman and O'Brien Thiele

story:
Fundraiser to support Business and Local Charities

Hi everyone, my name is Amy Methven and I am a self employed freelance artist currently located in Moray, Scotland.  I am also known as the internet reviewer, analyst and artist Mad Munchkin on Youtube and deviant Art.

My goal with my work has always been to raise money to put back into my local community, support local charities as well as expanding the business itself to improve the quality of artwork I produce.

With this campaign I hope to replace and improve vital equipment needed to keep the business running.  It is also to help fund various events and to assist with travel expenses as well so I am able to attend events outside my jurisdiction.

By donating, you will not only be supporting me and my work but also helping the business and enabling it to have the means to contribute more to my local community and support local charities such as 'Caring Hands'.  'Caring Hands' is a local charity that raises money to feed the homeless and people living in poverty.

What We Need & What You Get

Of course, I want to be able to offer rewards to people who donate.  By donating, you will receive limited edition signed prints usually only available at conventions, a Mad Munchkin Badge, discounts on any future commissions you may wish to purchase,  as well as the opportunity to tell me what the next Mad Munchkin Blethers video should be about.

The Impact

Having the means to expand means the world to me.  I don't want to just make art for myself or to line my own pockets.  Art to me is about sharing it with the world.  I want to encourage more people to be creative with their ideas and put those ideas into action and reach their full potential.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are always ways to show your support other than making a donation.  By spreading the word and telling people about this campaign and others like it, we may reach our goal a little sooner than initially expected.

Thank you to everyone who has already shown their support might it be by subscribing to my videos, following me on face book and twitter, supporting me on Patreon or simply by liking what I do.  You all mean the world to me.

Thanks for reading!  I'm Mad Munchkin.
Stay Creative!

story:
Dear Supporters,

I started CHIPRC because I saw a need in my community of self-publishers for a space that would bring us together to work, to learn from each other, and to celebrate the amazing work being created by independent writers and artists in Chicago.

Over the past two years CHIPRC has been proud to host workshops, community meetings, art exhibits, and readings for artists and writers who may otherwise not have had access to space or a forum for continuing education. We have welcomed artists and writers from across the country and we have tried to make meaningful connections at home. We are a small operation and we are proud to have sought out meaningful partnerships with Chicago Zine Fest, Columbia College’s Center for Book and Paper Arts, Chicago Alternative Comics Expo, Transit Residency, Trans Oral History Project, Quimby’s Bookstore, Chicago Public Library West Town Branch, Columbia College Library, and Learnapalooza. And all this with an all-volunteer staff and a committed group of artists willing to teach what they know to help others do what they love.

I am asking for your help now because I need it to keep CHIPRC's doors open. I need your help to expand CHIPRC's offerings, to provide needed resources, and to get the work out so that people of all skill levels and backgrounds can come together, develop their practice, and share what they do with others. 

By donating to this fundraiser, you can become part of CHIPRC’s vision by choosing membership, by taking a class or private less, or by simply supporting with a tax deductable donation. Please share this with other creatives who support the arts or who might like to know more about what we do at CHIPRC.


Thank you,
John Wawrzaszek
Executive Director
Chicago Publishers Resource Center


A bit about CHIPRC…
CHIPRC was imagined after a visit to Portland’s Independent Publishing Resource Center. The idea that a center like that existed was awe-inspiring. Chicago has a rich literary history with so much going on, it is hard to keep track of it all. There are academic programs, DIY organizations, community supported events, and nationally recognized publishers. The makeup of the literary and arts community is so diverse that even though there is a shared love for art and literature, these circles don’t always overlap. I saw CHIPRC as a way to support all these endeavors under one roof.

Since opening in July 2013, CHIPRC has spread its wings, offering a multitude of programming focused on writing,  comics, fine art, web design, book and paper arts, and storytelling. There have been community events supporting and partnering with Chicago Zine Fest, Columbia College’s Center for Book and Paper Arts, Chicago Alternative Comics Expo, Transit Residency, Trans Oral History Project, Chicago Artists Month, Graze Magazine, SLUTWALK Chicago, Northside Independent Artists, Quimby’s Bookstore, Chicago Public Library West Town Branch, Columbia College Library, Sequential Artists Workshop, and Learnapalooza.


We’ve welcomed readers from across the country, from Seattle to Philadelphia. Guest workshop leaders have come from Colorado, Wisconsin, and California. We’ve received mentions in industry publications Poets and Writers, HTML Giant, Newcity and Groupon.

We do this with an all volunteer staff. We've added the roles of Arts Coordinator, Comics Coordinator, and Literary Coordinator. All our workshop moderators are makers and doers from the community. This approach helps facilitate the sharing of skills and processes from those who are an authority on the subject.

Moving forward…
Entering into the center’s third year, we want to build on these successes. There are needs that we feel our patrons and the independent publishing community can benefit from, and we are dedicated to raising funds to meet those needs.

This boils down to service and materials.

Our goal is to provide equipment like a self-serve copy machine, a Risograph printer, accessible computer usage and additional supplies to expand our stock of DIY printmaking and bookbinding tools. For service, we want to open the scope of our low cost community classes. This would include expanding writing, art, graphic and web design programs for those looking to continue education.  

Membership

As part of this fundraiser, we are offering CHIPRC memberships. This allows access to the space and equipment during the center’s open hours, reduced costs on select workshops, and member’s only activities. You will be able to get your projects off the ground while supporting the space in which you work.

story:
We Need Art for the Taking

The world needs thoughtful, inspiring art and this art needs to be accessible to everyone. For the interesting is only interested in offering gorgeous "greeting cards" that celebrate profound meaning in small moments -- no less -- and needs your help to make them available.

The designs are digital interpretations of real photographs and wrap all the way around each card. Cards should never have a naked backside, as many famous historians have said.

 

 

What's the Money For?

Funding this endeavor is very straightforward, but we need your help to make these cards available to the world. $1,000 goes toward material sourcing, $1,800 to distribution, $1,200 pays for the initial printing and production costs, and $1,000 for building a robust e-commerce platform that benefits customers.

Commitment to the Interesting

This project is about helping people find profound meaning in small moments and celebrate them. For the Interesting Founder Kaston Griffin, in addition to running the company, will thoroughly document his varying quest for "the interesting" and the bumps along way.

Are you the right person for this?

The founder, Kaston Griffin, is a marketing professional in the financial industry, whose major strengths are project management, analytics and data interpretation, and corporate strategy.

Innovative projects such as this deserve and need focused integrated business strategies with coordinated actions aligned with clear guiding policies and correct diagnoses of challenges. The business plan extends 3 years from now, with built-in flexibility to nimbly respond to a changing marketplace.

The missing piece is the funding. $5,000 would push the product off the ground with enough power to fly, but if this campaign generates $10,000 or more, the propellers on this plane become jet engines. If you want to have access to art like this, tell your friends about this campaign.

More Designs

 

See all the designs in higher quality in For the Interesting's design gallery.

story: Bonjour, je me présente: mon nom est Eric Braün, je suis un artiste et galiériste situé à Montréal, au Québec. Je m'occupe de la galerie d'art autogérée USINE 106U qui, depuis bientot 10 ans, présente une expo collective mensuelle regroupant une trentaine d'artistes. Depuis 2 ans, j'ai démarré le projet 106U MAGAZINE, une revue d'art trimestrielle de 32 pages couleur, format 9" X 12" tirée à 3000 exemplaires et distribuée gratuitement. Le tirage est entièrement financé par les publicités, qui sont de plus en plus difficiles à trouver, c'est pourquoi je fais appel à votre aide, pour pouvoir continuer ce projet bénévole et passionné qui permet de promouvoir l'art qui sort des sentiers battus. Pour ce 10e numéro, le peintre-sculpteur visionnaire et fantastique Jean Pronovost est à l'honneur. Son art d'une qualité et d'une minutie exceptionnelle puise son inspiration dans la mythologie et le symbolisme, avec un souffle moderne unique. S'il vous plait, aidez-nous à atteindre notre objectif et faites circuler parmi vos amis qui aiment et veulent encourager l'art hors-normes.

story:
Our Goals.

Have you ever wondered, what is it like to die? Scarier yet, what happens after? Well, our cast and crew of ‘Damned in the Midst of Paradise’ want to answer those questions, and provide it to you in the most emotionally engaging and cinematic fashion possible. 

We have a story of family, love and hate which follows a protagonist who, after losing everything, attempts to spit in the face of The Creator, and sets off on a path of his own self-destruction. 

Our crew has the ambition and ability to create a short film that pushes the boundaries of what a ‘student film’ can achieve, however, as you can imagine making a short film isn’t easy and we could really use your help. 

How Can I Help? And What's In It For Me?

Our project is already raising quite the production value; as well as the traditional funds required such as paying for cast and crew, transport, locations, props etc. Our project’s narrative spans many years and features two huge set pieces that will require both attention to detail in terms of practical effect, sound and most importantly, health and safety. Some of what we hope to achieve such as make up and set pieces have a clear but fine line between tacky and believable. It would be your donations and support which would help us cross that line.

Every penny is appreciated, any donations big or small will be met with a thank you! You can donate any figure, so even if you can only spare  £1 that's entirely fine, just use the donation box to the right to enter any custom figure. However, to show our deep appreciation for your support, we’ve already offered various perks for those who donate specific figures. We hope you enjoy them, and yes, they are entirely optional. The perks are listed on this page, they include various methods of thanks, copies of the film and the chance to become a producer. There’s also the super embarrassing but hopefully worthwhile perk that will see our director, Conor, cover a Taylor Swift song of your choice. We doubt any of you will donate that much, but should you prove us wrong you will surely be rewarded! <3 – Points for improvisation...right?

Risks & Challenges

So if we have your curiosity so far, let us get your attention, - this is exactly where your money would be going should you choose to help us;
  • Set Pieces - We need to hire private land, build a fire, and ensure a safe working environment that allows our actors to interact with said fire. We have the land and the fire crew on stand by, it would be your money which makes it possible.
  • VHX, Practical Effects, - Our film will require a lot of extremely detailed practical effects which includes the burning of human skin, creating a demon, and successfully portraying what you see after your die. Your money will help us improve upon our practical effects but will also make the difference between our dying sequence being animated or (more ideally) practical. 
  • The Essentials - Essential in the true meaning of the word. Our film's sense of scope requires multiple actors, locations - methods of transport, accommodation, - your money will be used as salary and our means of procuring a wonderful set located in the Mourne Mountains. It will also allow for us to get our equipment and crew to this location.
  • Production Value - The more money we can raise, the better this allows us to make every frame and every scene as best as it can be; such as allowing us to hire different equipment for night shoots, and the implementation of an original score.

But Why? What Happens After? 

This is a project that we really believe in, and we'd like you you to believe in it too. It is the desire that after completion, this film can be entered into festivals and exhibits which we hope will have audience's asking questions on life and death. We really do hope to start a dialogue with our audience and we invite you to become a part of that dialogue with us.

I'd Love To Help, but...

Hey, we get it, it's not a problem. Other than donating there are other methods in which you can help - and they'd be just as appreciated! It's as simple as getting the word out about our project, telling your friends, family, work-collegues and fellow film lovers. IndieGoGo even has some super neat share tools to help you do so.

Lastly,

Thanks for taking the time to see what our project is all about. We really do want Damned in the Midst of Paradise to be the best film it can be, and your support will help us do that. If you place your confidence and well earned money in us, we'll be sure not to let you down. 
Thanks for your time, see you at the screening in May!
-Conor Kelly (Writer/Director)

story:
WELCOME EVERYONE!

Thank you for visiting my campaign! If you know me, you most likely know that I am a passionate makeup artist and I run my own makeup company, Honorine Makeup Studios. 

I have been in business doing freelance makeup for the past few years, and today I am proud to share with you my BEST NEWS OF THE YEAR: I have been selected as the winner of the KELLY GLEASON MAKEUP SCHOLARSHIP, hosted by THE POWDER GROUP, to study in the ADVANCED CINEMA MAKEUP PROGRAM at one of the best makeup artistry schools in the world: THE MAKEUP FOREVER ACADEMY in Paris! Founded by painter and sculptor Dany Sanz, The Academy has expanded internationally over the last 10+ years. Well-known for its strong focus on developing artistic skills and professional work ethic amongst its students, it is also recognized for its quality professional makeup line, its involvement with the yearly Parisian Fashion Week, and its recent sponsorship for SyFy's TV Series "Face-Off." 

During this rigorous, six-month program, I will:

-Study and perfect my makeup skills for 8 hours a day/5 days a week 

-Meet movie directors and key speakers, including internationally recognized makeup artist and TV Series judge Glenn Hetrick, from SyFy's show "Face-Off" 

-Build a new, stronger network that will guide me to the next phase in my career as a professional makeup artist 

-Complete a stunning, professional portfolio that I can add to my body of work  

-Learn a whole new set of skills, such as the art of wig-making, special effects sculpting/casting, and more! 

-Reach the skill level required on Face-Off so that I can compete myself one day

As you can see, this school will open hundreds of doors for me - it will truly be an honor to learn everything the cinema program has to offer me and create a brighter future for myself! Please visit this link to view more information about the program. 


WHY SHOULD YOU CONTRIBUTE TO MY CAMPAIGN?

Now that some of the amazing steam has blown off, I am realizing that this is going to be a bit of a financial burden for me. Here are the facts:

-Paris is an expensive city to live in

-My scholarship only covers the program tuition 

-I will not be legally allowed to work in Paris under my student visa

-I recently graduated college, and my student loan payments are due

-I have to purchase new health insurance

-I have mandatory monthly car loan/car insurance payments that I have to make while studying abroad

This is where I turn all my followers and supporters - you have been there for me before and I know you all want me to succeed, so I am giving you all a shout out - I need your support to be able to attend this program and jump-start my career! Below is a brief outline of definite expenses I will inquire along the way:

-Student Visa processing fees ($200)

-Roundtrip flight from Los Angeles to Paris ($2500)

-Health Insurance/Civil Insurance ($300-400)

-Materials/Supplies ($300-500)

-Rent/Utilities/Food ($900-$1,000/month) x6 months

Though I do not expect my fundraiser to pay for all of the above (let's be honest, it's a lot of money), it will definitely give me a strong push! I am hoping that the money I raise will fund my one-way flight to Paris, my health insurance plan, and my first three months of rent. 

IF YOU HELP SUPPORT MY CAMPAIGN, I WILL THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART THROUGH INDIEGOGO'S LOVELY PERK PROGRAM, AND I WILL ALWAYS REMEMBER YOU AS THE KIND SUPPORTER YOU ARE! PLEASE SHARE MY CAMPAIGN WITH ALL YOUR FRIENDS TO SHOW YOUR FURTHER SUPPORT AND THANK YOU FOR PUTTING FORTH THE EFFORT TO HELP ME SUCCEED!

Please visit this link to view my online portfolio and company website. Also, please let me know if you have any suggestions for people I can reach out to in Paris. I'd love to meet new people and make new friends while I'm there! Thank you!


BEST,

ONI

story:
Short Summary

Chicago Industrial Arts and Design Center (CIADC) is a multidisciplinary industrial arts facility featuring dedicated departments for: fabricated metalworking & forging, woodworking, casting, and integrated technology & design. CIADC aims to remove the common hurdles that prevent many people from constructing objects in permanent materials, and establish an incubator for creativity, innovation, industrial skill-based learning, problem-solving, and empowerment.

We will provide continuing education, working access, and community for 3D object makers working with materials and processes requiring industrial workspace and expensive shop equipment. Programming is designed to appeal to DIYers, craftspeople, makers, and artists of all skill levels and interests.

CIADC is a unique combination of the educational aspect typical of continuing education programs, with the accessibility of a makerspace. For those who prefer structure and guidance, we will offer a robust schedule of classes on a quarterly basis. If you’re comfortable with your craft and looking for access to equipment, our memberships allow just that.

Our programming will promote a cross-medium, cross-process, cross-department approach to making. Whether creating kinetic metal sculptures, tables of forged metal bases and wood tops, or 3D printed models cast in aluminum, there are endless opportunities for integration.

With shop class going by the wayside at most high schools, we are losing the know-how to work in these materials. Each department at CIADC offers a hands-on approach to designing, problem-solving, and gaining confidence, all transferable skill sets.

CIADC is located near the intersection of Devon and Ravenswood in Rogers Park. We have a 10,500 sq.ft. building, 3 stories of poured concrete with a freight elevator and plenty of windows for natural light. The building has a rich history as the Chicago Radio Laboratory, the precursor to Zenith Electric! Our facility is easily accessible by bike and public transit.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to open the metal fabrication facilities on April 6 and have the entire facility open with programming by May 11. Before we can open our doors, we need equipment!

Our goal is to raise $5,500 by April 9, which will purchase a TIG welder for the metal fabrication department and a table saw for the woodworking department. If we hit that goal, our next goal will be to raise an additional $5,500 to purchase a 3D printer for the technology department and a glass kiln for the casting department.

If we don’t reach our goals, funds raised will still be applied towards equipment costs. It just means it will take a bit longer to develop the full programming we envision for Chicagoland 3D makers. On the flipside, if we exceed both our goals, the additional funds will be put towards our operating budget allowing our facility to be open longer hours each day. That translates to more access for makers!

In exchange for your contribution, you will be able to experience CIADC! Haven’t you been thinking about building yourself a new bookshelf, but you’ve been too intimidated to try it? Or maybe you know how make stuff, but you just need access to space and equipment? Come on over and make things with us!

Not interested in partaking in our offerings? Your class or membership will be donated to an artist in need, to help bolster their skill set.

**All contributions over $25 include a ticket to our June gala! We'll email you information about the event as the date gets closer!**

CIADC is a 501c3 nonprofit organization, and all contributions are tax-deductible.

The Impact

The north side of Chicago lacks in resources for artists, while serving as home to over 4,000 self-identified working artists in the Rogers Park, Edgewater, and Uptown communities alone. Despite the density of artists and makers, there are no facilities that offer the breadth and scope of resources that CIADC will provide.

We’re seeing the rise of the makerspace and hackerspace model across the city and across the country. CIADC offers the shared space, tools, and community of a makerspace, with the structure of an arts education center to help get newbies started.

What really makes the CIADC unique is the ability to work cross-department, cross-material, and cross-process. Education and access to all these materials, all these processes, and all these tools under one roof! This integrated approach is not available to the general public elsewhere in Chicagoland. Fabricate a table with steel legs and a wooden top, no problem! 3D print a prototype in plastic and then cast in aluminum, sure! Cast a glass wall panel with digitally controlled LEDs as backlight, yes! Design and build a cargo bicycle, the CIADC can help facilitate that too! The Chicago Industrial Arts and Design Center will appeal to DIYers, craftspeople, artists, makers, entrepreneurs, and the curious alike.

Who We Are

Matthew Runfola - CIADC Founder; Fabricated Metalworking & Forging Department Manager

Matt owns a custom design/build furniture and sculpture business focusing on fabricated metalwork and unique patina finishes. He recently authored a book, “Patina: 300+ Coloration Effects for Jewelers & Metalsmiths” (Interweave, 2014). Matt has a mechanical engineering degree, but ultimate design and creative freedom led him to the arts. Matt formerly headed the Metal Sculpture program at the Evanston Art Center (Evanston, IL) for nearly 13 years, where he initiated many of the programming concepts he brings to the CIADC.

Stuart Marsh - Integrated Technology & Design Department Manager

Stuart works as an artist and craftsman. He is co-founder of Edgewater Workbench, a co-working and digital fabrication center on the north side of Chicago. He grew up in a family of artists, spending much of his youth learning trade skills, including painting, carpentry, metalwork, and glass-blowing. Stuart moved to Chicago to pursue a career in animation and enrolled at Columbia College Chicago. More recently, Stuart has delved into 3D printing. He served as a guest speaker in classes on the subject of design for 3D printing and its application to film at Columbia College and DePaul University. Stuart's plans for a community 3D print center won ABSOLUT vodka's "Transform Today" challenge.

Dominic Sansone - Casting Department Manager

Dominic is a native of Chicago and holds a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of Illinois Urbana Champaign and a Master of Fine Arts from the Herron School of Art and Design in Indianapolis, both in sculpture. Between degrees he spent two years working for an aerospace company producing fabrication and assembly drawings for satellites, military aircraft, and mobile artillery units and over a decade in the tradeshow industry where he oversaw worldwide exhibition programs for major multinational corporations. Dominic exhibits in group and solo exhibitions across the United States and is represented by Baang + Burne in New York City, Minan Gallery in Los Angeles, and Fulton Market Gallery in Chicago. He currently works and lives in St. Charles Illinois with his wife and two sons.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share on social media, tell your friends and co-workers about this wonderful new facility!

Volunteer your time! We have no shortage of need for helping hands. Email darlys@ciadc.org and let us know how you’d like to help and we’ll get back to you soon.

story:
Hello! My name is Maia Duerr and I am sponsoring this campaign on behalf of my dear friend Katya (Kathy) Lesher. 

Every once in a while, if you’re lucky, you meet a person who touches your life in a very deep and authentic way… a person whose great heart and soulful spark helps you to see and feel yourself in a bigger way, and to heal, as well. Katya has been such a person in my life. I know she has touched many others in that way too.

February 1 is Katya's 52nd birthday. This campaign gives us a chance to honor her for a life well lived, a life devoted in service to the healing journeys of many people and to creating art that nourishes our hearts and feed our souls.

As a working artist, Katya is in a transitional place in her own life right now. Our support will help her to move into the next phase in a way that will benefit many people.

The following words are Katya's, as she describes her journey, her vision, and her wish for this birthday.

_______________________


Katya's Life Journey

I have always loved making art. It is an inner experience, a form of meditation. 

When I am making art, I am in a place of not knowing – I begin, and see what unfolds. This is similar to how I live my life – not knowing and being open to the unfolding. Making art is healing – it opens me up, fills me up….it nourishes me. It helps remind me to notice how things are in this moment. I want to walk through this world with my heart open, fully awake, fully alive. Making art helps me remember this.

After working as a hospice social worker for 8 years, I felt depleted and I yearned for time and energy to reconnect with my art. A year and a half ago, I resigned from my position as hospice social worker, moved to New Mexico, and took some time for healing and replenishing. 

After a great deal of inner work and caring for myself, I am now in a place to move outward and continue integrating my passions of making art, guiding others with art as healing, and honoring the journeys of end-of-life and grieving time. 

As I discover more clarity about my life’s purpose, I recognize there is not a path already laid out for me but rather I discover it as I go. And I would love your support on this journey!


Katya’s Vision

I am honored to help others discover a path of healing and transformation through creative expression and contemplative practice. I am passionate about opening hearts and minds in relationship to the dying time and the importance of honoring this most sacred time, as well as honoring the grieving time when a loved one dies.

Throughout my life I have had numerous opportunities to facilitate creative expression retreats for children who experienced the death of a loved one, as well as parents who experienced the death of a child. I witnessed art as healing while I watched these children and parents weave together the loss, sadness, memories, and gifts they received from the death of their loved ones, and begin to move towards a place of wholeness.

Many years ago I volunteered with a non-profit organization for at-risk youth, and witnessed the transformational power of creative expression. I was inspired by their courage as they shared laughter and tears and their stories via writing, drawing, photography and the spoken word. It was clear to me that through creative expression, these young people were discovering parts of themselves they had not met before.

We are all discovering our paths, we all have unique gifts to offer, and none of us can do any of this alone… I am overflowing with ideas of what I want to offer!

Currently I am working on several projects and, with your support, I can bring these ideas into reality:

• A series of note cards featuring my photos and haikus for those who are nearing end of life… to wish someone well on their journey to the next realm; as well as note cards for care givers and for those who are in their grieving time.

We gift cards to people for all kinds of transitions – new baby, birthday, graduation, wedding…and we send sympathy cards after a person dies. But so often we have no vehicle to express our true feelings when someone we love is in the process of dying. There is a gap here and these note cards are meant to help fill that gap. 

The rite of passage at end-of-life is one of the most important times in a person’s life – a part of a beautiful cycle we all share in common. Yet we don’t typically acknowledge or celebrate with them – we have difficulty honoring this very sacred time in a loved one’s life. My hope is to help others to move towards awareness and acceptance of the fact that we all die and that along with sadness and the missing, it is a time of celebration as well as a letting go. These note cards will provide the opportunity to celebrate someone’s life and death, to let them know how much they are loved, and to wish them a peaceful journey.

• Programs/retreats that will support people on their healing journeys with creative expression. I have already offered a one-day version of this healing journey called “Roots and Wings” at my studio in Santa Fe. I want to take time to develop more programs and retreats like this and reach out to communities that will benefit from them. 

• Honoring the artist within. It is clear to me that I thrive when I make art and that a huge part of me fades when I don’t. I am better able to support others when I am able to spend time creating.

Katya's Birthday Wish

In the end, though, maybe we must all give up
trying to pay back all the people in this world who sustain our lives.
In the end, it is wiser to surrender before the miraculous scope
of human generosity, and to just keep saying thank you, forever,
and sincerely, for as long as we have voices.

~ Elizabeth Gilbert

My work is a labor of love. Your support will give me the 'gift of time' as I continue to find creative ways to do the work I am called to do, along with generating an income so that I am able to take care of my living expenses. 

All gifts received are deeply appreciated, and I will keep saying thank you, forever…

____________________

Giving and Receiving

Our goal is to raise $3700 through this campaign, which will run for 45 days starting on Katya's birthday. Your gift will help Katya in the following ways:

· $1500 – Equipment: This amount will enable Katya to purchase a new computer and a good photo editing program so that she can continue to create these note cards. (Her current computer is a dinosaur and she's not sure how much longer it will hold up!)

· $1600  – Studio space: This will cover four months of studio rent while Katya continues to establish reliable sources of income. Katya has a studio in Santa Fe where she creates her art as well as hosts "Roots and Wings" workshops to support others in their inner explorations and healing journeys. 

· $600 – Professional Support: This amount will make it possible for Katya to consult with a business coach who has experience in the art world and can help her find the appropriate business model so she can financially sustain herself; and possibly also with an attorney regarding copyright/trademark support.

When you give a gift, you'll receive a thank-you gift created by Katya….

· $25 – a thank-you card

· Gift of $100 and more – a set of Pausing Turtle note cards (one of them is pictured below)

· Gift of $500 and more – a Prayer Box 

· Gift of $1000 and more – a personal "Roots and Wings" day with Katya in her Santa Fe studio


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you're not able to contribute at this time, you can still help out by sharing this campaign with others through email, Facebook, and other social media sites.
  • If you have connections with a publisher or organization that would be interested in marketing the note cards, this would be a huge support so that Katya can focus on the creative part. Get in touch with Katya through the link at the bottom of this page.
story_txt:
Hello! My name is Maia Duerr and I am sponsoring this campaign on
behalf of my dear friend Katya (Kathy) Lesher. 
Every once in a while, if you’re lucky, you meet a person who
touches your life in a very deep and authentic way… a person whose great heart
and soulful spark helps you to see and feel yourself in a bigger way, and to heal, as well. Katya has
been such a person in my life. I know she has touched many others in that
way too.
February 1 is Katya's 52nd birthday. This campaign gives us a
chance to honor her for a life well lived, a life devoted in service to the
healing journeys of many people and to creating art that nourishes our hearts
and feed our souls.
As a working artist, Katya is in a transitional place in her own
life right now. Our support will help her to move into the next phase in a way
that will benefit many people.
The following words are Katya's, as she describes her journey,
her vision, and her wish for this birthday._______________________
Katya's Life Journey 
I have always loved making art. It is an inner experience, a
form of meditation. When I am making art, I am in a place of not knowing – I begin,
and see what unfolds. This is similar to how I live my life – not knowing and
being open to the unfolding. Making art is healing – it opens me up, fills me
up….it nourishes me. It helps remind me to notice how things are in this
moment. I want to walk through this world with my heart open, fully
awake, fully alive. Making art helps me remember this.
After working as a hospice social worker for 8 years, I felt
depleted and I yearned for time and energy to reconnect with my art. A year and
a half ago, I resigned from my position as hospice social worker, moved to New
Mexico, and took some time for healing and replenishing. 
After a great deal of inner work and caring for myself, I am now
in a place to move outward and continue integrating my passions of making art,
guiding others with art as healing, and honoring the journeys of end-of-life
and grieving time. 
As I discover more clarity about my life’s purpose, I recognize
there is not a path already laid out for me but rather I discover it as I go. And
I would love your support on this journey!
Katya’s Vision
I am honored to help others discover a path of healing and
transformation through creative expression and contemplative practice. I am passionate
about opening hearts and minds in relationship to the dying time and the
importance of honoring this most sacred time, as well as honoring the grieving
time when a loved one dies.
Throughout my life I have had numerous opportunities to facilitate
creative expression retreats for children who experienced the death of a loved
one, as well as parents who experienced the death of a child. I witnessed art
as healing while I watched these children and parents weave together the loss,
sadness, memories, and gifts they received from the death of their loved ones,
and begin to move towards a place of wholeness.
Many years ago I volunteered with a non-profit organization for
at-risk youth, and witnessed the transformational power of creative expression.
I was inspired by their courage as they shared laughter and tears and their
stories via writing, drawing, photography and the spoken word. It was clear to
me that through creative expression, these young people were discovering parts
of themselves they had not met before.
We are all discovering our paths, we all have unique gifts to
offer, and none of us can do any of this alone… I am overflowing with ideas of
what I want to offer!
Currently I am working on several projects and, with your
support, I can bring these ideas into reality:
• A series of note cards featuring my
photos and haikus for those who are nearing end of life… to wish someone
well on their journey to the next realm; as well as note cards for care givers
and for those who are in their grieving time.

We gift cards to people for all kinds of transitions – new baby, birthday,
graduation, wedding…and we send sympathy cards after a person dies. But so
often we have no vehicle to express our true feelings when someone we love is
in the process of dying. There is a gap here and these note cards are meant to help
fill that gap. 

The rite of passage at end-of-life is one of the most important times in a
person’s life – a part of a beautiful cycle we all share in common. Yet we
don’t typically acknowledge or celebrate with them – we have difficulty
honoring this very sacred time in a loved one’s life. My hope is to help others
to move towards awareness and acceptance of the fact that we all die and that
along with sadness and the missing, it is a time of celebration as well as a
letting go. These note cards will provide the opportunity to celebrate
someone’s life and death, to let them know how much they are loved, and to wish
them a peaceful journey.
• Programs/retreats that will support people on their healing
journeys with creative expression. I have already offered a one-day version
of this healing journey called “Roots and Wings” at my studio in Santa Fe. I
want to take time to develop more programs and retreats like this and reach out
to communities that will benefit from them.  
• Honoring the artist within. It is clear
to me that I thrive when I make art and that a huge part of me fades when I
don’t. I am better able to support others when I am able to spend time
creating.
Katya's Birthday Wish
In the end, though, maybe we must all give up 
trying to pay back all the people in this world who sustain our lives. 
In the end, it is wiser to surrender before the miraculous scope 
of human generosity, and to just keep saying thank you, forever, 
and sincerely, for as long as we have voices. 
~ Elizabeth Gilbert
My work is a labor of love. Your support will give me the
'gift of time' as I continue to find creative ways to do the work I am called
to do, along with generating an income so that I am able to take care of my
living expenses. 
All gifts received are deeply appreciated, and I will keep
saying thank you, forever…____________________

for 45 days starting on Katya's birthday. Your gift will help Katya in the
following ways:
· $1500 – Equipment: This amount will
enable Katya to purchase a new computer and a good photo editing program so
that she can continue to create these note cards. (Her current computer is a
dinosaur and she's not sure how much longer it will hold up!)
· $1600  – Studio space: This will cover
four months of studio rent while Katya continues to establish reliable sources
of income. Katya has a studio in Santa Fe where she creates her art as well as

· $600 – Professional Support: This amount will
make it possible for Katya to consult with a business coach who has experience

· Gift of $500 and more – a Prayer Box · Gift of $1000 and more – a personal "Roots and Wings" day with Katya in her Santa Fe studio

If you're not able to contribute at this time, you can still

If you have connections with a publisher or organization that

story:
What is Scrap?

Scrap is a student-organized art magazine that aims to provide Bard High School Early College students with an outlet for their visual and conceptual creativity through our printed gallery of teen artwork. Our goal is to represent a diverse range of artistic talents and mediums by compiling selected submitted pieces and publishing them in a deliberate and harmonious way. Scrap Art Magazine is an organization that is conscious and supportive of student talent and hopes to motivate teenagers to continue to express themselves creatively. We hope to be a publication that not only inspires our student following, but the the public as well.

How are we going to achieve this?

We intend to print as many copies of our magazine as our funds will allow. To give you a rough idea of how many copies we need, 100 copies are $450, 200 copies are $840 and 300 copies are $1,200. We hope to print up to 300 copies, and begin to gather a base of submitting student artists at high schools all across the city by sending student representatives and sample copies to other schools.

Complete Budget Breakdown:

$1500 - indiegogo fees ($105) = $1,395

$1,395 - printing fees ($1,200) = $195

$195 - price of paper ($40) = $155

The excess $155 will be used either towards some sort of Scrap-related event (a gallery-type event, perhaps?), or towards printing even MORE copies. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.  If you can't donate, for whatever reason, forward the page to others! You can also send us an email or leave comments on our website, whether they're comments of encouragment or disgust, we appreciate your interest.

Ditlev fandt René Dif på Roskilde Festival 2014. Ditlev tog en selfie med Diffen. Nu vil vi gerne have et banner med Ditlev og Diffen på Farma, da vi mener det ville pynte gevaldigt!

Vi regner med at banneret kommer til at se cirka således ud, designtips modtages gerne!

Dimensioner 240x80cm.

http://i.imgur.com/7GvEDf7.jpg


Vi skal bruge ca. 130 dollars pr. banner, målet er 4 bannere.

story:
Nature-based Arts Residency

Hi! We're Richard Merrill and Susan Barrett Merrill, an artist couple from the tiny town of Brooksville in Downeast Maine (where the seasons are "winter and six weeks of hard sleddin'"). We've been selected for a six-week art residency this winter at the Conservation Foundation of the Gulf Coast in Osprey, Florida, south of Tampa. We will share our interest in and focus on the wildlife of the mid-Florida Gulf Coast landscape, our recognition that we are part of that landscape, and our commitment to living in harmony with it. The effects will reach far beyond Florida, supporting the creation of new work in the arts of puppetry and masks.

Here is what it means to the Foundation (we added emphasis):

"Access to natural spaces is critical to ensuring that creative people of our time and those in the future remain connected to the environment. The Artist in Residence program of Conservation Foundation of the Gulf Coast makes that connection possible. Artists selected for the program are given extraordinary access to our bays, beaches and barrier islands. Our hope is that their work will enhance appreciation for our coastal environment and broaden interest in the arts and conservation."

Who we are

Richard: I'm a puppeteer and a member of Puppeteers of America. I recently won an arts visibility grant from the Maine Arts Commission to create an innovative wheelchair-based puppet theater which I use to perform with my shadow puppets, because an injury prevents me from standing or squatting for very long. The grant helped me revive my puppetry, which I dearly love and am excited to share.


Above is a video demonstrating the mobility of Richard's wheelchair- based puppet theater, funded in part by an Arts Visibility grant from the Maine Arts Commission.

My puppets have been exhibited in museums and galleries, and I have presented at Sharing the Fire, the national storytelling conference.

My great grandmother was Haudenosaunee (Iroquois), and I am working on a play for shadow puppets of the Haudenosaunee story "How the Birds Got Their Songs." Above, the Creator's feet are walking through the world. Below are two views of the hero of the story, Chih'neh the Hermit Thrush. The designs are traditional Haudenosaunee motifs. I cut them from 6-ply Bristol board with knives and wood chisels, or use knives to cut them from aluminum sheet. They are articulated for graceful and beautiful movement.

In Florida, I will teach a shadow puppet-making class based on the Seminole story of creation of the animals, and a class on the making of bird kites based on local Gulf Coast species.


You can also see some of my puppets from another Native American story, The Legend of Jumping Mouse, at my puppet website. These and others were exhibited for four months at the Farnsworth Art Museum in Rockland, Maine.

Susan: I weave three-dimensional masks from wool I help shear on an island off the Maine coast. I spin it, dye it with plants from my garden and my local area, so the essence of the plant life is imbued in the masks. The method for weaving them came to me in a dream, and to me the characters speak for the Earth. The masks you see above contain wool dyed with goldenrod, Japanese indigo from my garden, and the roots of the madder plant, which I grow in my garden. The faces are felted onto headdresses, and embellished with small people, designs, and decorative details.

Here I am shaping a mask face after taking it off the loom. The photo is by Paola Gianturco.

My masks are in private collections, have seen exhibition and performance in Sarajevo and Tblisi, Georgia, and have been in galleries in the US and abroad. Two masks are in the permanent collection of the City of Chieri, Italy, an ancient weaving city where blue denim originated. Visit my mask web site

I will be creating new work incorporating natural materials from the Florida landscape, teach weaving and primitive methods of spinning, and help local residents and visitors create community weavings on a large free-standing EarthLoom - a loom I originated. 


Above is a community EarthLoom at a school in Maine. Children are lined up to weave in colorful materials, grasses, and their wishes for a better world written on ribbons of birch bark. My husband Richard and I are the founders of the EarthLoom Foundation, which supports the creation of EarthLooms everywhere, and training on how to make EarthLoom projects most effective for your community.

We would LOVE your help!

The Conservation Foundation of the Gulf Coast is providing living and working space and a beautiful gallery to exhibit our work, plus a small honorarium. We are confident we and the Osprey community will have a huge impact on each other. Still, we need to pay our bills during the time we're working, and get ourselves, our theater and our materials to the Foundation. We are saving up for the trip, but will need an additional $3,500 to pay bills at home, travel expenses, and materials.

Give and ye shall recieve

Besides the great feeling of helping support art and nature, all contributors will receive a link to a donors-only private blog of our experience and our work at the Conservation Foundation, and AND we will mention all of you in our presentations. Plus, when we begin our residency, we'll list you on our websites, weavingalife.com and shadowpuppetstories.com!

For $50 or more, you will also receive a free audio mp3 of Susan reading her book ZATI the Art of Weaving a Life.

Each $100 or greater contribution earns the book as a 144-page full color ebook.

$250 or more: you will receive a one of Richard's delightful bird puppets (signed!), that flaps its wings, and both of the downloads above.

$500: these awesome folks will receive a bird puppet, both free downloads, plus a DVD about Susan's masks, AND a signed copy of Susan's book. In addition, once it is produced, we will send you a signed limited-edition home-produced DVD video of Richard's shadow puppet play of How The Birds Got Their Songs.

This project benefits our work and the community

The production of How The Birds Got Their Songs is going to be exquisitely beautiful, bringing an inspiring Native American story to wider audiences. Susan will take her work in a new direction with the incorporation of natural materials from the surrounding landscape, and we are excited to introduce community weaving to the Gulf Coast area. Our classes will provide children and adults with new skills and projects that can inspire them and give them confidence in their own abilities. Richard's performances of shadow puppet plays will introduce funny stories with a spiritual core, as well as the wheelchair puppet theater. Richard will work to connect with organizations that support people with physical and cognitive challenges, to introduce the possibilities of the wheelchair puppet theater.

What if I can't contribute?

You can still help! Share this campaign with your social media, email your friends, bring it up at family dinners, at the office, with your base jumping buddies, and anyone else you can think of.
