Koji su to svjetovi moći ćete saznati isključivo u muzeju.  Sadržaj muzeja odijeljen je tematskim cjelinama  prema  pričama i eksponatima : ljubav & tragedija ozdravljenje & ostvarenje sna  pustolovine & businessnevjerojatnih događaja & humoraostale prostorije će za sada ostati u tajnosti. Izložbe stvaranja na licu mjestaDio u  muzeju gdje će svoje mjesto pronaći radionice i izložbe u kojima mogu sudjelovati svi koji to požele.       Kroz radionice i izložbe moći ćete naučiti puno toga o životu i stvaranju. Radionice su interaktivne i nadahnute potrebama današnjeg svijeta. Osmišljene su  kako bi vam omogućile neka nova saznanja i pružile uvid u stvaranje do sada ne dostupnog ...           Radionica i izložba djetinjstva gdje predstavljamo igranje igračkama naših starih.Radionica i izložba izgradnje u kojoj je osmišljeno raditi na gradilištu. Naučit ćemo vas kako  se  zida i pokazat ćemo vam  kakav je to osjećaj držati zidarski alat u rukama, biti majstor, raditi oplatu, žbukati  i još puno, puno toga...Kakav je to osjećaj izgraditi svoje glazbalo ... svoju gitaru ... Do sada je osmišljeno ukupno 9 radionica i izložbi koje će se periodično predstavljati u muzeju, a svojim izazovima uvesti posjetitelja u Nezaboravnu pustolovinu. Muzej će okupljati i samostalne izložbeumjetnika kao i izložbe stvaranjau sadašnjem trenutku.         U trenutku izložbe moći ćete vidjeti stvaraoce kako rade, kako vare, pile, bruse, oblikuju ...   Moći ćete im se i pridružiti, ali i stvarati svoje djelo zajedno s njima ukoliko se nađete potaknuti i inspirirani kreativnošću.        Koncept muzeja je stvoren podjednako za sve, za umjetnike  kao i za nove stvaraoce svih profila. Stvaramo umjetničku oazu na čijem će  mjestu biti prezentirati umjetnici i njihovo izuzetno stvaranje, ali i neki novi budući umjetnici-stvaraoci koji do sada nisu imali prilike pokazati svoje umijeće.Stvaramo mjesto za sve ... Imamo posebno veliku prostoriju koja je namijenjena samo za njih.      Sva potrebna oprema i materijal za stvaranje donirana su sredstvima muzeja.Svoje radove će na kraju svi izložiti na otvorenoj izložbi, čijom će se naplatom omogućiti da se sredstva podijele svim sudionicima podjednako prema uloženom vremenu stvaranja.  O NAMAMi smo kreativna grupa umjetnika, entuzijasta i  poslovnih ljudi s višegodišnjim iskustvom koji smo pokrenuli  stvaranje  Nezaboravnog Mjesta... Muzeja Nezaboravnih Trenutaka.   Već godinu i pol smo svi zajedno uključeni u stvaranje projekta, jedinstvenog mjesta u Zagrebu u kojem želimo napraviti prostor svih naših kreativnih i znalačkih sposobnosti za dobrobit ljudi oko nas.Muzej Nezaboravnih Trenutaka je mjesto altruizma i susreta kroz priče i eksponate koji nam donose uvid u shvaćanje ljudi oko nas. Htjeli smo približiti svjetove, koji su do sada bili jako udaljeni jedni od drugih. Svjetove Nevjerojatnih i Posebnih priča ... koje nose poruku ... Ovo je muzej s Porukom ...Naša zaljubljenost u koncept je toliko velika da niti jednom nismo odustali od stvaranja svih novih koraka koji nas već polako vode prema realizaciji muzeja. Ovdje smo svi jedni za druge, usmjereni svatko prema svojim vrlinama i sposobnostima,Mi smo#UNFORGETTABLE TEAM Matija - #unforgettable čuvar zlata Matija ima snažno iskustvo u korporativnom bankarstvu, upravljanju rizicima i korporativnoj financijskoj analizi. Stekao je zvanje magistra računovodstva i financija na Veleučilištu VERN '.Marta  - #unforgettable savjetnica za umjetnost   Svojim umjetničkim  stilom i točno određenim stavom oko onoga što želi i kako želi postaviti stvaranje sa svrhom i na određeno mjesto, s lakoćom ostvaruje potpunost u realizaciji u konkretiziranju ideje muzeja...Koraljka - #unforgettable svjetlo malih i velikih trenutakaOtvaračica srca i horizonata, Slušačica i sakupljačica priča, Žaruljica novih ideja i spoznaja, Val podrške, Prepoznavanje "Onog nečeg .. . " i Uživalica u ljepotama bića i malih i velikih trenutaka koji čine život tako čudesnim i posebnim.Tomislav  -  #unforgettable sanjar i osvajač novih dimenzija  Prištekan na nepresušan Izvor raznolikih ideja, koje je djelom, vulkanskom upornošću i srčanim entuzijazmom, i ostvarivao kroz život .. .  Uveseljavajući, obogačujući  i šireći granice mašte, daje svemir kroz sebe do zadnje stanice ... . Jedan život i jedno njegovo tijelo su mu često premali i preuski .. .Andrej  - #unforgettable stvaralac novcaSvojom inženjerskom preciznošću i šahovskom  smjelošču FIDE instruktora svakim danom donosi novi vjetar snažnim ulagačkim sposobnostima nezaboravnog financijskog pokretača. Andrej je osovina cjelokupne snage svojim neprikosnovenim šarmom i vedrinom. Bella  - #unforgettable životna trenerica i psihologinja  Odlučila je postati životna trenerica i psihologinja. S preko četiri godine radnog iskustva, oslobodila je od stresa preko 100 ljudi.Sonja  – #unforgettable menadžerica odnosa s javnošćuSonja ima dugogodišnje iskustvo u vođenju projekata, organizaciji događanja i upravljanju ljudskim resursima – od javnog do nevladinog sektora.Denis - #unforgettable liderIznimno progresivnog raspona, oboružan dijalektičkom moći, nadrasta titule, discipline i akademski poredak. Izdašan i originalan mislilac, stanovite moralne hrabrosti. 
    Muzej Nezaboravnih Trenutaka 
je naše životno djelo ... osmišljeno kako bi trajalo zauvijek ... kako bi živjelo ... raslo i odrastalo...  Koncept muzeja je stvoren u čast ljepote življenja ...Osjetimo to kroz ovaj muzej ... Izgradimo sebe kroz ovaj muzej. Ovo je MuzejNezaboravnih Trenutaka... jedinstveno mjesto na svijetu ...  ... muzej sa stavomKroz ovaj muzej željet ćete zapisati i svoje nezaboravne trenutke, željet ćete ih pokloniti nekome, iščitavati ... svojim najmilijima ... prijateljima ... obitelji ... ostaviti im uspomenu na mnogo toga nezaboravnog iz vašeg života i pružiti im poruku vašeg života.Takvih i sličnih trenutaka je mnogo oko nas, ima ih, a mi ih ne poznajemo. Ne znamo gdje su skriveni i u kojim životnim pričama te je zato i krenulo stvaranje jedinstvenog muzeja, Muzeja  Nezaboravnih Trenutka gdje ćemo moći jedni drugima prepričati svoje nevjerojatne priče.Ova neispisana bilježnica dar je muzeja Nezaboravnih Trenutaka u zahvalu za donaciju kojom se muzej izgradio. Svojim darom zauvijek ste upisani u nezaboravni trenutak ostvarenja jednog sna . Hvala Vam Svi zajednogradimoMuzej Nezaboravnih Trenutaka   Hvala Svima !

story:
FOR THE 2021 FUNDRAISER, CLICK HERE:

https://igg.me/at/csawgrants

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

CSAW MICROGRANTS FOR U.S. CIRCUS ARTISTS OF COLOR

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Help us raise $15,000 to create twelve microgrants for U.S. circus artists of color! One grant will be awarded in the amount of $1,000 each month for a year. 

CSAW - Connecting Circus Students Around the World is committed to taking action against racism in the circus community. We are raising these funds to actively support representation and equality for the future of circus. Visit https://www.csawcircus.org/ for more info on CSAW. 

Grantees will be chosen through an application process and reviewed by a selection committee composed entirely of circus artists of color. These grants will be available for circus artists of color to pay for circus education (private lessons, tuition fees, audition expenses, etc) or other circus pursuits - shows, videos, any project that has an immediate need for funding and meets the application criteria. We're hoping to provide one grant each month September 2020 - August 2021! 

Why Donate? 

  • Help rebuild circus with resources for representation
  • Pave the way for future funding opportunities for circus artists
  • Support current and future circus artists of color in our community 
  • Help provide relief in the recovery from COVID-19 

All donations will go toward the following expenses: 

  • $12,000 toward the microgrants
  • $3,000 toward paying the selection committee, advertising fees and administrative fees 

 

About the promotional video: 

CSAW wants to thank the amazing circus artists who volunteered their time and support to be featured in the promotional video for this campaign. Here is more about these artists (in order of appearance) : 

  • - Susan Voyticky: http://www.voyticky.com/professional/about_en.html​
    • Video courtesy of The Uncle Junior Project https://www.unclejrproject.com/
  • Sidney 'Iking' Bateman : https://www.midnightcircus.net/news/featured-performer-sidney-iking-bateman​
    • Featured clip is from his hoop act at École Nationale de Cirque
  • Noeli Acoba: https://www.noeliacoba.com/
    • YouTube Channel : https://www.youtube.com/noeliacoba
    • Noeli's featured rope act was performed at “Sans Filet” at la TOHU. "This act is dedicated to every person who has ever had a big dream and felt like they could not achieve it. This act is a response to those who told me my skin was too dark, my body type is not right, and that I would never become a circus performer. " Noeli would like to acknowledge these people who helped her: Coaches: Irena Purschke & Eric Newton Artistic Advisor: Veronica Melis Videographer: Luc Tremblay Costume: MC Larivière -
  • Paris The Hip Hop Juggler: https://www.hiphopjuggler.com/
    • Video courtesy of The Uncle Junior Project https://www.unclejrproject.com/
  • Joseph Pinzon: http://www.shortroundproductions.com/
  • Special thanks to The Uncle Junior Project and Kevin Flanagan for support in making this video.

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

More Info: 

CSAW recognizes that funding and access to money is not the only barrier for circus artists of color and that there is so much more work to be done to fight systemic racism in the circus community and the United States at large. CSAW is working with existing non-profits to create an infrastructure that would allow for long-term donors and more significant funding opportunities to be created. We are also continuing conversations and learning to find where the NEED for funding truly lies in the circus. Receiving applications for these grants may help us identify which area of circus is most in need of support. For any feedback, inquiries, or other information contact csawcircus@gmail.com or visit https://www.csawcircus.org/.

CSAW was founded in 2018 by Sierra Rhoades Nicholls in an effort to make information about international circus schools more accessible for future applicants, current students and alumni. With the assistance of Kevin Flanagan and others in the circus community, CSAW is expanding its mission to provide financial aid for circus artists. “CSAW Microgrants for US Circus Artists of Color” is the first fundraiser in service of this mission. 

Sierra and Kevin are both white. They recognize the potential for this fundraiser to look like white saviorism. This is not their intention and they are trying to ensure that in the campaign and fundraising, they do not center themselves. CSAW is endeavoring to amplify the voices of as many US circus artists of color as possible without tokenizing them. All featured circus artists have given their permission for the use of their work.

CSAW would also like to recognize that in spite of their best efforts, these or similar harmful practices, might happen anyway. In the fight for social justice, mistakes will inevitably be made. If you'd like to call us out, if you have any concerns or any questions, please don't hesitate to contact CSAW in the following ways: 

  • Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/csawcircus/
  • Instagram : https://www.instagram.com/csaw_circus/
  • Email : csawcircus@gmail.com
  • Website : https://www.csawcircus.org/
  • Twitter : https://twitter.com/CsawThe
  • YouTube Channel : https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIDfUsWIjzZb9ExJ-E3a5EQ

Because CSAW is awaiting non-profit status, your donation will not be tax-deductible. Thank you for your understanding.

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/csawcircus/

Website : https://www.csawcircus.org/

story:
Hello Friends! Thanks for checking out my campaign! I'm Shiva - a writer, artist, organizer, and Satanist. This year, I released my first book - The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual. I was overwhelmed and encouraged by the support it received and the explosion of interest around ritual practice. Its success has inspired me to create a companion piece to the book that can help users tune into their inner knowledge and power - The Devil's Deck.

Tarot and oracle decks have played an important part in my Satanic journey. They were a gateway to the occult for me and played a huge part in my personal liberation. Of all my ritual tools my decks are probably employed the most - they have an uncanny way of bringing to surface desires and inner-knowledge we often ignore.

My love of the cards inspired me to create The Devil's Deck - the first deck of its kind. The Devil's Deck is a 30 card ritual deck that is a companion to my book The Devil's Tome and is illustrated by Satanic Temple co-founder Lucien Greaves, The Devil's Tome illustrator Lex Corey, and myself.

 

 

The Devil's Deck is a tool that can be used to sharpen inner knowledge, aid in healing, and deepen personal power. This printing is limited to 666 hand-numbered and signed copies. I designed the deck to serve as a ritual tool and sacred art piece.

 

The Devil's Deck, like The Devil's Tome, will be gilded. The deck, booklet, and card box will all be a heavy matte print illuminated with gold foil.

The Sight sigil - the symbol from The Devil's Tome that represents vision and insight - will be applied with gold foil on the back of each card in the deck and each card will have gilded edges. The 30 cards will come in a heavy two-piece matte black and gold-foiled box and be accompanied by a matte black softcover guide book with gold foiling. This accompanying booklet will be over 30 pages and discuss the reflections for each card and its associated ritual, act of empowerment, or introspection.

Stretch Goal 1 - Unlocked!

We hit $20,000 - now all decks will have gilded card edges!

 

 

 

The Devil's Deck Companions

I've created special items to accompany the deck and put together a number of enchanting packages to support the project. All Visions level pledges and above will include an altar cloth, ritual deck bag, and handmade incense made specially for The Devil's Deck

The Altar Cloth

The Devil's Deck altar cloth can be a lovely addition to your practice. The altar cloth is 21x21 inches and will be printed with metallic gold ink. It's decorated with The Sight sigil, representing your inner guidance and vision.

The Deck Bag

The Devil's Deck Ritual Bag is designed to transport your deck and other ritual tools easily. The bag is 6 x8 inches, gilded with The Sight sigil and will be printed with metallic gold ink.

Ritual Incense

Over the last year I've created a collection of handmade ritual incense for my site Serpentīnae. I'll create an new incense for use with The Devil's Deck. All Visions Packages and above will include a bag of 20 incense.

The Devil's Tome Gilded Paperback

The Devil's Deck is the companion to The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual.   Although the deck can be used without the text,  the two are truly meant for each other. You can add on a gilded paperback version of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual signed by me to any order for $30 (that's a discount from retail price!)

You can also get The Devil's Deck paperback signed by Lucien Greaves, Alexander Corey, and myself in the Signed Gilded Paperback Package. Those are limited to a numbered Edition of 20.

The Leather Hardcover version signed by Lucien Greaves, Alexander Corey, and myself is limited to a numbered edition of 23 and is available in the Signed Gilded Leather Package and Baphomet Package.

The Devil's Tome + Devil's Deck Prints

I've put together packages that feature illustrations from Lucien Greaves and Alexander Corey. Each 8x10 print edition is limited to an edition of 30 and is signed and numbered by the artist. The prints are available in the Print packages, The 666 Packages, and The Baphomet Package.

Additionally, The Baphomet Package contains an original piece of artwork from Alexander Corey.

 

 

Use the deck to bring Satanic insight, personal empowerment, and facilitate healing.

Pull a card to find your message and embark on a powerful Satanic journey

Each card represents a different Satanic ritual, lesson, act of introspection, or empowerment. Every card presents an evocative image for contemplation. The Deck's accompanying booklet provides a narrative and questions for each card as you continue on your inner journey.

The deck is composed of 17 Ceremony cards and 13 Illumination cards. Ceremony cards contain a sigil or illustration The Devil's Tome. When chosen, you can engage in the recommended reflection from the accompanying booklet or the entire ritual from The Devil's Tome. The Illumination Cards contain new illustrations from Alexander Corey, Lucien Greaves, and myself. When chosen, perform the recommended reflections or actions of empowerment in the booklet accompanying The Devil's Deck.

The deck is designed to be used in conjunction with The Devil's Tome, as The Tome provides the full rituals the Ceremonial cards refer to. However, The Devil's Deck can also be used without The Tome as the companion booklet that comes with the deck provides insights and prompts of its own for each card.

 

Stretch Goal Unlocked!

We hit $20,000 - now all decks will have gilded card edges!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this project but can't contribute, you could help a ton by sharing my Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram + anywhere else as well as with your friends, family (they need to learn more about Satanism, right?), and network. Please use #thedevilsdeck and tag me (@shiva_honey @serpentinaeofficial) and my collaborators @luciengreaves and #Alexandercorey.

You can easily share my Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

About The Creator

Photo by Courtney Brooke

Shiva was a founding member of The Satanic Temple Detroit and The National Council (now International Council) of The Satanic Temple. In addition to being a chief architect of The Unveiling, Snaketivity, and other TST Detroit actions and rituals, she organized a number of national events/campaigns, including bringing Baphomet to Arkansas 2018. Since 2017, she had created and led rituals at The Satanic Temple Salem, including modern takes on The Black Mass. Shiva has been featured in the film Hail Satan (2019) and CNN's This is Life with Lisa Ling: The Satanists Next Door (2015). In 2020 She released her best-selling book, The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual. Shiva is currently writing ritual music to accompany The Devil's Tome with Lucien Greaves and Kyle Apsey for her band Serpentīnae . Shiva creates candles, oils, and other ritual products for The Satanic Temple + her own line for Serpentīnae and considers ritual an essential part of her Satanic practice.

The Devil's Tome Gilded Paperback

The Devil's Deck is the companion to The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual.   Although the deck can be used without the text,  the two are truly meant for each other. You can add on a gilded paperback version of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual signed by me to any order for $30 (that's a discount from retail price!)
You can also get The Devil's Deck paperback signed by Lucien Greaves, Alexander Corey, and myself in the Signed Gilded Paperback Package. Those are limited to a numbered Edition of 20.
The Leather Hardcover version signed by Lucien Greaves, Alexander Corey, and myself is limited to a numbered edition of 23 and is available in the Signed Gilded Leather Package and Baphomet Package. 
The Devil's Tome + Devil's Deck Prints

I've put together packages that feature illustrations from Lucien Greaves and Alexander Corey. Each 8x10 print edition is limited to an edition of 30 and is signed and numbered by the artist. The prints are available in the Print packages, The 666 Packages, and The Baphomet Package. 
Additionally, The Baphomet Package contains an original piece of artwork from Alexander Corey.
 

 

Use the deck to bring Satanic insight, personal empowerment, and facilitate healing.
Pull a card to find your message and embark on a powerful Satanic journey
Each card represents a different Satanic ritual, lesson, act of introspection, or empowerment. Every card presents an evocative image for contemplation. The Deck's accompanying booklet provides a narrative and questions for each card as you continue on your inner journey.
The deck is composed of 17 Ceremony cards and 13 Illumination cards. Ceremony cards contain a sigil or illustration The Devil's Tome. When chosen, you can engage in the recommended reflection from the accompanying booklet or the entire ritual from The Devil's Tome. The Illumination Cards contain new illustrations from Alexander Corey, Lucien Greaves, and myself. When chosen, perform the recommended reflections or actions of empowerment in the booklet accompanying The Devil's Deck.
The deck is designed to be used in conjunction with The Devil's Tome, as The Tome provides the full rituals the Ceremonial cards refer to. However, The Devil's Deck can also be used without The Tome as the companion booklet that comes with the deck provides insights and prompts of its own for each card.
 


Stretch Goal Unlocked!
We hit $20,000 - now all decks will have gilded card edges!

 











Other Ways You Can Help
If you like this project but can't contribute, you could help a ton by sharing my Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram + anywhere else as well as with your friends, family (they need to learn more about Satanism, right?), and network. Please use #thedevilsdeck and tag me (@shiva_honey @serpentinaeofficial) and my collaborators @luciengreaves and #Alexandercorey.
You can easily share my Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Thank you so much for all of your love and support!
About The Creator

Photo by Courtney Brooke
Shiva was a founding member of The Satanic Temple Detroit and The National Council (now International Council) of The Satanic Temple. In addition to being a chief architect of The Unveiling, Snaketivity, and other TST Detroit actions and rituals, she organized a number of national events/campaigns, including bringing Baphomet to Arkansas 2018. Since 2017, she had created and led rituals at The Satanic Temple Salem, including modern takes on The Black Mass. Shiva has been featured in the film Hail Satan (2019) and CNN's This is Life with Lisa Ling: The Satanists Next Door (2015). In 2020 She released her best-selling book, The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual. Shiva is currently writing ritual music to accompany The Devil's Tome with Lucien Greaves and Kyle Apsey for her band Serpentīnae . Shiva creates candles, oils, and other ritual products for The Satanic Temple + her own line for Serpentīnae and considers ritual an essential part of her Satanic practice.

story:
Note: Indiegogo won't release the funds until after this piece is made (debuts in only 2 weeks!). So we're asking people to send their donations, directly to paypal at rikochirito@gmail.com as friends and family. Thank you! Read on.

 

Short Summary

Thank you for taking the time to read our fundraising proposal, we are excited to announce that we have been accepted to bring a one-of-a-kind experience to the LoveBurn festival in Miami! This campaign is to raise funds to produce an Interactive Art Installation called "Doorways to the Multiverse." Your contribution will help us bring this sculpture to the beach! Read on for more details!

The LoveBurn is a magical happening where participants gather to experience one main aspect of life, their uttermost freedom! At the Loveburn you can express yourself freely and meet others on the same journey. The yearly festival features an eclectic assortment of art, music, and interactive activities that you will keep in your memories for years to come. In truth, this isn't a really good description for the LoveBurn. It is much more than that. It is a place to connect, to explore, to dance, and discover a world outside of time. (Find out more about theloveburn.org here.)

The Loveburn is a regional slice of the greater Burning Man Festival community. Burners pride themselves in bringing some of the best most breathtaking art pieces to life. They do so by following the 10 Principles of Burning Man, one of which brings everything together, "Participation". Everyone is bringing something to the table or is able to contribute in a different way. This year, my team and I are bringing a new installation to the Playa. Moreover, we are shooting to create this piece to reach the main event in September, and would like to Debut first at the LoveBurn! Your donation will go to cover the costs of this art piece, transportation, storage, materials, maintenance, and preservation. Be part of this awesome production, make a contribution today!

About the Artwork:

"Doorways to the Multiverse"

Imagine encountering a door... You walk closer and on this door, there is a mirror. You see your face covered in dust. It's you. Or at least a version of you, one on a journey. 
You notice a doorknob. Intuitively, you open the door and walk-in. You are now entering through a portal... 
Across from you, you see another door with yet another mirror. A sign above it tells you, "Close the door behind you". You do, and discover you are now between two mirrors. Both doors reflect each other with infinite reflections, and you see yourself and the multiverse within you. The many, replica, repeating infinitely, symbolizing your true essence, your infinite self. You open the next door and close it behind you, only to see pieces of different sized mirrors. Each reflecting a different perspective. 


"Doorways to the Multiverse" makes the participant part of the art and enter literal portals into the multiverse. 

Whether alone or with friends, people will able to get a good look at who they are, how they look and allow for deep realizations. Their personas, costumes, and masks will be visible to them at the perfect part of their journey.

This piece supports the theme of Burning Man this year (the Multiverse) and makes for a physical representation of the infinity of the multiverse and its different layers, all starting with your individual perspective. 

What is the philosophy of this piece?
Reflection. When you get to see yourself in the mirror, you get to know yourself better. You have the opportunity to have a conversation with yourself. You have the opportunity to take care of yourself, whether it is grooming, or emotional maintenance. This piece gives you a quick look. The reason it is perfect for the playa is because it lets you see the landscape from a totally new vantage point, with you in it. I see it has a momentary portrait of your time in the playa. How do we connect to a multiverse that we can't see? We make it visible, we make it interactive, we give the people a chance to experience themselves being infinite, with something so simple, that they'll be able to remember it every time they go in between two mirrors.

About the Artist:

Riko Chirito is a Miami based artist and producer. He's been creating experiences and events for the community involving artists and creatives. In 2015 he started a non-profit called Waking Hearts, where he organized hundreds of local artists to perform, showcase, and present their art forms in community grassroots events. After this project, Riko moved into the healing arts space, where he has been practicing to master the art of Thai Vedic Healing. Since then, he's organized workshops and lectures at festivals like Burning Man, LoveBurn and Tribal Gathering. This project will be his return to the art world, for more art to come. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to cover the costs of the art piece and to get it to both Burns. This includes, materials, labor, tools, storage, maintenance, troubleshooting, insurance, and secure transportation.

As you know, you will be contributing to this art piece as a Patron of the Arts. If you haven't donated to the production of an art piece, this is a good place to start.

For all donations of $50 or more I will carve or laser imprint your name on the piece, you as a Patron. So yes your name will be immortalized and taken to the playa for years to come!

 

The Impact

Here's an excerpt of what this art piece represents:

Found in the desert, two decorated and fully-functional doors are furnished with mirrors on both sides. They face each other and provide a perspective into both of the participants' outer and inner self. These reflections allow for a real-life experience of the infinity that is the multiverse. 

"This project will be my debut as an artist at a large festival. I have organized artists for years to exhibit art at events produced by me, this time around, I am designing this piece and ensuring it's presented at these two burns! I can't do it alone, I need the help of the community. As an incentive, if this piece ever sells, I will use the money to revive my non-profit and continue to support artists in our communities." - Riko Chirito

Risks & Challenges

We are taking the risks of paying for the work out of pocket, and we are raising funds to expand on the quality of the design. Right now our budget only permits us to do a very simple, rather flimsy version of it, with your help we will be able to create a strong and stable piece ready to take on the challenges of being an outside interactive piece.

  • From the Burning Man website: "Creating art on the playa of Black Rock City is like no canvas or gallery that you may have ever experienced before. The challenges are many. You must consider the extreme physical conditions of the desert, the logistics of transporting building materials and equipment to this remote desert site, and the difficulty of maintaining tools and equipment in a place that has no service grid or ready market of resources."

Basically we will have to prepare for a very difficult journey to get the piece to Burning Man, this is why your donation will come in handy, it will give us the funds to secure the art piece, transport it, and get it back home to exhibit in more places!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with people who would like to support incredible art projects or would like to see this come to life!

And that's all there is to it. Donate now!

story:
Hello All!!!!

I want to start off by saying THANK YOU!!! The things we pulled off in 72 hours was amazing. From writing to setting up amazing shots to booking locations and actors, all within 3 days; is amazing. I am reaching out because participating in events like the 72 hour film festival comes with costs. I am asking for donations to help spread the expenses. This year our costs were: $300 on equipment rental, contest fees and props $200 on food and meals You all have already donated so much of your time and effort, so please donate what you can, if you can

story:
A gorgeous calendar with great purpose

Hi! I'm Maya Zankoul, a Lebanese illustrator. Over the last few years I've published several books about life in Lebanon.

I'm also passionate about cooking and try my best to eat with the seasons because it has been proven that eating that way results in more vibrant taste, more absorbed nutrients, in addition to being more environmentally conscious.

This is why, last year, I produced the first 2018  Eat The Seasons calendar, showcasing the fruits and vegetables in season per month, all year round. The calendar was an instant hit and to this day I get messages from people telling me how it changed their life and improved their eating habits. I personally have also become addicted to it and can't imagine starting 2019 without it.

Over the last few months, I've re-designed the calendar with new, even more colorful illustrations, and added more fruits and vegetables to it. I love the result and can't wait to share it with you. 

But the question is, should I only print one copy for my own kitchen, or would you like to have one in your home, too?

Note: All Indiegogo funds will go toward the printing cost of 200 copies.

My Goal

I will be printing a limited edition of 200 copies of the 2019 Eat The Seasons calendar, and printing the poster on demand. The calendar will be printed on locally recycled paper, using high quality ink. The binding will be done through a white wire binding with an easy way to hang the calendar.

The total cost of printing the calendars, including the IndieGogo additional 5% and processing fees is $1,740. You can participate in the project by purchasing any of the below perks.

Your Rewards

Select your rewards from the column on the right ->

  • One Calendar: $29
  • One Poster: $59
  • One Calendar + One Poster: $88
  • Three Calendars: $87
  • Five Calendars: $135
  • Five Calendars + Five Posters: $457

Note: In the event of  the campaign not reaching its goal, all your money will be refunded to you.

The Impact

By participating in this campaign, in addition to supporting me as an illustrator, you will be:

  • Taking a step towards a healthier lifestyle by increasing your intake of fruits and vegetables in their season
  • Helping local producers throughout the seasons
  • Supporting the environment by choosing to eat in a more sustainable way
  • Making your home or office fresher and more colorful!

Other Ways You Can Help

If for some reason you're not able to contribute to this campaign today, that doesn't mean you can't help.

  • Spread the word to your friends and followers about this campaign by sharing it
  • Personally reach out to people who you think would love this calendar and benefit from it

Thank you for your support. Let's put this beautiful calendar on your walls together!

story:
The Stage Mages are proud to present:
A Madhouse Dramedy.

The play
What began as a word game exercise inspired by a scene from Sweeney Todd, has grown into so much more. Experience something new as, the bizarre meets the comedic. Witness the English Language become rearranged and reinvigorated as these characters try to speak without communicating.
A group therapy session has gone awry and now the therapist is dead. The patients try to go about their everyday routine, but that pesky dead therapist is complicating things. And wouldn't you know it, now she's up and vanished! Join Dorian, Joanna and Taylor as they hunt for the deceased Mildred; as well as any semblance of sanity.

The Company
The Stage Mages were formed in the spirit of producing unique and thought provoking theatre, which explores societal issues by exposing them to the bizarre and the fantastical. The current company is composed of new and emerging artists who are all dedicated to dream:
To provoke and to inspire; to inspire wonder and provoke change.
These artists are:
Alexander Offord
Nicole Wilson
Graeme Black Robinson
Genevieve Trottier
Joshua Swartzenshuber
Matt Pilipiak
and Scott Garland

The funds we are raising, will go toward covering the venue fee, renting rehearsal space, adverstising, and of course dramaturgical development.
However, this is only the beginning ...
Understand, though this production will open and close at the 2012 Toronto Fringe, it will in no way be the end of the play. A piece truly begins it's true growth after meeting it's audience. And we intend to develop this piece
By contributing to this production, you are investing in a greater work to come. As well as other works dedicated to creating unique, high caliber works that will enlighten and enterain.

In exchange for your generous contribution you will also be entitled to some unique one of a kind opportunities:
Earn one of three specially made buttons in style of the characters and the show
have your name spoken onstage as part of the maniancs' bizzare storytelling language.
get your hands on a bound and signed copy of this literary marvel
AND
to our top tier donators:
have your visage be seen on stage for all 7 performances (painted by visual artist Colin Palangio) as part of the show!

Please, join us at the Toronto Fringe and Spread the word!
Location: St. Vladimir’s Theatre- 620 Spadina Avenue
Tickets: $11 in advance
$10 at the door

Performances:
July 4, 7:00pm
July 8, 11:00pm
July 9, 4:45pm
July 11, 9:30pm
July 12, 12:00pm
July 13, 8:00pm
July 14, 1:45pm

Tickets can be purchased:
online at torontofringe.com
via phone at (416)-966-1062x1
in person at the Festival Box Office (581 Bloor Street West)

Let people know about this campaign and this wonderous new work.
Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
My name is Ulrich Schwanitz and I would like to introduce to you the sculpture »You & Me« from the »Scrappies« figurine family. It represents love, affection and mutual commitment - emotions that everyone values and never lose their significance.


Click to view in 3D

The »Scrappies« are inspired by everything you can find in a scrapyard: old nuts and bolts, tin cans, pipes, coils, parts of ball bearings.

But they are actually manufactured in a totally different, novel »3D printing« process. Each of them is made in one piece from fine metal powders. Check the Updates page for the details.

I had initially made the »You & Me« sculpture as a unique gift for our 30th wedding anniversary, but when Christiane placed the Scrappies on her office desk, her collegues loved them so much that we thought why not share it and make it available to others.

Therefore, and for a limited time, I am offering you my work here on IndieGoGo, outside of the traditional channels of exhibiting and selling art. Each figurine will be customized with your initials of choice. I will make and ship a unique »You & Me« sculpture for every supporter, be it one or many.

What's in it for YOU

You want to surprise your loved one with something truly unique and special? Or give your friends an individual, creative wedding gift? Then here is your chance: become a sponsor of my campaign and secure yourself one of these cute »Scrappies« figurines. Just check out the perks – there is something for every budget.

Don't wait for his or her next birthday, your wedding anniversary, next Christmas, or next year's Valentine's day. This campaign runs for a limited time only, don't miss the opportunity.

This is a Flexible Funding campaign and there is no minimum funding needed to let the project to go ahead. I guarantee that all perk'ed items will be shipped to even the smallest number of supporters. No matter how successful the project is, I will never mass-produce and every figurine will always be individually manufactured to make sure each one is truly unique.

What we need & what you get

For me, the most important thing about this campaign is to spread the word about what I do and to share my work with you. The money from your perks will go into manufacturing each sculpture and shipping out the rewards to my supporters.

All time- and cost-intensive preparation has already been completed. The necessary digital designs are finished and I have samples of all sizes and material variations standing on my workbench. So I don’t even need a minimum number of supporters or money to get the project going. The only I thing I do need are

People that like the design as much as I do, are intrigued by the unique manufacturing process and cannot wait to hold such a one-of-a-kind item in their hands.

Of course I hope for a fantastic response from you, our supporters. If the »You & Me – Scrappies« do become overwhelmingly successful, I plan to bundle some of the processing into larger runs and will be able to make some profit from the project. Depending on your response, you might even see me here again with future works.

You are wholeheartedly invited to support my project. There is a choice of rewards suitable for every budget. Take a look at the perks and if you have any questions, please let me know. Below you can already find some information about the different materials and sizes available:

Bronze-infused steel

Eternal Love: This is the original and most valuable design. The two figurines, 3.5" (8.5 cm) high, will look beautiful anywhere, be it on your desk or in your living room. They can stand individually or be connected by their jigsaw-puzzle-shaped pedestal.

Like any of the other models, both the boy and the girl will carry an initial of your choice. We will never produce more than 99 copies of the original, full-size "Eternal Love" sculpture. So if you reserve one, it will probably be the only one in the world with that specific letter combination.


The original edition of »You & Me« is limited to 99 copies that are signed and numbered on the boy's pedestal.

Other full-size pictures are available at the gallery page.


Bronze Love: This is a smaller variant of the bronze sculpture. The figurines are each 2" (5 cm) high – the ideal size and shape to be worn on a keychain or as a necklace. They will also be equipped with the two letters of your choice.

925 Sterling silver

Silver Love: Two small pendants, 1" (2.5 cm) high. These figurines make up a cute small pair and can comfortably be worn as a pair of earrings or around your neck.

The small silver pendants retain a surprising level of detail that is similar to the original design at a quarter of the size.

Alumide

True Love: Alumide is a composite material from fine Aluminium powder and Polyamide plastic. There is a light metallic effect on the surface which does not show on the photos.

The model has the same size as the original design. The manufacturing process is less complex and therefore less costly. The figurines are also lighter than the ones from real metal.

Polyamide

I would be thrilled about any contribution. So even if you can only afford a few dollars, you can receive a special and unique reward for helping me with this project.
 
Polyamide is a light Nylon plastic that is available in several colors. The figurines are pretty light but still suitable as a keychain or pendant.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for reading all the way to the end. I am glad I caught your interest and would love to read your comments and suggestions.

So if you liked what you saw, please help me spread the word and let your friends and family know about my project. Thanks again.

  • Twitter
  • Facebook
  • Email
  • More share tools

 

The fine print

Prices shown include shipping to the US. For delivery to EU countries, please add 20% (=19% VAT + 1% shipping) as indicated in the perk descriptions. For other countries, please contact me. Import duties may apply.

All items will be made to order. After receipt of payment, the delivery time is about 4 weeks for metallic items and 3 weeks for plastic items. Keyrings and chains are not included with the pendants.

Paypal payments, including those made with credit cards as Paypal guest, will be immediate. Other credit card payments will only be released when the campaign ends. For credit card payments, delivery is delayed until 3 weeks after the end of the campaign.
story_txt:
My name is Ulrich Schwanitz and I would like to introduce to you the sculpture »You & Me« from the »Scrappies« figurine family. It represents love, affection and mutual commitment - emotions that everyone values and never lose their significance.
Click to view in 3D
The »Scrappies« are inspired by everything you can find in a scrapyard: old nuts and bolts, tin cans, pipes, coils, parts of ball bearings.
But they are actually manufactured in a totally different, novel »3D printing« process. Each of them is made in one piece from fine metal powders. Check the Updates page for the details.
I had initially made the »You & Me« sculpture as a unique gift for our 30th wedding anniversary, but when Christiane placed the Scrappies on her office desk, her collegues loved them so much that we thought why not share it and make it available to others.
Therefore, and for a limited time, I am offering you my work here on IndieGoGo, outside of the traditional channels of exhibiting and selling art. Each figurine will be customized with your initials of choice. I will make and ship a unique »You & Me« sculpture for every supporter, be it one or many.


What's in it for YOU
You want to surprise your loved one with something truly unique and special? Or give your friends an individual, creative wedding gift? Then here is your chance: become a sponsor of my campaign and secure yourself one of these cute »Scrappies« figurines. Just check out the perks – there is something for every budget.
Don't wait for his or her next birthday, your wedding anniversary, next Christmas, or next year's Valentine's day. This campaign runs for a limited time only, don't miss the opportunity.
This is a Flexible Funding campaign and there is no minimum funding needed to let the project to go ahead. I guarantee that all perk'ed items will be shipped to even the smallest number of supporters. No matter how successful the project is, I will never mass-produce and every figurine will always be individually manufactured to make sure each one is truly unique.



What we need & what you get
For me, the most important thing about this campaign is to spread the word about what I do and to share my work with you. The money from your perks will go into manufacturing each sculpture and shipping out the rewards to my supporters.
All time- and cost-intensive preparation has already been completed. The necessary digital designs are finished and I have samples of all sizes and material variations standing on my workbench. So I don’t even need a minimum number of supporters or money to get the project going. The only I thing I do need are

story:
Bartertown! 

We're a group of burners who want to provide a highly unique experience heretoforth unseen at southeastern regional burn events. That's right: We're gonna have an arena where best friends bash the hell out of each other with foam weapons until they're laughing so hard they fall over. We just need the arena first.

Impact(s):

We want to bring some of the best fun from the big burn in the desert back to the East Coast. Think "American Gladiators" meets Mad Max meets wailing on your buddy with a boffer sword...or watching the fun! The southeastern burns have never seen anything like this before!

We Need Donations! You Need Schwag!

We need $1500 total to construct this arena. It will be modular and sturdy so we can use it for years to come. At least $800 will go toward plywood and 2x4s for the walls. The joints for each wall module and the hardware will also be a significant expense. Then there are halogen work lights (to light up the arena at night!), gasoline for our generator and transport truck. We are borrowing as many tools as we can and have a lot of great volunteers helping to build this thing through their own sweaty labor. In other words, we've reduced costs to the lowest point at which the arena will still be durable and incredibly awesome.

 

We have already received some small Paypal donations. If we don't reach our fundraising goal, we will use funds to create a bare bones version of the arena. People are so, so excited about this and we really want to make this happen for them.

 

Help Get the Word Out!

Make noise about this! Use the share tools! It's super easy! You really have no excuse unless you want lots of people to be incredibly disappointed, you mean bastards.

story:
Hello friends and family!

I am staging a full length contemporary dance and circus production, in Montreal on 25th August 2012. It is an all original creation, using 16 artists, 6 musicians and an all original musical score. It is my first dive into producing a full length show of this size!  Please dig deep and contribute whatever you can towards this exciting project!!

If you are unable to donate, you can assist us by getting the word out there. Share this site on Facebook and invite people to contribute. You can "like" our Facebook page here: https://www.facebook.com/somethingrealshow

If you are in Montreal on August 25th 2012, come and see the show. Tickets are now on sale at http://somethingreal.eventbrite.ca

Please read below for more information on this project.

thank you for you support!!

Meaghan Wegg 

 

BACKGROUND

In 2009 I achieved my dream of working for Cirque du Soleil when I was hired to perform in the aerial hoop trio of their classic show, Quidam. I toured with Quidam for 3 years in South America, USA and Canada. Since leaving Quidam I have maintained my connection with Cirque Du Soleil by working as a VIP tent animation character with Amaluna in Monteal.  I am now returning to my dance roots and am pursuing my passion for teaching, choreographing and directing. 

 

PROGRAM DESCRIPTION

I am producing and directing a live production combining both dance and circus arts, tied together with an original musical score to be performed live. Entitled Something Real, the full length show will be performed on August 25th 2012 at La Gare Dalhousie, Montreal, home of Cirque Eloize. This will be my first venture into creating and directing a full length show of this size.

The underlying theme of the show is stories of love, separation and heartache as interpreted through dance and circus, with particular emphasis on the lyrics expressed in each song. Traditional circus arts typically employ instrumental music to accompany the performer who then drives the story. In Something Real, lyrical ballads will be the main musical feature and the story’s driving force. The artists will interpret the emotion expressed by the musician’s words.

The musical score has been entirely composed by Tim Buckley. A combination of music performed by a live band and pre-recorded instrumental pieces will be played on the night. This is also Tim's first break into contributing performance music on a professional stage. Music from his album, Something Real, will feature in this production. Check it out on itunes: http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/something-real/id463937627

Rehearsals for the show have already begun in Montreal, Ottawa and Clinton ON. The musical score is being learnt by 5 professional musicians, and instrumental pre-recordings are being mixed / mastered.  It's all happening... get on board!!

 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO THE SHOW!!

All funds raised, regardless of the final amount will go directly to covering the costs of the project. 

- Rental of rehearsal space and performance venue (including technical support)

- Equipment rental

- Props / costumes

- Marketing, ticketing, promotion

- Artist travel and lodging

Currently we are recruiting artists on a voluntary basis, and have been lucky enough to secure an incredibly generous and committed team of performers. ALL artists deserve to get paid for provision of their artistic services as career professionals. We are working hard to also secure funding from the Arts Council of Canada, in order to pay our talented artists what they are worth.

We are setting the goal at $5000 through this website, but total costs are likely te be 4 times this amount!!!  Makes your eyes water, doesn't it...  So any funds we can get are most welcome.

 

THE SHOW'S CONTRIBUTION TO THE COMMUNITY

The staging of this entirely new contemporary circus arts production will expose to the Montreal public a show in which dance, circus, and music collaborate fully rather than borrowing elements from each other. 

Having professional artists showcase acts in new disciplines provides them an avenue for increased marketability, while the exposure of amateur performers to a professional setting provides invaluable work experience. We are inviting industry professionals from Cirque Du Soleil, Cirque Eloize and Les 7 doigts de la main, so the performance will also provide an exposure opportunity for budding performers.

story:
Short Summary

After watching the torment that Karen H. Klein endured, we were just as enraged as Max and wanted to help. Sending her on a dream vacation is a brilliant and extremely kind gesture and now, hopefully, she will be able to retire.

Which gave us an idea.

What if we could retire bus #784 and, in the process, help to retire bullying?

We want to purchase the bus from the Greece County School District and turn it into an anti-bullying museum that travels to schools across the nation to raise awareness for this important issue. 

Help us retire bus #784. 

http://www.indiegogo.com/loveforkarenhklein?a=725590

http://www.facebook.com/RetireBus784

story:
Who We Are

The North Bank Artists Community Project (or North Bank Artists, NBA) is a non-profit organization that fosters the artistic and personal development of a group of talented, local member artists. We provide affordable studio spaces to more than a dozen artists, gallery space for member artists to display their work, and a supportive network of peers who encourage and challenge one another.

When NBA was founded in 2002 by Rebecca Seymour, Greg Lueck, and Maya Jones, the Arts in Vancouver, WA were underrepresented and artists had few opportunities to create and show their work. NBA found a home in the heart of Downtown Vancouver on Main Street, and work began renovating the aging building. With help from generous donations and grants, we transformed the space into Vancouver’s premiere gallery.

We all at NBA are deeply invested in the development of our artists, but we are equally invested in our community’s relationship with the Arts. After all, it is the support of the community that allows artists to make the work they love. Every month, our gallery hosts a new show with work by member artists, local high-school art programs, or members of the public. Most recently, NBA spearheaded a successful campaign to designate Vancouver’s first Arts District in the heart of Downtown.


What We Need & Why You Should Help

Since its inception, NBA has rented its home building on Main Street. Rent on the building is paid for by renting out studio spaces on the ground and basement levels. This model meant that we would not be dependent on art sales to cover the bulk of our costs, giving artists the freedom to create work that pushed boundaries without sacrificing the organization’s viability.

In our current building, we have 12 studio spaces; enough so that rents remain affordable, and the rent on the building is paid. For over a decade, this was sufficient. Recently however, our rent has increased to a point where it cannot be absorbed by the current number of renters. To remain a part of Downtown’s art culture, we need to build more studios. 

We need to raise $30,000 to complete our studio build-outs. This goal is based on the cost of renovations to the building in 2002, adjusted for inflation, and includes items like sheetrock, lighting, flooring, and some labor costs. Almost all of the build-outs will be completed through volunteer labor of NBA members and friends.

All donations to this campaign are tax-deductible. NBA is a certified 501(c)3 nonprofit.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends and family! Even if you can't donate, spreading the word about the importance of local art cultures is incredibly valuable. Thank you for reading, and may the Arts live on!

story:
“Are you down on cars or are you down with cars?”

This question was put to me by an auto-body finisher during the of assembly of Trans Am Totem. "Both," I said. It's not just about irony and doubt, sometimes people forget to look for the humour. I’m Marcus Bowcott, a Vancouver based painter and sculptor, and my sculpture, Trans Am Totem has been selected to be exhibited as part of the 2014-2016 Vancouver Biennale exhibition alongside international artists such as Ai Wewei, Vik Muniz, Jonathan Borofsky & OSGEMEOS. This is an amazing opportunity for my work to be exhibited in a public space at Quebec Street and Pacific Boulevard. This sculpture is important because it will be a public art piece that is a meditation on the artifacts of our culture as a part of the Open Borders / Crossroads Vancouver curatorial theme. I am in the final stage of a long and challenging process spread out over 2 years. Your contribution to this campaign will add to the joys and success of this project, which I hope will be shared by everyone visiting Trans Am Totem.


                  

All of the parts of this sculpture have been prepared and are ready to go. I need $6,500 to install it. The stack of cars have been engineered and welded together. An old growth Cedar has been donated to this project as a base for the car stack. The final phase will require heavy lifting equipment that will secure a steel column as support for the tree and car sculpture to the cement base foundation. The total cost of this project is $40,000. Thank you to the Vancouver Biennale for contributing $10,000. I have put a lot of my own money and time into this project and I have received generous donations of time and expertise from engineers, steel fabricators, and metal recyclers. What I have spent and what I expect to spend of my own money sums to $23,500. The remaining costs is the campaign goal of $6,500 for the installation. Whether I reach this goal or not, all funding will go to the project.

In return for your contribution I offer several of my original works, including paintings and sculptures. I’m also offering a small group to join me at the site where we can discuss the work. Be sure to check out the perks side panel for more details. I understand that not all of you can make financial contributions, so instead I encourage you to get the word out by using social media, the Indiegogo sharing tools, or simply talking about Trans Am Totem to your friends and peers.

Here is a sample of the perks:

 "33' high and roughly 25,000 pounds."

The road to Trans Am Totem has been challenging, especially considering the scope and the size: 33' high and roughly 25,000 pounds. Initially I considered using synthetic materials to make the sculpture. But I knew I had to be true to the subject and materials involved - so I chose recycled cars and a real tree. I was really surprised by the amount of hard work it took just to take the cars apart and prepare the automobiles for the sculpture. It was pure labour and persistence. I can't thank my wife, Helene, and my friends enough for helping me slog through it. I'm also grateful to the engineers, Eric and Troy, who have donated their time and energy to this project. 

Even before work even started, the smaller scale maquettes really got people talking, especially when they saw the sculpture montaged onto a photograph of the site at Quebec St & Milross Ave. One of the powerful aspects of a sculpture is that it can engage in a 3D space with its mass and volume. Trans Am Totem's meaning is open to interpretation. I did not want it to be glib or obvious. Public Art is to be viewed multiple times, free of admission. The work must continue to be interesting on several encounters, especially so that the local Vancouver resident and international viewer can unpack their own meaning over multiple visits. This work will not disappear into the background for the 2 years of its installation. 

The connection between the sculpture and the location is both personal and historic. Prior to the existence of Science World, traffic corridors and the high rise condominium towers the site consisted of mills that processed lumber. Before the mills existed there was a vast forest of old growth cedars and Douglas Firs. As a young man - when I worked as a deckhand on the towboats - we towed log booms into False Creek to be processed for lumber. Later, when the City of Vancouver made way for Expo '86 I saw barges full of toxic mud  towed away from False Creek and the world's largest logging camp morphed into it's current incarnation. Quebec Street & Milross Ave is no longer an industrial site, it is now a major hub of movement: the viaducts, light rail, major roads, and residential towers. The wood and the cars of Trans Am Totem speak to the identity of Vancouver: Where we were, where we are, and where we are going to be. I don't claim to have answers, but I'm interested in the conversation.

This sculpture is important because it will be a public art piece that is a meditation on the artifacts of our culture as a part of the Open Borders / Crossroads Vancouver curatorial theme. I am in the final stage of a long and challenging process spread out over 2 years. Your contribution to this campaign will add to the joys and success of this project, which I hope will be shared by everyone visiting Trans Am Totem.                  

All of the parts of this sculpture have been prepared and are ready to go. I need $6,500 to install it. The stack of cars have been engineered and welded together. An old growth Cedar has been donated to this project as a base for the car stack. The final phase will require heavy lifting equipment that will secure a steel column as support for the tree and car sculpture to the cement base foundation. The total cost of this project is $40,000. Thank you to the Vancouver Biennale for contributing $10,000. I have put a lot of my own money and time into this project and I have received generous donations of time and expertise from engineers, steel fabricators, and metal recyclers. What I have spent and what I expect to spend of my own money sums to $23,500. The remaining costs is the campaign goal of $6,500 for the installation. Whether I reach this goal or not, all funding will go to the project.
In return for your contribution I offer several of my original works, including paintings and sculptures. I’m also offering a small group to join me at the site where we can discuss the work. Be sure to check out the perks side panel for more details. I understand that not all of you can make financial contributions, so instead I encourage you to get the word out by using social media, the Indiegogo sharing tools, or simply talking about Trans Am Totem to your friends and peers.
Here is a sample of the perks:



















 "33' high and roughly 25,000 pounds."
The road to Trans Am Totem has been challenging, especially considering the scope and the size: 33' high and roughly 25,000 pounds. Initially I considered using synthetic materials to make the sculpture. But I knew I had to be true to the subject and materials involved - so I chose recycled cars and a real tree. I was really surprised by the amount of hard work it took just to take the cars apart and prepare the automobiles for the sculpture. It was pure labour and persistence. I can't thank my wife, Helene, and my friends enough for helping me slog through it. I'm also grateful to the engineers, Eric and Troy, who have donated their time and energy to this project. 








Even before work even started, the smaller scale maquettes really got people talking, especially when they saw the sculpture montaged onto a photograph of the site at Quebec St & Milross Ave. One of the powerful aspects of a sculpture is that it can engage in a 3D space with its mass and volume. Trans Am Totem's meaning is open to interpretation. I did not want it to be glib or obvious. Public Art is to be viewed multiple times, free of admission. The work must continue to be interesting on several encounters, especially so that the local Vancouver resident and international viewer can unpack their own meaning over multiple visits. This work will not disappear into the background for the 2 years of its installation. 
The connection between the sculpture and the location is both personal and historic. Prior to the existence of Science World, traffic corridors and the high rise condominium towers the site consisted of mills that processed lumber. Before the mills existed there was a vast forest of old growth cedars and Douglas Firs. As a young man - when I worked as a deckhand on the towboats - we towed log booms into False Creek to be processed for lumber. Later, when the City of Vancouver made way for Expo '86 I saw barges full of toxic mud  towed away from False Creek and the world's largest logging camp morphed into it's current incarnation. Quebec Street & Milross Ave is no longer an industrial site, it is now a major hub of movement: the viaducts, light rail, major roads, and residential towers. The wood and the cars of Trans Am Totem speak to the identity of Vancouver: Where we were, where we are, and where we are going to be. I don't claim to have answers, but I'm interested in the conversation.

story:
As a result of the 1967 race riots in Detroit, Tyree Guyton returned to his childhood stomping grounds to find them riddled with trash, drugs, and violence. Of the many abandoned, ignored neighborhoods around the city, Guyton's was statistically one of the hardest hit. As people had rushed to move out, crime had eagerly moved in.

Having already lost three brothers to the very streets he'd grown up on, Tyree decided to take a stand. In 1986, he started the Heidelberg Project as a way to use art to brighten the neighborhood for the many children on his block, but also to call attention to the extreme blight that had enveloped his community. Tyree took stake in his community, and as a result, not a single serious crime was reported within a two block radius of the project for over 26 years. The project is now in its 27th year.

Today, the Heidelberg Project (HP) is the third most visited cultural destination in Detroit and one of the world's most iconic displays of community art. The inspirational and controversial art environment, built largely by repurposing found and abandoned materials and homes, spans two city blocks and has generated $3.4 million for the city of Detroit. 


An Urgent Need

On May 3rd of this year, the HP suffered an unprecedented blow: The longest standing house installation on the project was nearly entirely claimed by a "suspicious" fire. Despite many leads and tips, the city's arson investigators were unable to make an arrest due to lack of municipal resources. Six months passed before the arsonist returned to finish the job, burning the Obstruction of Justice house completely to the ground on October 5th, 2013.

Just days later, the project was rocked by two more early morning arson attempts. The Number House and Penny House were targeted, but only suffered minor damage. Just as we paused to take a breath, the arsonist struck again. The popular House of Soul installation was leveled in the wee hours of November 12th, leaving behind nothing but charred rubble and bits of the vinyl records that once adorned it. 

Now, just five house installations remain, intermingled with the homes of our longtime neighbors and family members. Despite the fact that we are clearly under attack and believe we know who is responsible, the city's arson investigators claim they don't have the resources to pursue the investigation.  We must take matters into our own hands! 

UPDATE: In the early morning hours of November 21, the Heidelberg Project lost a THIRD home installation to arson. The Penny House on Mt. Elliot Street, which was under renovation to become our new offices and community center, has been reduced to rubble. The Penny House now rests in our hearts along with the OJ House and the House of Soul, leaving only 4 house installations remaining. Though we lost another house, the authorities have since launched a more in-depth investigation into the arson attacks.

UPDATE: On November 28, 2013 we were hit again by arson. The War Room house, the former home of Motown Legend Wilson Pickett, went up in flames around 5:15AM. Our patrol was present, but because the area is so dark, and the man was wearing dark clothing, it was difficult to catch him in the act.

UPDATE: December 8, 2013, The Clock House on Elba Street became the fifth home installation lost to arson. The blaze began much earlier than those preceding it, and just minutes before our patrolman arrived for his shift. We assure you we are adapting security and surveillance measures currently in place, and working in complete cooperation with the ATF.


Beyond the Artwork

The destruction of artwork and history is disheartening and frustrating, yes. The fact that these fires are inching nearer and nearer to our long time neighbors, however, is absolutely unacceptable.

Just as Tyree didn't wait for others to change his community, we cannot wait for others to secure it.  We have decided on three primary security measures to implement immediately within the extended Heidelberg Project Community: 

  • Nightly mobile patrol (already in place, but with limited funding)
  • Improved lighting of the area (solar-powered for sustainability)
  • Surveillance cameras (strategically integrated into lighting equipment, equipped with remote monitoring capabilities)

While our course of action is clear, the source of funding for this endeavor is not. Initial estimates for the necessary additions already teeter past $50,000. Unfortunately, it is unrealistic to believe that we will meet this demand on our own. That doesn't mean it's impossible; if each one of our Facebook friends gave just $1, we'd be more than half way there!

*If for some reason the Indiegogo Gods do not smile in our favor and we don't reach our entire goal, the funds that are raised will foot the bill for as much of the security cost as possible. For example, although Nightly patrols are already underway, there is absolutely no wiggle room in the budget to sustain this cost.


Make it a Movement

Wishing you could contribute some other way? You can! We need all the help we can get spreading the word about what we're up against here. PLEASE share this campaign with your friends & family and let them know why YOU believe we're a worthy cause. 

Share right from this Indiegogo page, tell a neighbor or coworker, and definitely follow us on Facebook (The Heidelberg Project) for share-worthy news, graphics, and updates. We're on Twitter, and Instagram, too (@heidelbergproj). 

Interested in donating surveillance equipment, expertise, or services? We're all ears! Reach us at (313)974-6894 or Information@heidelberg.org.

WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU! THANK YOU!

story:
Heres the Scoop:

     My name is Kate and my husband/life partner/best friend for 15 years, Dave and I are working artists (yes, not just myth). We participate in national art shows, and have won numerous awards and been in magazines such as Sunshine Artist and Lapidary Journal. You can see our work and find out more at katebaerfossils.com.

     We also have a small line of original art clothing that we are ready to take to the next level. We have field tested three designs and have had great response and are wanting to print more. We have wholesale accounts with American Apparel, Alternative Apparel, and Onno. We use a local printer that uses formaldahyde-free wate- based ink which you can drink up to a pint of...but please don't! (It tastes really bad)

     We feel really good about offering a product that is in line with our beliefs and lifestyle. We live in an off-grid straw bale home and are passionate about living simply and close to the earth.

     All of the birds have a saying drawn into the design which reflects what I  learned from my encounter with said bird. Here is the rundown on the birds and what is written or will be written into the design. The bat is a little different as I drew it inspired by a non profit hot springs that we like to visit when we take our yearly or twice yearly trip to Colorado. The saying in it is an African proverb that my friend who is a Buddhist monk told me.

  •   Red Tail Hawk "I know my name"
  •   Raven "Honor and Cherish your gifts for you have paid dearly for them"
  •   Barred Owl " We are all sacred and we are all part of a sacred path"
  •   Mexican Free Tailed Bat "We may go faster alone but we go farther  together"
  •   Great Blue Heron "You not only have to ask for inspiration, you have to listen"
  •    Wren "You can't always tell who the brave ones are"
  •    Roadrunner "Don't be predictable, give your life to a higher purpose"
  •    Peewee "Be fearless. Make unexpected friends"
  •    Pheasant "Free yourself. Go in the direction of your choosing, even if the road is unknown. You will be met with beauty."       

     Dave is being super kind and we are adding one of his awesome original song CD's to all of the perks!

Even if you aren't able to be a part of this project I would really appreciate it if you would share the link : igg.me/at/theylistentobirds

Thank you sooo very much...kate and dave
