story:
The Mandala Project: Messages From Nature

This is the Snowy Wisteria Vine Mandala. It is here to remind us that we are ALL interconnected. What a powerful message and reminder for each of us at any point in time, but it seems, especially relevant in today’s divisive climate.

This Mandala has been invited to be the focal point of the 1st annual Kingston Art Festival being held in Kingston, NY on August 24, 2013. It will be on display in three separate locations throughout the festival as a 10FT x 4FT banner.  

It is the first of many public appearances for The Mandala Project and we need your help to share the messages of these beautiful creations far and wide.

Your support will help us follow the Public Art thread for The Mandala Project.

The Mandala Project is about so many things – awareness, energy, nature, meditation, our ability to create positive change, the fact that we are all connected yet we rarely remember this, the ripple effect and the notion of ‘paying-it-forward.’

The Mandala Project’s Facebook page is accomplishing this – people are liking and sharing each Mandala as they get posted. They are commenting, they are engaging; they are being touched, moved, inspired and guided and they are passing it on! (Check it out at www.facebook.com/sharethemandalaproject )

I have a philosophy in life of ‘following the threads.’ When ideas come to me, I follow them until they become something bigger or they take a turn and become something else. With The Mandala Project, each thread has led to something greater and more wonderful. In my words, the project is flowing!

The idea to use The Mandalas as public art projects is the next thread. If they are meant to meet the world in this way, we will see a great response to this campaign and if not, we will look for the next thread to follow.

But I sure hope this is the next step for the project. The idea of seeing The Mandalas in action, of seeing them support and inspire and if even just for a moment, give people an opportunity to see differently, think differently or feel differently, is really exciting.

It is my hope that the Public Art component will be the next step for this incredibly rewarding project and your support will not only help us create the banners, floor graphics, structures and ads needed to release the Public Art component, but your support will also let us know that this is the thread to follow.

Proposed Public Art Projects

Here are several Public Art Projects in the works, one is confirmed, a few are proposals, one is pending and the possibility of all of them is dependent on whether we have the money to manufacture what we need to make them happen.

We Are All Connected  

Snowy Wisteria Vine Mandala – Kingston, NY (confirmed)

The Snowy Wisteria Vine Mandala will be on display in three different locations throughout the Kingston Art Festival as a 10FT x 4FT banner and staked into the ground or hung from a building (depending on the location.) Participants in each location will be led through a meditation that draws on the energy of The Snowy Wisteria Vine’s message of unity, connection and the reminder that we are ALL connected. At the end of each location’s event, participants will be invited to sign the back or leave a message on the back of The Mandala banner – creating another interconnection through the overlapping of names and messages.

 

Reflection

Tannery Brook Falls Mandala- Walkway Over The Hudson (proposal)

 

This project includes an 8FT x 8FT floor graphic of the Tannery Brook Falls Mandala installed center point of the famed Walkway Over The Hudson. Participants will be invited to sit or stand in the Mandala and explore its message of clarity, of seeing the layers in life and of learning to flow with grace and ease.

 

 

THE WISH

Dandelion Puff Mandala

Central Park Open Lawn (proposal); Storm King Sculpture Park, Storm King, NY (proposal), Art Park, Lewiston, NY (proposal)

 

Do you remember ‘play parachutes?’ Maybe you played with them in gym class or at day camp, well, The Dandelion Puff Mandala shares a whimsical and playful message of taking time to out to play and to dream.  

This project entails the creation of a 24FT Diameter play parachute of The Dandelion Puff Mandala. Participants will be invited to grab a spot along the edge of the play parachute, will be guided through a simple meditation to help them tap into the energy of the Dandelion Puff, then led through a series of play parachute games, ending with everyone energizing a hand full of grass seed with two wishes to toss energetically onto the Mandala– one for themselves and one for the planet. In a symbol of release the play parachute will be tossed up, releasing the seeds and the wishes, just as we have done as a child when blowing on the Dandelion Puff.

 

Messages From Nature - NYC Subway (Proposal)

 

Imagine standing on the subway platform and encountering one of The Mandalas - stunning, inviting, refreshing and healing. Each ad will include one of The Mandalas, the name of the mandala and a single word like 'inspire' or 'hope' or 'love'. Each ad will also include a QR code that will take the viewer to The Mandala on The Mandala Project's Facebook page, which will offer additional information and guidance in using this mandala and in an effort ot continue the ripple encourage viewers to share the project with their community.

 

Projections - a Mandala Project Flash Mob - Snow, Water, Sand, Buildings (Proposal)

What if you were walking down the street and suddenly in front of you was The Snow Drop Mandala sharing it's message of Hope; or you were at a sky resort and there on the night slope was the Hosta Flower Mandala sharing it's message of Prayers Answered. 

Projections will require a special GOBO machine that will allow for high powered projection in any setting, day or night. Plus it requires a special housing for the machine itself to protect it from weather. Once we have the machine, the possilbities are endless though. We have visions of Pop up Mandalas on the beaches, on the snow, on the side of buildings - think of it like a Mandala Project flash mob!

 

 

 

What happens with the money raised?

$1000 launches The Snowy Wisteria Vine Mandala project. We have figured it will cost $1000 to create the banner and install it in three separate locations. Once the banner is created, we will have it to use at other festivals and events.

$2000 launches the above plus The Tannery Brook Falls project – The floor graphic will need to be specially made because of its size. It will cost about $1000. Unless I can find a way to make it moveable, this will be a one-time event as the graphic will be adhered to the ground. I am exploring the idea of having the graphic made in sections that can be placed on Masonite boards. If this works, then the project will be portable and can be done at additional venues.

$7800 launches the above plus Messages From Nature - NYC Subway Project. This will let us create four subway platform ads that will be on display for 4 weeks. Imagine the impact and the number of people this will reach. Each add is approximately $1200. If we raise more, we can place additional ads.

$12,000 launches the above plus THE WISH – yes a big jump. The play parachute will need to be custom made – everything from the silk screening of the material to the sewing of the parachute itself. In the end though, we will have an awesome addition to The Mandala Project – one giant Dandelion Puff Mandala play parachute!

$20,000 launches the above plus PROJECTIONS - A Mandala Project Flash Mob. This will enable us to purchase the projector and create custom glass GOBOs with images of The Mandalas, that's all that is needed to be able to do this project. From there all we need is a blank canvas to project onto - walls, floors, sand, snow, open fields, the possiblities are endless!

This is just an example of how funding will be used. More ideas will continue to sprout, so all funding will help to share the ripple effect of The Mandala Project.

BIG DREAMS – I dream of seeing The Mandalas on billboards, installed in museums and hospitals as interactive mandalas, installed in public transit as mosaic tile installations – there are no shortage of creative ideas springing up around The Mandala Project

 

 

A Little About Christine Agro, Creator of The Mandala Project

I have Scorpio Rising and Scorpio as my Sun sign which makes me passionate and deeply connected to the metaphysical nature of life. I’m tempered by a lovely Gemini Moon, which makes me talkative. Each sign has a motto, and Scorpio’s is I Create; Gemini is ‘I Dream’. So combine the double creativity with dreaming and it fuels my passion to support people by being inspired to create new ways of helping people live life to the fullest.

I love to learn, heal and grow and to share what I have discovered with those for whom my information seems to resonate. I am fascinated by our life’s journey, how we learn our lessons and I relish in the opportunity to help people see, find and embrace a simpler, drama-free approach to moving through their days.

Over the years I have written two books, published two decks of conscious living guidance cards and written countless articles for a variety of publications including Beliefnet.com and Gaiam Life. I have been teaching and supporting people around the world in creating the lives of their dreams since 1999.  I’ve been on Animal Planet TV, featured in the New York Times, cited in several books including Supernatural America: A Cultural History, Messages From Spirit by Collete Baron-Reid and the New York Times Bestseller Grace: A Memoir by Grace Coddington. In October, I’m honored to be giving the Keynote talk at the first ever Women of India Leadership Summit in Delhi, India.

I have, what I like to call, a tool basket of skills: a BFA in painting and printmaking, an MBA, a Traditional Naturopaths degree as well as a Master Herbalist degree and a collection of certifications in everything from clairvoyance to aromatherapy to reflexology. Skills that, to many over the years, seemed disconnected, but always for me, have been very connected. Creativity, clear seeing and a business sense have yielded who I am today; grounded, certain, passionate, creative and a boundary pusher.

The Mandala Project combines many of the tools that I feel help to create powerful and positive change in our lives. The project is designed to encourage a deeper connection to nature and energy; to tap into the power of meditation and to explore the positive experience of The Ripple Effect and paying-it-forward.

As the project has unfolded, The Mandalas are inspiring people to interact, to share and to pass their experience on to friends and family – everything I had hoped for.

I believe the next step for The Mandala Project is to take them into the public arena. They are already being shown in various shows from NYC to Woodstock, NY to Connecticut, and as much as I love seeing them framed and hanging in a gallery for people to reflect upon, The Mandalas yearn to get out and interact.

 

 

What Do You Receive For Your Support?

There is a Universal Law that states ‘whenever two or more come together to support something the energy is magnified’ When you support this project, you get to be a part of a matrix of positive energy that is rippling out and creating powerful change.

Ya, ya…lol…that’s all well and good, but I know – what do you get?

 

I have created some great gifts for your support, like unique Mandala Cards that embrace the nature of the ripple effect and paying-it-forward. These sets are exclusive to these public projects, so they are not for sale on The Mandala Project’s website or in stores. There are also additional Mandala Project incentives as the donation amount increases including necklaces, portable speakers, framed and signed images and an amazing commuter bag. And of course the good juju that comes from being a part of The Mandala Project!

Remember, you can decline to receive a benefit and then all of your donation goes directly toward making Messages From Nature happen!

 

 $5.00 –Ripples

 You receive all that good energy that comes from supporting The      Mandala Project, an invitation via email to the public art projects and  your name (as it appears on your donation) on The Mandala  Project Facebook Page.

 

 

 

 $20.00 – Best Friends

 Receive a 4.8 x 4.8 inch window cling of the  Dandelion Mandala which is a symbol of unending friendship and  fortune.    

 It says "I created a ripple by supporting The Mandala Project." 

 

$35.00 – Pass it On!

Receive one set of Mandala Cards. Each set is 4x4 inches and comes with 10 cards that include an exclusive code and password that unlock a special meditation at The Mandala Project.net Keep a card for yourself, do the meditation for seven day and then pass your card along; while you give away the other nine to friends, family or even strangers and watch the ripple effect your donation has! 

$50.00 – Mandala Meditation

Receive an invitation to an exclusive Mandala Meditation for project supporters at this level or higher. This offers the opportunity to work with Christine Agro and to experience the powerful energy these Mandalas hold. The Mandala Meditation will be held via a teleconference and it will be recorded if you can't make it, you can listen later.

 

 

$75.00 –  Thanks For Carrying!

Receive The Day Lily Mandala Tote. The Day Lily Mandala offers a source of inspiration and encourages you to shine from the inside out. With a slim, fashionable design, this tote is environmentally friendly and truly is a great value. Made from 100% cotton and has strong handles with reinforced stitching. Dimensions: 15.75"h x 15.25"w.   

 

  

$150.00 - Close To Your Heart

A beautiful square custom sterling silver plated Dandelion Puff necklace. Complete with a 18" sterling silver-plated chain (2" extender) and lobster claw clasp, this necklace is finished with a UV resistant and waterproof coating to protect your Dandelion Puff for years to come. 

Made in the USA

 

 

$300.00 - The Sound of Change

Recieve The Snowy Wisteria Vine Mandala portable speaker by OrigAudio for portable devices.

 

 

 

 $500.00 - Clear-ly Special

Receive an 8 ½ x 8 ½ signed print of the Tannery Brook Falls Mandala. (Unframed)

 The Tannery Brook Falls Mandala shares a message  of flow, evolution and clear reflection.

  

 

 

 

$1000.00 - Make A Wish...Come True

Upgrade your daily commute with a Dandelion Puff Mandala Rickshaw laptop bag! Made in San Francisco with a focus on sustainability and durability, this laptop bag stands up to daily wear ‘n tear and will spread it’s dandelion wish joy as you move through your day. Made with a pocket or compartment for everything from a 15” laptop to a journal, this laptop bag will make it easy to take it all, including The Mandala Project with you each day.

Water resistant, extra durable construction. Holds up to 15" laptop (sleeve included). 2 large front pockets and rear organizational pocket. Magnetic silencers, Velcro, and clip flap fasteners.Made with a sustainability focus in San Francisco, CA. Dimensions 11" H x 15.75" W x 4.75" D.

  

 

     Other Ways You Can Help

 

Whether you can contribute or not, you can definitely help support the project!

  • Share The Mandala Project Indiegogo campaign with your friends and community. Tell them why you think it’s a project worth supporting!
  • You can use the Indeigogo share tools to help you with your sharing. Remember The Mandala Project in all its forms is about ‘passing it on’ so pass it on!
  • If you know people in the media, tell them about The Mandala Project and why you think its wonderful and ask them to check it out too, then share the Indiegogo page with them to make it easy – just one piece of press will have a tremendous ripple effect!

Thank you, thank you, thank you!
story_txt:
The Mandala Project: Messages From Nature


This is the Snowy Wisteria Vine Mandala. It is here to remind us that we are ALL interconnected. What a powerful message and reminder for each of us at any point in time, but it seems, especially relevant in today’s divisive climate.
This Mandala has been invited to be the focal point of the 1st annual Kingston Art Festival being held in Kingston, NY on August 24, 2013. It will be on display in three separate locations throughout the festival as a 10FT x 4FT banner.  
It is the first of many public appearances for The Mandala Project and we need your help to share the messages of these beautiful creations far and wide.
Your support will help us follow the Public Art thread for The Mandala Project.
The Mandala Project is about so many things – awareness, energy, nature, meditation, our ability to create positive change, the fact that we are all connected yet we rarely remember this, the ripple effect and the notion of ‘paying-it-forward.’
The Mandala Project’s Facebook page is accomplishing this – people are liking and sharing each Mandala as they get posted. They are commenting, they are engaging; they are being touched, moved, inspired and guided and they are passing it on! (Check it out at www.facebook.com/sharethemandalaproject )

I have a philosophy in life of ‘following the threads.’ When ideas come to me, I follow them until they become something bigger or they take a turn and become something else. With The Mandala Project, each thread has led to something greater and more wonderful. In my words, the project is flowing!
The idea to use The Mandalas as public art projects is the next thread. If they are meant to meet the world in this way, we will see a great response to this campaign and if not, we will look for the next thread to follow.
But I sure hope this is the next step for the project. The idea of seeing The Mandalas in action, of seeing them support and inspire and if even just for a moment, give people an opportunity to see differently, think differently or feel differently, is really exciting.
It is my hope that the Public Art component will be the next step for this incredibly rewarding project and your support will not only help us create the banners, floor graphics, structures and ads needed to release the Public Art component, but your support will also let us know that this is the thread to follow.
Proposed Public Art Projects
Here are several Public Art Projects in the works, one is confirmed, a few are proposals, one is pending and the possibility of all of them is dependent on whether we have the money to manufacture what we need to make them happen.
We Are All Connected  
Snowy Wisteria Vine Mandala – Kingston, NY (confirmed)

The Snowy Wisteria Vine Mandala will be on display in three different locations throughout the Kingston Art Festival as a 10FT x 4FT banner and staked into the ground or hung from a building (depending on the location.) Participants in each location will be led through a meditation that draws on the energy of The Snowy Wisteria Vine’s message of unity, connection and the reminder that we are ALL connected. At the end of each location’s event, participants will be invited to sign the back or leave a message on the back of The Mandala banner – creating another interconnection through the overlapping of names and messages.
 
Reflection
Tannery Brook Falls Mandala- Walkway Over The Hudson (proposal)

 
This project includes an 8FT x 8FT floor graphic of the Tannery Brook Falls Mandala installed center point of the famed Walkway Over The Hudson. Participants will be invited to sit or stand in the Mandala and explore its message of clarity, of seeing the layers in life and of learning to flow with grace and ease.
 
 
THE WISH
Dandelion Puff Mandala
Central Park Open Lawn (proposal); Storm King Sculpture Park, Storm King, NY (proposal), Art Park, Lewiston, NY (proposal)

 
Do you remember ‘play parachutes?’ Maybe you played with them in gym class or at day camp, well, The Dandelion Puff Mandala shares a whimsical and playful message of taking time to out to play and to dream.  
This project entails the creation of a 24FT Diameter play parachute of The Dandelion Puff Mandala. Participants will be invited to grab a spot along the edge of the play parachute, will be guided through a simple meditation to help them tap into the energy of the Dandelion Puff, then led through a series of play parachute games, ending with everyone energizing a hand full of grass seed with two wishes to toss energetically onto the Mandala– one for themselves and one for the planet. In a symbol of release the play parachute will be tossed up, releasing the seeds and the wishes, just as we have done as a child when blowing on the Dandelion Puff.
 
Messages From Nature - NYC Subway (Proposal)

 
Imagine standing on the subway platform and encountering one of The Mandalas - stunning, inviting, refreshing and healing. Each ad will include one of The Mandalas, the name of the mandala and a single word like 'inspire' or 'hope' or 'love'. Each ad will also include a QR code that will take the viewer to The Mandala on The Mandala Project's Facebook page, which will offer additional information and guidance in using this mandala and in an effort ot continue the ripple encourage viewers to share the project with their community.
 
Projections - a Mandala Project Flash Mob - Snow, Water, Sand, Buildings (Proposal)
What if you were walking down the street and suddenly in front of you was The Snow Drop Mandala sharing it's message of Hope; or you were at a sky resort and there on the night slope was the Hosta Flower Mandala sharing it's message of Prayers Answered. 
Projections will require a special GOBO machine that will allow for high powered projection in any setting, day or night. Plus it requires a special housing for the machine itself to protect it from weather. Once we have the machine, the possilbities are endless though. We have visions of Pop up Mandalas on the beaches, on the snow, on the side of buildings - think of it like a Mandala Project flash mob!
 
 
 
What happens with the money raised?
$1000 launches The Snowy Wisteria Vine Mandala project. We have figured it will cost $1000 to create the banner and install it in three separate locations. Once the banner is created, we will have it to use at other festivals and events.
$2000 launches the above plus The Tannery Brook Falls project – The floor graphic will need to be specially made because of its size. It will cost about $1000. Unless I can find a way to make it moveable, this will be a one-time event as the graphic will be adhered to the ground. I am exploring the idea of having the graphic made in sections that can be placed on Masonite boards. If this works, then the project will be portable and can be done at additional venues.
$7800 launches the above plus Messages From Nature - NYC Subway Project. This will let us create four subway platform ads that will be on display for 4 weeks. Imagine the impact and the number of people this will reach. Each add is approximately $1200. If we raise more, we can place additional ads.
$12,000 launches the above plus THE WISH – yes a big jump. The play parachute will need to be custom made – everything from the silk screening of the material to the sewing of the parachute itself. In the end though, we will have an awesome addition to The Mandala Project – one giant Dandelion Puff Mandala play parachute!
$20,000 launches the above plus PROJECTIONS - A Mandala Project Flash Mob. This will enable us to purchase the projector and create custom glass GOBOs with images of The Mandalas, that's all that is needed to be able to do this project. From there all we need is a blank canvas to project onto - walls, floors, sand, snow, open fields, the possiblities are endless!
This is just an example of how funding will be used. More ideas will continue to sprout, so all funding will help to share the ripple effect of The Mandala Project.
BIG DREAMS – I dream of seeing The Mandalas on billboards, installed in museums and hospitals as interactive mandalas, installed in public transit as mosaic tile installations – there are no shortage of creative ideas springing up around The Mandala Project
 
 
A Little About Christine Agro, Creator of The Mandala Project
I have Scorpio Rising and Scorpio as my Sun sign which makes me passionate and deeply connected to the metaphysical nature of life. I’m tempered by a lovely Gemini Moon, which makes me talkative. Each sign has a motto, and Scorpio’s is I Create; Gemini is ‘I Dream’. So combine the double creativity with dreaming and it fuels my passion to support people by being inspired to create new ways of helping people live life to the fullest.
I love to learn, heal and grow and to share what I have discovered with those for whom my information seems to resonate. I am fascinated by our life’s journey, how we learn our lessons and I relish in the opportunity to help people see, find and embrace a simpler, drama-free approach to moving through their days.
Over the years I have written two books, published two decks of conscious living guidance cards and written countless articles for a variety of publications including Beliefnet.com and Gaiam Life. I have been teaching and supporting people around the world in creating the lives of their dreams since 1999.  I’ve been on Animal Planet TV, featured in the New York Times, cited in several books including Supernatural America: A Cultural History, Messages From Spirit by Collete Baron-Reid and the New York Times Bestseller Grace: A Memoir by Grace Coddington. In October, I’m honored to be giving the Keynote talk at the first ever Women of India Leadership Summit in Delhi, India.
I have, what I like to call, a tool basket of skills: a BFA in painting and printmaking, an MBA, a Traditional Naturopaths degree as well as a Master Herbalist degree and a collection of certifications in everything from clairvoyance to aromatherapy to reflexology. Skills that, to many over the years, seemed disconnected, but always for me, have been very connected. Creativity, clear seeing and a business sense have yielded who I am today; grounded, certain, passionate, creative and a boundary pusher.
The Mandala Project combines many of the tools that I feel help to create powerful and positive change in our lives. The project is designed to encourage a deeper connection to nature and energy; to tap into the power of meditation and to explore the positive experience of The Ripple Effect and paying-it-forward.
As the project has unfolded, The Mandalas are inspiring people to interact, to share and to pass their experience on to friends and family – everything I had hoped for.
I believe the next step for The Mandala Project is to take them into the public arena. They are already being shown in various shows from NYC to Woodstock, NY to Connecticut, and as much as I love seeing them framed and hanging in a gallery for people to reflect upon, The Mandalas yearn to get out and interact.
 
 

What Do You Receive For Your Support?
There is a Universal Law that states ‘whenever two or more come together to support something the energy is magnified’ When you support this project, you get to be a part of a matrix of positive energy that is rippling out and creating powerful change.
Ya, ya…lol…that’s all well and good, but I know – what do you get?
 
I have created some great gifts for your support, like unique Mandala Cards that embrace the nature of the ripple effect and paying-it-forward. These sets are exclusive to these public projects, so they are not for sale on The Mandala Project’s website or in stores. There are also additional Mandala Project incentives as the donation amount increases including necklaces, portable speakers, framed and signed images and an amazing commuter bag. And of course the good juju that comes from being a part of The Mandala Project!
Remember, you can decline to receive a benefit and then all of your donation goes directly toward making Messages From Nature happen!
 
 $5.00 –Ripples
 You receive all that good energy that comes from supporting The      Mandala Project, an invitation via email to the public art projects and  your name (as it appears on your donation) on The Mandala  Project Facebook Page.
 
 

 
 $20.00 – Best Friends
 Receive a 4.8 x 4.8 inch window cling of the  Dandelion Mandala which is a symbol of unending friendship and  fortune.    
 It says "I created a ripple by supporting The Mandala Project." 
 
$35.00 – Pass it On!
Receive one set of Mandala Cards. Each set is 4x4 inches and comes with 10 cards that include an exclusive code and password that unlock a special meditation at The Mandala Project.net Keep a card for yourself, do the meditation for seven day and then pass your card along; while you give away the other nine to friends, family or even strangers and watch the ripple effect your donation has! 
$50.00 – Mandala Meditation
Receive an invitation to an exclusive Mandala Meditation for project supporters at this level or higher. This offers the opportunity to work with Christine Agro and to experience the powerful energy these Mandalas hold. The Mandala Meditation will be held via a teleconference and it will be recorded if you can't make it, you can listen later.

 
 
$75.00 –  Thanks For Carrying!
Receive The Day Lily Mandala Tote. The Day Lily Mandala offers a source of inspiration and encourages you to shine from the inside out. With a slim, fashionable design, this tote is environmentally friendly and truly is a great value. Made from 100% cotton and has strong handles with reinforced stitching. Dimensions: 15.75"h x 15.25"w.   
 
  
$150.00 - Close To Your Heart
A beautiful square custom sterling silver plated Dandelion Puff necklace. Complete with a 18" sterling silver-plated chain (2" extender) and lobster claw clasp, this necklace is finished with a UV resistant and waterproof coating to protect your Dandelion Puff for years to come. 
Made in the USA
 

 
$300.00 - The Sound of Change
Recieve The Snowy Wisteria Vine Mandala portable speaker by OrigAudio for portable devices.
 
 
 
 $500.00 - Clear-ly Special
Receive an 8 ½ x 8 ½ signed print of the Tannery Brook Falls Mandala. (Unframed)
 The Tannery Brook Falls Mandala shares a message  of flow, evolution and clear reflection.
  
 
 
 
$1000.00 - Make A Wish...Come True
Upgrade your daily commute with a Dandelion Puff Mandala Rickshaw laptop bag! Made in San Francisco with a focus on sustainability and durability, this laptop bag stands up to daily wear ‘n tear and will spread it’s dandelion wish joy as you move through your day. Made with a pocket or compartment for everything from a 15” laptop to a journal, this laptop bag will make it easy to take it all, including The Mandala Project with you each day.
Water resistant, extra durable construction. Holds up to 15" laptop (sleeve included). 2 large front pockets and rear organizational pocket. Magnetic silencers, Velcro, and clip flap fasteners.Made with a sustainability focus in San Francisco, CA. Dimensions 11" H x 15.75" W x 4.75" D.
  

 
     Other Ways You Can Help
 
Whether you can contribute or not, you can definitely help support the project!

Share The Mandala Project Indiegogo campaign with your friends and community. Tell them why you think it’s a project worth supporting!
You can use the Indeigogo share tools to help you with your sharing. Remember The Mandala Project in all its forms is about ‘passing it on’ so pass it on!
If you know people in the media, tell them about The Mandala Project and why you think its wonderful and ask them to check it out too, then share the Indiegogo page with them to make it easy – just one piece of press will have a tremendous ripple effect!

Thank you, thank you, thank you!

story:
UPDATE 12/17/13: Thank you to everyone who helped.  All 98 funders made this possible.  If you are looking for the new Activity Books, you can find them here at the Kcymaerxthaere Exports store.  The prices are a little bit higher than the early adopters got by supporting the project during the campaign--but still a great value. If you missed the campaign, the other perks are available at the Exports store too, but at their standard prices. Visit Kcymaerxthaere installations and tell us about it on Facebook or twitter (@kcym). AND: sign up for our Newsletter--at the bottom of the page--to learn about events, future campaigns and possible discounts.

UPDATE 12/3/13: Excellent Online Article on Kcymaerxthaere.  Now, back to our regularly scheduled program . . .

My name is Eames Demetrios and I have a parallel universe.  Creating it continues to be an amazing journey--and a whole lot of that fun comes from sharing it with other people.  This activity book is the next step.

For the past decade I have been traveling the world--installing markers and historic sites that honor events from that parallel world in our linear world.  So far we have 98 sites in 22 countries, with more on the way.  I call this project Kcymaerxthaere and it is a bit like a novel with every page in a different place.  Where you read such a page out in the landscape (doesn't matter if it is remote or urban), it influences how you visualize that story. It may sound a bit unusual, but it is so rewarding to see how many people enjoy conjuring up another reality without a single digital enhancement--all by themselves in the real world with their minds.

I have a background as a filmmaker and have written several books on various topics (this will be the fourth from Kcymaerxthaere), but ultimately I think I consider myself a storyteller. I have even done a number of TED talks--on the TED Mainstage and at quite a few TEDx venues.

Putting it altogether, one of our key goals is to help people look at the world fresh, to start to see what's not there.  First, that is a great space in which to tell a story.  But, even though it sounds crazy in a way, I think it can help us come up with new ways to help ourselves and our world.  After all, most of the really important things in our lives--relationships, careers, businesses, families--DIDN'T exist before they did.  So what's not there is often the stuff that is our very essence. 

Before we get to specifics, here's more about the project in general: 


Ultimately I think that is what crowd funding is all about: to connect people with beautiful and unexpected projects that they can then help the artist or creator bring them into the world.  This will be my third IndieGoGo--here's what we did with the last one!

SO WHAT IS THIS ALL ABOUT?

One of the most rewarding aspects of watching people enjoy the stories and installations of Kcymaerxthaere over the years has been observing the different interpretations of the stories and characters they've created.  Even though we have physical installations, I always wanted to sketch the characters, creatures and stories into people's minds with words and implications, so they imagined all that for themselves.  And, from the beginning, I looked for ways to go further.  And so I started to ask people to draw what they thought things looked like.  In this way, we could tell the audience what the creatures MIGHT look like, but at the same time kind of take it away--by pointing out we are not sure that the renderings are exactly right. In Kcymaerxthaere, we call such interpretations Disputed Likenesses.  

We've done workshops around the world based on this idea.  And it is time to take it to the next level by creating a way for people to play on their own and share their images as well. 

I have to add that as a kid, and then with my own kids, I was never a huge fan of connecting the dots or coloring books (yes, I know there are a couple cool ones!).  It could be a fun puzzle sometimes, but it always seemed like the person who made it had already had all the fun!


That's why we've created an activity book we call Please DON'T Connect the Dots. It catalyzes thinking and creativity from the stories of Kcymaerxthaere.  And even though kids love the challenge, we find that adults have a great time on the journey too.  So not only it is a great holiday gift for the kids in your life, it is a pretty cool business gift too (and not just during the season).

WHAT ARE YOU ASKING FOR?

We aren't asking for a gift.  We are asking you to support this project by buying the book (or the other things) in advance.  And also we are offering some of the other amazing Disputed Likenesses we have done over the years-- all of which come with a complimentary activity book. 

In return, the shipping is free (see our note at the end about timing), the book is discounted and you will be the first to share this great Activity Book with your community.

And if you get some of the bigger perks, we are offering a discount as our show of appreciation of your support.

HOW DOES THIS HELP THE PROJECT?

For the Kcymaerxthaere project, there is another benefit as important as the financial one: seeing different Disputed Likenesses of the same creature (or character or story) is sometimes the best way to understand what something in Kcymaerxthaere might have looked like.  Because there are many dimensions of Kcymaerxthaere, it is tricky to represent aspects of the parallel world precisely in our world.  Your interpretations put into drawing is the best way to help share Kcymaerxthaere's stories with others and connect them across the globe!

So we are currently encouraging people to share their Disputed Likenesses from our workshops through our Flickr groups, but we believe Please DON'T Connect the Dots will take it to a new level.  All those groups of Disputed Likenesses accessible through our portal website disputedlikeness.com.  

Thanks so much for hearing me out.  And we sure hope you'll consider supporting our Activity Book.

Eames Demetrios

Artist and Geographer-at-Large for Kcymaerxthaere



*important note on shipping-all perks will be mailed free of charge by USPS first class by December 17.  Our goal, based on USPS parameters is for each shipment to arrive by December 24 on all domestic orders.  If your order will be an international shipment please allow 10-14 business days for your order to arrive. We would be happy to accommodate you with rush shipping if requested using Fedex (extra payment will be required) to allow delivery on or before Dec. 24 please contact info@kcystories.com to arrange this shipping option.

*important note on shipping-all perks will be mailed free of charge by USPS first class by December 17.  Our goal, based on USPS parameters is for each shipment to arrive by December 24 on all domestic orders.  If your order will be an international shipment please allow 10-14 business days for your order to arrive. We would be happy to accommodate you with rush shipping if requested using Fedex (extra payment will be required) to allow delivery on or before Dec. 24 please contact info@kcystories.com to arrange this shipping option.

story:
PDX Sass is a meetup group in Portland OR focusing on connecting and equipping Front-end Developers. We talk a LOT about Sass, the CSS preprocessor, as well as other popular Front-end topics. We've been meeting every 2nd Thursday, 6pm at Puppet Labs since July of 2013, and you can join our G+ community, or watch us live and catch previous meetups on our Youtube channel. 

Last month Lisa Jansen offered to create a new logo for our group, and I quickly accepted the offer! Now we need some stickers, and I'm turning to our members and supporters to help us get them. We are going to be ordering 3x3 die cut stickers from Stickermule. If we raise enough money for 3x3 stickers we'll put the rest of the money into some other sizes as well.

We talk a LOT about Sass, the CSS preprocessor, as well as other popular Front-end topics. We've been meeting every 2nd Thursday, 6pm at Puppet Labs since July of 2013, and you can join our G+ community, or watch us live and catch previous meetups on our Youtube channel. Last month Lisa Jansen offered to create a new logo for our group, and I quickly accepted the offer! Now we need some stickers, and I'm turning to our members and supporters to help us get them. We are going to be ordering 3x3 die cut stickers from Stickermule. If we raise enough money for 3x3 stickers we'll put the rest of the money into some other sizes as well.

story: I have been an artist my whole life. Being an artist is a struggle, and finding a place to buy, sell, or showcase your art is just as hard. For certain mediums, like glass, finding a way to further you skills and education in that medium can be even harder. This is where my dream comes in. The area i live in has no center for art. There are very few shops that sell any kind of art and most of them import generic stuff to make a quick buck. I have purchased a large (16,000 square foot!) building to change all that. My plan is to have a storefront/gallery on the ground floor for everything from glass art to print art to hand made clothing. Anything art. Anything hand made by skilled artisans and/or craftsmen (or craftswomen!) I will have my own personal studio right in the front window to show people the wonders of glass art first hand, In the basement I plan to have a large glass studio for live demos, classes, and studio space available and 24/7 access for those who cannot have their own studio at home. There is a lot of space so possibly a clay art or other medium studio down there as well, depending on community response. The top floor will be entertainment. Music, plays, spoken word, yoga classes, wedding receptions, you name it we can have it there! All in the name of bringing culture and art to a town trying to bounce back from the decline of the steel industry. There has recently been a slight turn around in the area for businesses. Larger ones are moving in and I don't want to see everything completely commercialized. There is a place in this world for true art and individual craftspeople. I want this to be the outlet for them so they don't get buried by mass produced big business. Now all this doesn't come cheap! I am working 40+ hours a week to fund this and doing all of the renovations and research and filing of papers by myself. I am probably putting in over 100 hours a week on this! And it is slow going. That is where you come in. Any help is a great help! Whether is monetary, volunteer work, telling your friends about it, anything. Of course money helps a lot! Studio equipment, drywall, plumbing supplies, running electric to accommodate lighting and everything else takes a lot. Thank you for reading this and I hope you can find it in you heart to help. :-)

story:
Short Summary

I'm Chris and I'm an audiobook narrator and have been producing, narrating and voice acting for around four years.  Currently my studio set up is located in a garden building at another location several miles away from where I live at my parents house.  Due to a few family issues I need to move the booth from it's current location to my own home to allow me to continue to produce top quality audiobooks.  Any money raised will be spent on:

  • A new garden building
  • Electrics/Networking Provision
  • Internal Soundproofing
  • Relocation of booth from exisiting site
  • Internal Decoration
  • New audio equipment to allow for tuition sessions

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise approximately £5000. The costs break down approximately to

Garden Building including base £2300
Electrics/Network Provision - £700
Soundproofing - £1300
Internal Decoration - £400
New Studio Equipment (Mic Boom, Reference Monitors, New Chair, New Headphones) - £300

Should we raise the required funds we will be able to offer a much faster, higher quality service to all our clients and help anybody in the local community who is interested in learning sound production by offering tuition to anyone who wants to learn.

The Impact

I love producing audiobooks with independant authors.  The process currently for me is quite slow due to a number of factors.

  • The amount of travel time between the house and the studio
  • Juggling work and home commitments - I have 4 boys and a long suffering wife
You ,may be asking yourself - "Why should I contribute to a project like this?  What do I get out of it?"

Good question, and here's the honest answer - You'll get audiobooks, faster, better quality and my eternal gratitude, and quite possibly my soul (slightly used). What you get personally out of it, will depend on the package you select and I will go into full details of what you can expect and when.

Risks & Challenges

In essence, this is a construction project, small in scale but huge in effect.  I will be acting as project manager during every phase of the work ensuring that every penny you pledge is a penny well spent.

In my day job in ICT, I have acted as a technical lead on a number of construction projects from a £1m youth hostel in Edinburgh to a £12M local government installation in West Lothian so I am no stranger to these types of situation and the problems that can occur.

All trades involved will be asked to set out a timetable for works to be completed and any issues addressed as they arise.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you cannot donate to this, you can still help!  Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us spread the word about what I'd like to do!  Every share will help!

    Thanks for reading

    Chris Barnes
    Dynamic Ram Audio Productions

story:
Our Story

Wildflower was founded in 2009 to meet the demands for a local women's publication in Northern Nevada. It has since become an international project with contributors from around the world. We are continuing to expand and will be releasing four large print issues this coming year.

The Impact

We call Wildflower "female-positive" -- it is a place where women can share their creativity and their stories in a respectful, inspirational setting. Women and men alike have expressed gratitude for offering a female publication that covers all subjects and aspects of women's lives, and for featuring artists who make people think and reflect through their words and visual images. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to help cover our operation costs. Printing costs are very expensive and they limit how far we can expand the publication. The magazine will continue to be available even if we don't meet our goal, but in order to make it affordable and accessible to those who may be struggling in this economy, we are trying to make each issue cost as little as possible. 


We would also like to pay our regular contributors for their hard work and exceptional art that allow the magazine to thrive. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can become a contributing writer or artist! We are always looking for new content for the quarterly print issues and the website. You can also purchase an advertisement for the print or web issues.

story:
Recto Verso is a term that refers to the "front" and "back" sides of a leaf of paper in a bound publication such as a book or magazine. TEXO VERSO RECTO means "combining back and front". I search for pages in magazines with images on the front and back that have a dialogue with each other, that when combined tell stories that are thought provoking, heartbreaking, inspiring and humorous.

My hope is by putting these enlarged images in a gallery setting, they will have a profound emotional impact on the viewer by getting them to think and see publications and the world in an exciting new way.


My goal is to enlarge and exhibit 15 enlarged images starting in Downtown Phoenix. They will  range in size from 36" x 48" to 60" x 72". The images are divided into a grid and then individual sections are then printed onto canvas panels which are then bolted together to reconstruct the original image. There are 4-6 panels per piece. This process can be expensive, running between $200 - $350 per image. This is where I need help from the art loving public. Funds will go to canvas printing, hardware, marketing and promotional items and exhibition space.

Once the works are produced, an exhibition proposal will be submitted to the Mesa Arts Center as well.


Perks are available, from a 5" x 7" print , a signed & matted 8" x 10" limited edition print, to an exhibition booklet.


Thank you!

Eric Reger

story:
In the Battle of Ideas, Aesthetics Matter

Occupy Wall Street is a lot of things. But at the core it's a conversation -- a conversation about tactics, a conversation about democracy, a conversation about in what kind of world we want to live.


For a successful conversation, parameters are defined, topics delineated. The consensus-building at Zuccotti Park works on this, slowly, methodically, setting the stage for further action.


It's a lot of talk, and a lot of effort, but, for a lot of people, it just doesn't matter. 


Why? Because to them we look like a bunch of dirty hippies.


Conversation: Over.


We Propose a Solution: Suits

We all look great in suits. To reporters, to workers, to skeptical tourists, we'll look like people to listen to, or, at the very least, to hear out. Lazy journalists won't be able to easily dismiss us and will have to actually listen to what we say. The conversation will grow out of the echo chamber and into the wider world -- where it belongs.


Suits are camouflage in the warrens of Wall Street. And there are other advantages.


Need a bathroom? Try wearing a suit. It's easy.


Want to walk past a police barricade? Put on a suit.


Let's Show Them We're Serious

In the 1960s you could fly your freak flag high. In 2011, it just looks sloppy. We are the 99 percent, but we need the support of the 60 percent who think we're just messing around.


On October 15, our crack team of well dressed artists, designers, and wardrobers will deliver racks and racks of business attire, free of charge to anyone at Liberty Square. We'll be joined by progressive tailors, radical barbers, and folks who want everyone to look great.
The way you say it matters as much as what you say. So say it in style. Say it in a suit.


What We Need and What You Get

You can help us realize this vision with your donations. Twenty dollars will put a protester in a crisp thrift store suit.


Or mail us a nice suit you're not using anymore. It’s free if you mail it from work. Here's our address:


Proper Business Attire Working Group
C/O The House of Yes
342 Maujer Street
Brooklyn, NY
11206

Extra suits and late deliveries will be donated to Threads for Success, an innovative New York City program that dresses young people in the justice system for court appearances and job interviews.

Let's get organized.


Look sharp. The whole world is watching.


Other Ways You Can Help

Post our campaign to anyone who needs to see it. 

And straighten your tie.

story:
Child of this Culture Foundation strives to change the mainstream opinion of Hip Hop Culture.  Help us reach more children by donating to our organization!  We hope to reach at least 10 cities annually and provdie over 200 children with free art, dance, and music classesa inspired by our love for the Hip Hop culture. Every $1 goes right back to the community and programming!
 
VISION: Build children’s intuitive creativity by spreading our Hip-Hop culture to the next generation.

MISSION STATEMENT:  To become the leading corporation for children’s urban arts program across the U.S. by providing the highest quality instructors and well developed classes tailored for children ages 2-18.  

Check us out on facebook or at our website: www.childofthisculture.com

story:
Tis December 15th, 2013 and I'm happy to announce that www.juliebrokken.com is live! I'm leaping for joy!  My heart if full of gratitude to all who made these next steps possible...


Onward & Upward, 12/5/2013 Rio Grande Bosque

Please go to the website and have a look. Feel free to leave a comment via the Contact page. 

For those who have been waiting to select a perk until the website went live ~ enjoy choosing your fine art photographic print, send title and/or code for your selection/s via the comment box on the Contact page with your contact info.

 

Blessings, besos, & beauty in all things, Julie



We must walk consciously only part way toward our goal then LEAP in the dark to our success.

~ Henry David Thoreau

Leap and the NET will appear...   

Hand-Tied Sinew Fishing Net with Cottonwood Floats [4WTfn1] ... an apropos image to include here.  I had the privilege of participating in and photographing the Earth Skills Gathering at the Valles Caldera National Preserve here in New Mexico over the Memorial Day weekend.



And now? a playful and curious video to 'catch' your attention...  

WHO AM I?                 

aLLo!   My name is Julie SuZaNNe BroKKeN.  

I am an artist ~ poeta ~ photographer.  I must be part frog, too, with this compulsion for leaping from creative 'lily pad' to creative 'lily pad'.  And, as you can see, I'm quite fond of water.  I am TiCKLeD PiNK to welcome you to my LeaPs aBouND Indiegogo Campaign.  

Three years ago I took another big intuitive leap and followed my dreams to New Mexico ~ my spiritual home.  Since then I've re-established my studio at the Factory on 5th Art Space and become active in the dynamic local poetry scene.  My little camera snuck up behind me to surprise and charm me with her fresh perspective and singular eye.  Her keen, playful, meditative ways have opened me to more expansive and, at once, intimate creative leaps.  'LiTTLe GRaCie' is now my near constant companion.   

Photography is the primary focus of this Indiegogo campaign, and with your help, I am certain photography is the medium that will springboard my life and living to the next level.  I've taken huge LeaPs to get this far, made pennies sing, and stretched my financial 'net' to maximum...'stretchage'. 

Read more "Who Am I?", if you wish & my full artist's blurp @   http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2013/09/leaps-abound-who-am-i.html


 

Self-Portrait at Three Sisters Volcanoes, NM & "Painted Desert Sky", Petrified Forest, AZ [4LDsw6] http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2011/10/autumn-song-in-land-of-enchantment.html


WHY AM I HERE?

I am a woman on a mission...

Part of which is to brighten, soothe and enlighten.  To facilitate healing and growth. To add some whimsy and laughter.  To invite introspection. To uplift, inspire, and foster the shifts that make our individual and collective lives better.  To celebrate our precious Mother Earth and to foster better care for her and all her inhabitants.  To live my higher purpose. 

This creative life is a calling.  No matter what medium or discipline I use to I express myself ~ photography, painting, poetry, assemblage, installation art ~ it is my hope that it invite others to reflect upon and to cherish this beloved Mother Earth and these unlikely lives we are blessed to live on this...

compelling     deeply beautiful     shadowy

light-infused     joyful     mysterious

ever-evolving     crazy     precious

confounding     mystical     miraculous

... planet!  Life is but a precious dream or magic show flowing down this bejeweled and luscious stream full of grace. 

Explore more @  http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2013_08_01_archive.html


"Twilight Apache Plume", South Domingo Baca Arroyo, ABQ, NM [3FLap1]  Find series & poem @ http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2011/11/apache-plume-pretty-medicine.html 

 

PERKS ABOUND: How to Choose Yours

 

Option One: Pick Now!  

INSTRUCTIONS FOR SELECTING YOUR FINE ART PRINTS:

NOTE:  I use The Artistic Image for my photographic print needs.  The Artistic Image is a local company that specializes in custom digital printing services using the latest state of the art digital printers.  They have a passion for photography and deliver outstanding quality.  Each print is given individual attention.  Each is archival quality. I have all my photography printed on fine art paper.  

1. Click on the GALLERY tab at the top of this page. Pick the photograph(s) you want.  Note the corresponding CODE(s).  

For more choices go to the Facebook Fan Page or the RIPPLES FROM THE CENTER blog.  Just click on the corresponding website BUTTONS at the bottom of this page.  

2.  Select the perk you want and enter your details.  Be sure to type the CODE corresponding to your choice in between brackets following your STREET ADDRESS, ie: [CODE] 

OR,  EMAIL your selection(s) to LeapsAbound.INFO@gmail.com  (Type PERK CODES as the email subject heading.)

3. Please remember to ADD SHIPPING COSTS manually to total >BEFORE< you pay,

otherwise you will have to take extra steps to receive your perks.  Prints will be shipped USPS First Class.


For print sizes up to 8x10 please add the following to your total for
SHIPMENT TO:
United States        $5.00 plus $1.00 per each additional print                                 
Canada                 $6.00 plus $1.00 per each additional print                              
Everywhere Else   $8.00 plus $1.00 per each additional print
For larger print sizes up to 16x20 please add the following to your total for  SHIPMENT TO:
United States        $7.00 plus $2.00 per each additional print
Canada                 $10.00 plus $3.00 per each additional print
Everywhere Else   $15.00 plus $4.00 per each additional print

FOR QUESTIONS or more info E-MAIL: LeapsAbound.INFO@gmail.com

"Johnny's Tepee", Valles Caldera Preserve, NM  [ACtp4s] There's a story here and it has everything to do with "The Lone Ranger" movie and then some...


Option Two: Pick Later! 

When JULIESUZANNEBROKKEN.COM goes live you'll be able choose from the full collection. You'll be able to use the amount of your contribution as credit on my new website at the same 'LeaPs aBouND' rate.  You will have an entire year to make your selections. 


Lavender Loves Iris [3FLir3]  


WHAT WILL I DO?  

In PHASE ONE I Will:

CREATE JulieSuZaNNeBroKKeN.com websiteCREATE JulieSuZaNNeBroKKeN.com website.

PRINT & PROMOTE my photographyPRINT & PROMOTE my photography.

EXHIBIT my works @ 5G North Gallery, ABQ, NM at the Factory on 5th Art Space with local press and media promotion, participation in First Friday/Albuquerque ARTScrawl. EXHIBIT my works @ 5G North Gallery, ABQ, NM at the Factory on 5th Art Space with local press and media promotion, participation in First Friday/Albuquerque ARTScrawl. 

As this process progresses I'll take evermore leaps... PHASE TWO, THREE, and BEYOND...  One-of-a-kind encaustic photography, photography transfers onto my three-dimensional assemblages, interactive installations, community projects and more!  Details for Phases Two and Three @ http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2013/09/leaps-abound-what-will-i-do.html



Soul of an Iowa Oak [3TS3]  An old pamphlet mythologized that "Iowa" means "beautiful land" in the language of the Sauk and Fox Peoples.  But Iowa's beauty is not a myth.  


THREE WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

1. YOU CAN MAKE A FINANCIAL CONTRIBUTION

2. YOU CAN DONATE EQUIPMENT, SOFTWARE, SUPPLIES, ET AL.  Listed @ http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2013/09/leaps-abound-what-to-i-need.html  Your donation equals perks, too!

3. YOU CAN HELP SPREAD THE WORD.  I know some folks just can’t contribute  but you can still participate by telling your friends about this campaign in any of the following ways:

a. E-MAIL:  Just email this VIDEO or LINK to friends.

b. 'LIKE' my FACEBOOK FAN PAGE and share it with others who might be  interested.  Click the corresponding website BUTTON at the bottom of this page.

c. SIGN UP for 'RIPPLES FROM THE CENTER', my blog, and receive new posts as they are published about once a month.  Click the corresponding website BUTTON at the bottom of this page


  

"Hydrangea Blossoms ~ Posing" [5STfh3]  &  "Dervishing Rose: Quiet Dawn Awakens" [5STwr2] more in this series @ http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2011/11/autumn-rose_16.html

WHAT DO I NEED?  

In Order of Priority:

$350   ~ Website Fee
$1200 ~ New Computer
$900   ~ Updated Camera & Equipment
$500   ~ Printing Costs for Exhibit
$500   ~ Fee for month month show @ 5G Gallery North 
$500   ~ Adobe Photoshop CS5   (Adobe Photoshop Elements 11) donor wishes to remain anonymous!   I am so blessed by you... you know who you are!  GRiN!

aBoVe & BeYoND!  Monies over the goal amount will be applied to Phases Two & Three.  Full Details @ http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2013/09/leaps-abound-what-to-i-need.html

          

ReaDY?  SeT... LeaP!

Watch for updates...

  "Mr. FRoG" [2ANfr2]

THANK YOU!

My heartfelt gratitude for your time, your support, and your belief in my life's creative work.  It matters ~ beyond measure.

Heaps of gratitude to the LeaPs aBound Team and all the folks who have already leapt in:  Barbara Scheopf, Linda Bailey Zimmerman, The Austin Famila, Carla Trees and Brian Haymond.

Laughter and thank you's to my 'LeaPs aBouND!' pitch video cast and crew:  Patty Brokken, camera and voiceover; Madison Brokken, Morgan Brokken, Dalton Smith, and Casey, the Cat all starring as themselves.  Special thanks to Chris Brokken for his computer savvy.  A shout out to Stewart Warren for reworking a pair of audio clips and making them... well... audible.  Acknowledgements to Archive,org's Community Audio for The Sounds of Nature Collections by Gaia.  http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/  

And to all who have purchase my DVD single, 17 BREATHS: Inhale.Exhale ~ thanks for believing in my poetry and photography, and moreso, my vision. 

Beauty in all things ~ love and grace.

Julie SuZaNNe BroKKeN


Perception itself is a form of grace.

Diane Ackerman, A Natural History of the Senses
story_txt:
Tis December 15th, 2013 and I'm happy to announce that www.juliebrokken.com is live! I'm leaping for joy!  My heart if full of gratitude to all who made these next steps possible...



Onward & Upward, 12/5/2013 Rio Grande Bosque
Please go to the website and have a look. Feel free to leave a comment via the Contact page. 
For those who have been waiting to select a perk until the website went live ~ enjoy choosing your fine art photographic print, send title and/or code for your selection/s via the comment box on the Contact page with your contact info.
 
Blessings, besos, & beauty in all things, Julie






We must walk consciously only part way toward our goal then LEAP in the dark to our success.
~ Henry David Thoreau

Leap and the NET will appear...   



Hand-Tied Sinew Fishing Net with Cottonwood Floats [4WTfn1] ... an apropos image to include here.  I had the privilege of participating in and photographing the Earth Skills Gathering at the Valles Caldera National Preserve here in New Mexico over the Memorial Day weekend.



And now? a playful and curious video to 'catch' your attention...  

WHO AM I?                 
aLLo!   My name is Julie SuZaNNe BroKKeN.  

I am an artist ~ poeta ~ photographer.  I must be part frog, too, with this compulsion for leaping from creative 'lily pad' to creative 'lily pad'.  And, as you can see, I'm quite fond of water.  I am TiCKLeD PiNK to welcome you to my LeaPs aBouND Indiegogo Campaign.  
Three years ago I took another big intuitive leap and followed my dreams to New Mexico ~ my spiritual home.  Since then I've re-established my studio at the Factory on 5th Art Space and become active in the dynamic local poetry scene.  My little camera snuck up behind me to surprise and charm me with her fresh perspective and singular eye.  Her keen, playful, meditative ways have opened me to more expansive and, at once, intimate creative leaps.  'LiTTLe GRaCie' is now my near constant companion.   
Photography is the primary focus of this Indiegogo campaign, and with your help, I am certain photography is the medium that will springboard my life and living to the next level.  I've taken huge LeaPs to get this far, made pennies sing, and stretched my financial 'net' to maximum...'stretchage'. 
Read more "Who Am I?", if you wish & my full artist's blurp @   http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2013/09/leaps-abound-who-am-i.html



 


Self-Portrait at Three Sisters Volcanoes, NM & "Painted Desert Sky", Petrified Forest, AZ [4LDsw6] http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2011/10/autumn-song-in-land-of-enchantment.html



WHY AM I HERE?

I am a woman on a mission...
Part of which is to brighten, soothe and enlighten.  To facilitate healing and growth. To add some whimsy and laughter.  To invite introspection. To uplift, inspire, and foster the shifts that make our individual and collective lives better.  To celebrate our precious Mother Earth and to foster better care for her and all her inhabitants.  To live my higher purpose. 
This creative life is a calling.  No matter what medium or discipline I use to I express myself ~ photography, painting, poetry, assemblage, installation art ~ it is my hope that it invite others to reflect upon and to cherish this beloved Mother Earth and these unlikely lives we are blessed to live on this...
compelling     deeply beautiful     shadowy
light-infused     joyful     mysterious
ever-evolving     crazy     precious
confounding     mystical     miraculous
... planet!  Life is but a precious dream or magic show flowing down this bejeweled and luscious stream full of grace. 
Explore more @  http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2013_08_01_archive.html


"Twilight Apache Plume", South Domingo Baca Arroyo, ABQ, NM [3FLap1]  Find series & poem @ http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2011/11/apache-plume-pretty-medicine.html

"Johnny's Tepee", Valles Caldera Preserve, NM  [ACtp4s] There's a story here and it has everything to do with "The Lone Ranger" movie and then some...

Soul of an Iowa Oak [3TS3]  An old pamphlet mythologized that "Iowa" means "beautiful land" in the language of the Sauk and Fox Peoples.  But Iowa's beauty is not a myth.  

THREE WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

2. YOU CAN DONATE EQUIPMENT, SOFTWARE, SUPPLIES, ET AL.  Listed @ http://juliebrokken.blogspot.com/2013/09/leaps-abound-what-to-i-need.html  Your donation equals perks, too!

3. YOU CAN HELP SPREAD THE WORD.  I know some folks just can’t contribute  but you can still participate by telling your friends about this campaign in any of the following ways:

a. E-MAIL:  Just email this VIDEO or LINK to friends.
b. 'LIKE' my FACEBOOK FAN PAGE and share it with others who might be  interested.  Click the corresponding website BUTTON at the bottom of this page.
c. SIGN UP for 'RIPPLES FROM THE CENTER', my blog, and receive new posts as they are published about once a month.  Click the corresponding website BUTTON at the bottom of this page

story:
The New Deck Order (NDO) was formed with the idea of reaching out to Cardists all over the world, and to bring them closer together. We currently run #15secondcardistry on Instagram, and School of Cardistry on YouTube.

Involving 10 Cardists across 5 different countries, the Cardistry of Southeast Asia DVD is the largest Cardistry project ever. Get to know these masters who are constantly pushing the boundaries of this art, and gain insights from the creative minds of the hundreds of practitioners in the region.

These 10 cardists are:

  • Rama Dimasatria from Indonesia, Champion of CDM 2011
  • Terry Lu from Thailand, Champion of CCC 2011
  • Abie Jie Assegaff from Indonesia, Champion of Dan and Dave's Smokes and Mirrors V7 Trailer Contest
  • Yang Nguyen, Semi-finalist in WKC 2014 (ongoing)
  • AJ Arandilla from Philippines, Top 8 in WKC 2014
  • Khanh from Vietnam, Top 16 in WKC 2014
  • Amsyar Fikri from Malaysia, Top 16 in WKC 2014
  • Zombieflourish from Vietnam
  • Ilyta from Vietnam
  • David Gooi from Malaysia

Jaspas Deck will also be giving lectures in Hanoi, Ho Chi Minh City, Bangkok, Kuala Lumpur, Jakarta and Manila.


Update 22 March 2014: Today we announce 2 MORE Cardists joining our star-studded crew of 8 in this amazing DVD. The 2 new additions, Abie Jie and Yang Nguyen, are both award-winning Cardists. Abie Jie was the champion in Dan and Dave's Smokes and Mirrors V7 Trailer Contest, and Yang Nguyen is currently a semi-finalist in the on-going World Kardistry Championship.

We've spent months searching for something special to present to you. Something different.

The DVD itself features moves from 8 Southeast Asian Cardists. There will also be footage of the lectures and jams that will be held while we are in each location. Find out what goes on in the minds of people on this side of the globe! If you get the physical copy of the DVD, it also comes with an insert full of photography, comments and notes from the tour.

Other perks include a limited-edition deck of cards specially designed for this project. These cards are only available with a purchase of the DVD. You might notice that the court cards have been changed. These look great for spinning moves like the Pirouette, and provide a more consistent look for displays.

Jaspas Deck's S.E.A. Tour Lecture Notes are a 60-page set of notes detailing his 12 years of experience as a Cardist. In it, he talks about everything from how to improve your skills, to live performances and creating moves. A large portion of the notes are dedicated to videography basics, tips and tricks.


*The above images are of prototypes, actual products may vary.

We've already spent a couple thousand dollars to get this project started. These include setup costs and costs of prototypes for the perks. 

Transport and accommodation make up majority of our expenses for the tour, as we are spending two months traveling across 5 countries. Other expenses include production costs, lecture venue rental and our day-to-day expenses.If you've been in the community for a while, you probably have lots of Cardist friends, many whom you've never met as they are spread all over the world.

Let us bring them to you.

This project will be the precedent for further documentaries of Cardistry scenes around the world. We're looking forward to meeting all of you guys everywhere and sharing your Cardistry with the rest of the world.

Also, 10% of our profits will be donated to the Philippines Red Cross for the Typhoon Yolanda disaster that happened in November last year. 

We really appreciate if you could help to share this project on your social media profiles. 

Southeast Asian Cardists, please support the project by joining us for the lectures and jams in your respective countries. We look forward to meeting you soon!

story:
In a Nutshell

I’m leaving NYC soon to embark on a life-changing service project with Kiva (www.kiva.org), in the northeastern region of India.  As a Kiva Fellow, I will be assisting local entrepreneurs get loans and learn about other services, such as healthcare, education, and savings to pick themselves up out of poverty.  This area is grossly underserved and is the  “poorest of the poor” in India, where most of the people live on less than $1.25 a day.   

My job will be working with the Kiva partner (Microfinance Institute) on all things business and operational but a good portion of my time will be spent visiting rural villages (36 in surrounding areas) to gather the stories (photography & film) of the people (mostly women) receiving the loan for their business.   

Show Me Your Light Project aims to give kids the opportunity to express themselves through photography, open their hearts through the storytelling of their experiences  and honor their creative spirit as it runs wild.  Above all, I want to infuse an outrageous amount of fun into these kids lives and explore ways of bringing themselves more into the light.  I intend to celebrate our little Light Seekers (ages 6 - 15 ) by having a weekly exhibit at a community center where the whole village will be invited to come together.  

Your contribution to this project has the possibility of changing a kid’s life.   It’s a universal truth that humans have dreams, but for people living in these conditions, they may not be identified yet, until someone “gets in there” with them and believes that their dreams are valid and worthy.  I don’t think of this as a photography class so much,  but a way to use this tool to give these kids a way to identify another perspective, and hopefully a dream that's ready to see the light of day.


I will be moving on to Africa in about 4 months and plan to take this same project there.  

** The slideshow are images taken by my little Indian friends in March 2012 and by myself.    

Here’s what I need to make this happen:


  • 15 camera (but of course, I can use more, if the funding comes in).  These will be point & shoot cameras at $160 each.  (Total = $2,400)

  • Portable printer at $250

  • Image quality paper = $50

  • TOTAL = $2,700

The Impact

It’s my truest joy to make an intimate connections with people using photography and then show them something about themselves they have yet discovered, or needed a visual to re-discover.   Such as, a deep truth, or soulful story behind a subject’s eyes or a sexy sway that came out into the light.   These moments feel like a journey home to me.  

On my last trip to India I brought an extra camera, which I gave to the street kids to use as they showed me their city. On every occasion, these kids were bursting with excitement and wanted to show me everything single thing about their home, their interests, their family and friends.  It seems so simple to me, but all of these kids couldn’t believe that I trusted them with my camera and that I wanted to know more about them, beyond the tourist clicking cameras in their faces as they beg to be paid.  They ended up showing me a profound way to define home.  Therefore, it’s my mission to expand this gift to the kids I’ll meet in India and Africa in a fun, interactive expression of the uses of light, texture, color and perspective through photography.   

Could photography pave the way for a new life for these kids?   Join me in trying!

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for your contribution; every little bit will be received with such gratitude and appreciation!!  Your gift will light up these kids world, I guarantee it.   

If you cannot contribute at this time, and would still love to see this project to the light of day, please consider sharing this with your family and friends (real and virtual) or just sending lots of love to the kids in this region.   

Thanks you for your support and being a transformative light in the world!

Much love,

Eileen


Email: eileenflannigan@gmail.com

story:
"R1 "- A Short Film

In a world not too different than ours, a lonely teenaged girl gets the surprise of her life when her dad comes home with a gift: the robot "R1." In the midst of what is supposed to be a routine "tune-up" she wrecks more than she can fix on her own, and must figure out the best way to salvage the situation before her dad returns home.

In the midst of what is supposed to be a routine "tune-up" she wrecks more than she can fix on her own, and must figure out the best way to salvage the situation before her dad returns home.

story:
What's irevuo?

irevuo started off as a nice idea. We wanted to build a platform dedicated to promoting indie artists. An online magazine which would review self-published books, showcase painters, musicians, photographers, graphic artists.

Then we decided to publish a magazine, which would be available in print and digital formats.

Which we did.

 

The digital edition of our January issue is available for free. And it's going to stay so.

You can download the PDF version here.

Each issue will have a main theme. This month's topic was self-publishing. Next month's going to be photography.

What we need

In order for irevuo to promote indie artists, we need exposure. That's why we're offering our magazine for free.

And for the same reason, we want to make irevuo available for iPads, iPhones, Android Smartphones, and Kindle.

But in order to do that, we need the following:

  • Adobe Digital Publishing Suite, Single Edition - an impressive piece of software designed for this very job - creating and publishing interactive content. 
  • an iOS Developer Program Account, which is another $99 per year.

Each month we want to buy a piece of software that will allow us to expand our reach, also allowing us to better promote indie artists.

 

What you get

Advertising in our magazine. Merchandise. Some other cool stuff.

Other ways you can help

Some of you just can’t afford to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Spread the word around. Share our campaign with your friends. The more people find out about irevuo, the more changes we have to reach our goal.
