story:
We're proud to announce that Turner Prize nominated artist David Shrigley is Patron of The Young Gallery! David is passionate about supporting the Glasgow based project having lived and worked in the city since gaining his Bachelors in Fine Art at the Glasgow School of Art in 1991.

David said:

“I became involved with The Young Gallery because I want to give something back to the city that I live and work in. Through The Young Gallery, Impact Arts gives a quality artistic experience to 300 children living in the East End of Glasgow each year, and to over 1000 members of the local community and I’m excited to be involved with such a brilliant project.

“I’d like to help children in Glasgow to realise the practical, social and emotional benefits of creating artwork and I’ll be working with Impact Arts to help The Young Gallery fulfil its aims of transforming lives and providing a legacy for children in the East End and across Glasgow.”

So what does this mean for our crowdfund? Our £50, £100, and £1000 rewards all include a limited edition invitation designed by David (and for the £100 +£1000 rewards signed by David!) to an auction event Impact Arts is hosting in summer 2014. There are only 150 of these special invitations available so pledge now to avoid disappointment!

Visit our website for more Information.

http://www.impactarts.co.uk/content/david-shrigley/


We are pleased to announce that people can now lend their social support and online influence by joining our Thunderclap campaign. Thunderclap is a platform through which a message can be promoted through social media utilising crowdsourcing. Instead of asking people to pledge their support financially, the service lets individuals “donate” the use of their social media channels in order to blast one message from multiple sources at the same time, hopefully creating a ripple effect of awareness. Our Thunderclap page for The Young Gallery crowdfund can be found here.




Hi, we’re the Development Team from Impact Arts, a national community arts charity based in Scotland! Impact Arts works with people aged 0-100 helping them to use the arts to create positive lasting change in their lives. In short we come up with creative solutions to social challenges like improving future life prospects, reducing youth unemployment and preventing isolation amongst older people.

We’re Crowdfunding £15,000 for our project The Young Gallery. Based in the East End of Glasgow, it is Scotland’s first and only space dedicated to exhibiting children’s art work. 92% of children in areas of multiple deprivation do not take part in any arts activities and in the East End between 30-50% of children are living in poverty. The Young Gallery is Impact Arts’ vehicle for helping children experience the importance of creativity and for celebrating their boundless imaginations!







With your help, we need to raise £15,000. This will help us to work with 300 more children living in the East End an area undergoing wide-scale regeneration.

Here’s how The Young Gallery works:

· Children take part in 8 art workshops

· Liz leads them on a journey of creative discovery

· Workshops culminate in a beautiful, professional exhibition of children’s artwork at the   gallery just like real artists!

· Parents, teachers, friends and family are invited along to celebrate the children’s             achievements


We’re aiming to raise £15,000 to work with 300 children, but every penny we raise will go towards engaging children in the arts.  





A creative experience means more to a child’s development than just creating art:

“A strong foundation in the early years increases the probability of a healthy happy child – a weak foundation increases the odds of later difficulties, sometimes lasting through a child’s life.”*

At the moment The Young Gallery programme is only available in Glasgow, but our dream is to make this programme available to help celebrate children’s imaginations all over the world.  We’ve started small but we’re dreaming big!


What will you get for helping us to achieve our goal?


Your name on the internet! Ok, so you can get your name on the internet for free, but does it have the added warm and fuzzy feelings?



When was the last time you received something beautiful in the post? It’s normally just bill after bill… But for just £10 we will send you a beautiful postcard of original artwork that’s guaranteed to brighten up your day when it lands on your mat!

+ Website thank you




Getting your name on the wall normally involves graffiti and a hefty fine – avoid this by paying a mere £25 and guarantee your place into our Young Gallery Hall of Fame!

+ Website thank you & TYG art postcard




As well as being included on our Young Gallery Hall of Fame this is also your golden ticket to an exhibition/auction of artwork  curated by our Patron David Shrigley, including his work, and work by other leading contemporary artists (TBA) that will be taking place in the Summer of 2014.  The invite will be exclusive designed by David, and it is strictly invite only so essentially your £50 gets you something priceless!

+ Website thank you, TYG art postcard & your name on the gallery wall




£100 will get you a David Shrigley designed and SIGNED invite to the exhibition/auction event, which includes work by David himself. This will be part of a limited run of 150. You will also get a limited edition print by one of The Young Gallery’s budding young artists. Who knows, they could end up being a Picasso of the future, so this is an investment worth making!

+ Website thank you, your name on the gallery wall & exclusive exhibition


A specially curated exhibition is normally only within the grasp of the rich and famous, but for £1000 you too can have beautiful art work grace the walls of your choosing *UK only. For more information on our Arthire service click this link: http://www.impactarts.co.uk/content/projects_arthire/. You'll also receive an invite to the auction/exhibition event designed and SIGNED by David Shrigley! 

+ Every other perk — Including the signed invite to the exclusive exhibition!




We’re looking to raise £15,000 but if you don’t have pennies to spare it doesn't mean you can’t help us make an impact. Please share this with friends, family and colleagues and get them shouting about how children’s creative experiences can change the life of child. 


*Source: Joining the Dots: A Better Start for Scotland’s Children An Independent Report by Professor Susan Deacon, The Early Years Matter
story_txt:
We're proud to announce that Turner Prize nominated artist
David Shrigley is Patron of The Young Gallery! David is passionate about
supporting the Glasgow based project having lived and worked in the city since
gaining his Bachelors in Fine Art at the Glasgow School of Art in 1991. 
David said: 
“I became involved with The Young Gallery because I want to
give something back to the city that I live and work in. Through The Young
Gallery, Impact Arts gives a quality artistic experience to 300 children living
in the East End of Glasgow each year, and to over 1000 members of the local
community and I’m excited to be involved with such a brilliant project.
“I’d like to help children in Glasgow to realise the
practical, social and emotional benefits of creating artwork and I’ll be
working with Impact Arts to help The Young Gallery fulfil its aims of
transforming lives and providing a legacy for children in the East End and
across Glasgow.” 
So what does this mean for our crowdfund? Our £50, £100, and
£1000 rewards all include a limited edition invitation designed by David (and
for the £100 +£1000 rewards signed by David!) to an auction event Impact Arts
is hosting in summer 2014. There are only 150 of these special invitations
available so pledge now to avoid disappointment!
Visit our website for more Information.
http://www.impactarts.co.uk/content/david-shrigley/

story:
ANTHRO CALENDAR STRETCH GOAL

Voucher use has change check Backerkit FAQ. Voucher covers the cost of 1 calendar. No shipping covered. If you are no longer interested in supporting the project do to this i'll gladly refund you.

$45 000 - ANTHRO CANTER CALENDAR

You will be able to select one or the other. Only super fan editions will get both. If you want both simply support again at calendar level. Please note that due to the lateness of offering this product the  ANTHRO edition may be delayed by a month. Artist are being contacted now so I will update with a list when I can.

UPGRADING
there is technically no way to upgrade your support level. You may do the 2 following things. 

1) Support again and make up the difference and we will contact you post project to ensure the final desire reward level. 

2) Simply buy the new reward level and we will use the initial support funds to pay for shipping then refund you the rest at shipping time.

FAQ Update

Q:Anthro Edition Digital files?!
A: They come with digital copy. You now get both calendars for the price of the one. They are bundled.

Q: I want both physical editions 
A: Support at 30 Again for another physical copy of Anthro Edition

Q: WIll there be Anthro editions of the Dakimakura?
A: Maybe?! I will run it across the all access members

Q: Can I get some of this stuff AFTER the funder?
A: Absolutely! It will go up on the store and you will be able to purchase it. If you are a calendar supporter (30 and up) you will receive a coupon code for a discount on the store.

Q: Why are there multiple versions of Super Fan. 
A. Super fan edition gets your name right on the cover. I wanted to limit how many names appear on the cover to avoid a calendar full of names. 

Q: Do 55/70 LEvels get Physical copies of the Calendars?
A: Yup

Q: Who automatically gets a an Anthro Edition?
A: $70 and up will automatically get an Anthro Edition

Q: Can We pick wich calendar we want with the voucher
A: Yes! Supplies permitting.

Q: Anymore figurine Options?
A: Just the one.

Q: 180 perk gets how many calendars?
A: 3. Special edition (human) and regular editions of both anthro and human

Q: Will there be sexy version of anthro
A: My entries will have modified versions yes. I cant guarantee all artist will do this.





Canter Calendar 2014: Girls Night Out is the 2nd edition of the Canter Calendar series

Canter Calendar 2014: Girls Night Out This year's Calendar theme focuses on each girls unique Friday night experience! The final product will be exact same shape and quality as 2013's Edition. 12x20inches. Shipping for early December.

Missed out on Canter Calendar 2013?
If you missed out on 2013's calendar you may add it to you by adding $15 to your support level.

Swag Bonus?
Swag bonus will be a tier level ($55 and up) that will allow you to gain access to merchandise. As the project increases funds, merchandise options for Swag bonus will increase. This means you will gain more selection as the project hits milestones. This will allow you to customize what your calendar comes with to best match your personal taste and interest. Swag will be able to be purchased post project! There will be an offer to purchase extra swag at a discount for supporters at the delivery stage.

Digital Edition
Digital editions will include high resolution digital copies of the calendar and a desktop version. Artist Edition will include PSD\SAI files, sketches, videos and other elements artists have collected.

*PoniParade Voucher Info Lower Down


Current Artists Involved

♦ Doxy (Dash, Trixie)

♦ Poporito

♦ Ehryel

♦ Maniac Paint

♦ Brekkist

♦ MegaSweet

♦ GashiGashi

♦ Polarity Plus

♦ Nasoshi

♦ Atryl

♦ Sui
♦ Shepherd




SWAG LEVEL 1 (Project Funded)

BTW SWAG MEANS MERCHANDISE, I'M NOT USING IT UNDER ANY OTHER CONTEXT. THE WORD IS CORRECT AND NOT BEING USED IN THE MEME\INTERNET JOKE SENSE

You may have 1 and only 1 of the options as they are unlocked. Rewards named "Upgrade" are merch rewards that will be additionally added to Swag level and up regardless of the Swag option you chose. Please note swag may delay you shipment of the calendar if you chose to have both shipped at the same time depending on the speed at which we can receive these from factory. If you are concerned stick with the poster.

TO CLARIFY 55, 70,125 levels get 1 single item options marked by a letter.

A) Poster (Folded by default, Tubes will be available upon shipping request phase)

SWAG LEVEL 2 (12000$)
Artists get an additional 50$ each 
Upgrade (+1 Button)
B) Dakimakura - Body Pillow slip case (Art to be announced)

SWAG LEVEL 3 (13500$)
Upgrade (+1 Additional Button)
C) Dakimakura second option (Art to be announced)

SWAG LEVEL 4 (15000$)
Artists get an additional 50$ each 
Upgrade (+1 Additional Button)
Sexy Version of option B&C (4 Dakimakuras to chose from in total) 

SWAG LEVEL 5 (24000$)
Artists get +50$ bonus
Special Edition Supporters Only, 1 Figurine per Perk
D) 6 Inch Tall Resin Figurine. PLEASE NOTE: Figurine making process is time consuming. It could take up 6-8 months for delivery of this item.

SWAG LEVEL 6 (27000$)
F) Sketchbook 10.5x7.5in 150 pages

SWAG LEVEL 7 (30000$)
E) Dakimakura 3rd option (Art to be announced)


Optional 
Dakimakura Pillow insert +$20 (This will increase shipping cost)



FAQ


Q. When will I receive the digital edition 
A. As soon as the books are printed and start being shipped to supporters the digital edition will be sent   

Q. Will we see dakimakuras before its over. 

A. Yes im drawing them tonight!

Q. Sexy versions?
A. Just like last years :)

Q. Canter Calendar 2013 addon what do I get?
A. Calendar and Special Edition Digital File

Q: Can I buy Calendar, button, poster..etc... post project

A: Yes but probably your best deal is to get it now.

Q: How do I upgrade?
A: Sadly indiegogo has no good method of upgrading and having you pay the difference with a second perk complicates it to no end. What is best for now is to support at the new level. Post project we will put aside some of your addtional funds from the lower perk to shipping and then either provide an option to purchase other things or be compensated.

Q.I want to upgrade my reward level.
A: Indiegogo suggest you purchase another reward level to match up. I'm going to insist you purchase a brand new reward level at full price. We will use the previous reward funds for shipping and refund the rest at shipping time.

Shipping 

Shipping will be handled after project funding. We will contact all supporters with a form for their specific location to give a accurate cost estimate for shipping. Current General shipping Quotes are the following. Please note these are cost averages and not final quotes.  

One Calendar  

CAD $6 
US $10 
EUROPE-INTERNATIONAL $18 

Note: Shipping can be expensive! It is something entirely out of our control how much we are charged to ship. THAT SAID we are making and effort to contact fulfillment services and alternative shipping companies to reduce the current quoted prices. If we manage to severely reduce cost of shipping we will pass the savings down to you, either by adding bonus swag or by financial compensation based on feedback and our own discretion. 

PoniParade Voucher 

If you supported PoniParade at a level which you received a Calendar Voucher, you will receive an email regardless of if you support this project or not so you do not have to do anything for your copy. 


 If you have a voucher from poni parade you may trade for 1 free calendar for your order. 
If you wish to use your voucher for a digital edition please wait for shipping time for this product you will be contacted.

This is the only way to do it without creating a huge reward management mess.


Unfortunately, I will not be able to cover shipping even though stated on that project page. I understand some of you may be unhappy with this. It was a mistake and if I follow through with that promise, the project costs will double (nearly 16k) which is unreasonable. I will hold copies at Brony-Con for those who wish to receive it then without shipping cost. Thank you for understanding this matter.

story:
ARTZ TO GO (http://cityoftheworld.org/artz-to-go-2/) 

City of the World Inc. (COTW) is a nonprofit art organization founded by Rosalind Knight, which was incorporated in 1996. Knight, an artist and teacher realized the importance and need to promote the arts. Our mission - To promote the arts in Las Vegas, Nevada and the world.

THE PROBLEM : ARTS CUT FROM VEGAS SCHOOLS

Three years ago families and the public schools system in Clark County, Nevada became financially stressed. Year round schools were shifted to serving students only eight months out of the year. A gap widened for students who relied on school during the summer months for food and art instruction, which they found therapeutic. 

With no more year round schools, children had no summer arts program and worse yet, some did not have food.

THE SOLUTION : ARTZ TO GO SUMMER and YEAR ROUND PROGRAM

Artz to Go is a traveling arts program that focuses on servicing the needs of the Las Vegas Valley by providing arts education including music, literacy, theater and visual arts.

Providing “Artz to Go” creates a place where a child’s world expands. Many of the Las Vegas inner-city families have not had the opportunity to venture out of their neighborhoods to appreciate the arts. Artz to Go allows local art school teachers to enter inner-city neighborhoods and bring color, visual art, theater, and music classes to these children and their families.  

We have -

- 3 Buses
- Custom Wrap of Each Bus with Artz to Go Design by Vector Media
- Department of Motor Vehicle Registration for Each Bus
- Insurance Paid Until August 2013
- Partnership with City of Las Vegas Parks and Recreation Department to service Huntridge Park, Freedom Park, Lorenzi Park and Stupak Community Center
- City of Las Vegas  Marketing and Advertising
- Applied for Summer Food Program to provide Breakfasts to At Risk Youth in conjunction with the Nevada Department of Education and Three Square
- Received donation of arts supplies from the City of Las Vegas Cultural Affairs Department

We need - 

- Art Supplies of Any Kind
- Books for All Ages
- Rhythm Instruments New Or Used in Good Condition
- Insurance  
- Gas (Natural Gas, Diesel)
- Storage Containers
- Pop Up Tents
- Foldable Tables
- Chairs

Important to Note:  2 buses run on natural gas and 1 bus runs on diesel.   Artz to Go has received a donation from Big Bus Tour Company 3 months of diesel gas and 1 year of maintenance.

Summer Program - Four mornings a week the buses go to dedicated sites in Clark County to provide for communities and families to participate and create art, music or read at no cost to participants.

Fall, Winter, Spring Program - Saturday programs run during the fall, winter and spring when the summer program is on hiatus.

Year Round Artz To Go Program - A rolling art exhibit, the Artz to Go buses, can be filled with local art and brought to many locations, such as school sites, parks and community gatherings.

...

Contact cityoftheworld702@gmail.com if you have any questions or require additional information.

Roz Knight, Founder, President, Executive Director

Website - http://cityoftheworld.org/artz-to-go-2/ 

City of the World is proud to partner with: Las Vegas First Friday Experience/Kids Zone, Farmers Market Fresh 52, Children’s Heart Foundation of Nevada, The Children’s Autism Foundation of Nevada, Henderson and Summerlin Arts Festivals, Very Special Arts of Nevada and the Las Vegas Chess Club.

THE SOLUTION : ARTZ TO GO SUMMER and YEAR ROUND PROGRAM
Artz to Go is a traveling arts program that focuses on servicing the needs of the Las Vegas Valley by providing arts education including music, literacy, theater and visual arts.
Providing “Artz to Go” creates a place where a child’s world expands. Many of the Las Vegas inner-city families have not had the opportunity to venture out of their neighborhoods to appreciate the arts. Artz to Go allows local art school teachers to enter inner-city neighborhoods and bring color, visual art, theater, and music classes to these children and their families.  
We have -
- 3 Buses - Custom Wrap of Each Bus with Artz to Go Design by Vector Media- Department of Motor Vehicle Registration for Each Bus- Insurance Paid Until August 2013- Partnership with City of Las Vegas Parks and Recreation Department to service Huntridge Park, Freedom Park, Lorenzi Park and Stupak Community Center- City of Las Vegas  Marketing and Advertising- Applied for Summer Food Program to provide Breakfasts to At Risk Youth in conjunction with the Nevada Department of Education and Three Square- Received donation of arts supplies from the City of Las Vegas Cultural Affairs DepartmentWe need - 
- Art Supplies of Any Kind- Books for All Ages- Rhythm Instruments New Or Used in Good Condition- Insurance  - Gas (Natural Gas, Diesel)- Storage Containers- Pop Up Tents- Foldable Tables- Chairs
Important to Note:  2 buses run on natural gas and 1 bus runs on diesel.   Artz to Go has received a donation from Big Bus Tour Company 3 months of diesel gas and 1 year of maintenance.
Summer Program - Four mornings a week the buses go to dedicated sites in Clark County to provide for communities and families to participate and create art, music or read at no cost to participants.Fall, Winter, Spring Program - Saturday programs run during the fall, winter and spring when the summer program is on hiatus.
Year Round Artz To Go Program - A rolling art exhibit, the Artz to Go buses, can be filled with local art and brought to many locations, such as school sites, parks and community gatherings.
...
Contact cityoftheworld702@gmail.com if you have any questions or require additional information.
Roz Knight, Founder, President, Executive Director
Website - http://cityoftheworld.org/artz-to-go-2/ 
City of the World is proud to partner with: Las Vegas First Friday Experience/Kids Zone, Farmers Market Fresh 52, Children’s Heart Foundation of Nevada, The Children’s Autism Foundation of Nevada, Henderson and Summerlin Arts Festivals, Very Special Arts of Nevada and the Las Vegas Chess Club.

story:
What We're Up To

For the past 11 years, Omaha has been sending a team of slam poets to the National Poetry Slam. In that time, our teams have made it to the 8-team semifinal round twice, have been named Best of the Rest once, performing on Finals Stage, and featuring poets such as Individual World Poetry Slam finalist Dan Leaman and Zedeka Poindexter, who was selectd for the Women of the World Poetry Slam in 2013.

Omaha has a vibrant and thriving poetry scene, hosting the second-largest youth poetry festival in the country with Louder Than a Bomb Omaha, and the bi-annual Great Plains Poetry Pile-Up. It's a wonderful community, and it needs your support.

This year, the National Poetry Slam is in Boston, and we need YOUR help to get there.

What We Need

Your money will go to support the cost of travel, room, and board in Boston throughout the competition. There will be 80+ teams making the same trip, and members of the team plan on competing in other poetry events tied to Boston, such as the Nerd Slam and the Poetry Decathlon. Your money goes toward making an already talented and gifted group of poets even better, to teach them lessons that they can bring back to Omaha, for both other members of the community and the students that the team members teach.

What You Get

We've got a lot of great perks to offer, as you can see to the right.
 
First and foremost, and most affordably, the work of our poets. You can get our chapbook shipped to your door for $8, a digital copy of our album for $10, or for just $15, a physical copy of both our chapbook and album.
 
There are a lot of additional perks available beyond that, from custom poems to art and design work from team members, even team shows at venues of your choosing.

The Impact

You'll be sending Omaha's strongest voices in this art form to a place where they can hone and grow their skills, which will enrich Omaha's own artistic community upon their return.

And remember, several of the team members are teachers, so the lessons they learn in Boston will enrich the next generation of poets and artists in Omaha as well.

How Else You Can Help

Spread the word! Use the share tools here to let people know about our trip!

story:
Short Summary

Votive Dance is a Halifax based dance company, founded in 2012 by Kathleen Doherty & Stephanie Mitro to provide more choreographic and performance opportunities for professional dance artists. Votive presented a full length show as a part of the 2012 Atlantic Fringe Festival entitled Wish.Desire.Vow. Other performances by the company include, The Beginning (2012), An ARTful Evening With Votive Dance (2013), In Bloom (2013), In Our Element (2013) and guest performances with Maritime Dance Performance Group (2012 & 2013) and Coastal Dance Theatre (2013).

This campaign is to raise money for Votive's newest project, Shedding Suffixes. Shedding Suffixes is a full length show which will debut at the Neptune Scotiabank Studio Theatre in Halifax on November 2 & 3, 2013. The show features dancing and choregraphy by four local artists: Rhonda Baker, Kathleen Doherty, Stephanie Mitro & Amanda Stafford. Shedding Suffixes is based on a poem written by local, and recently published emerging poet, Chantelle Rideout. 

All four members of Votive Dance have been busy in the studio over the last number of months, creating a beautiful show to bring to the Halifax public. The four women share a tremendous love of dance, and need your help in bringing it to life on the stage. By contributing to this campaign you are helping to present new and exciting work, gain exposure for this emerging dance company and enriching the lives of Haligonian audiences.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise about $2000 to cover the costs associated with the show, we are hoping to reach half of that amount through this campaign
  • The total cost for renting the theatre for 3 days is about $2500. The first day in the theatre is for set up alone, day two is for technical rehearsals and opening night, day three is for the second show and clean up.
  • Why does it cost so much to rent the theatre? There is a daily rental fee, hourly rates for mutliple technicans, ticket set up and printing fees, and other staff who are paid hourly such as: Front of House Manager, Ushers, Box Office Attendant and a Bar Tender. All of these costs must be covered by Votive Dance.

As a thank you for donating to our campaign you can receive unqiue perks such as

  • Hugs!
  • Post cards
  • Program shout-outs
  • Invitations to rehearsals
  • Tickets to Shedding Suffixes
  • Performances by Votive Dance

The Impact

  • Professional dance is an extremely important part of our city, heck, it's an extremely important part of the world! Dance and art brings meaning and magic to life, brings communities together, and celebrates the beauty and simplicty of life. Votive Dance is trying to bring a little more of that beauty and joy to Halifax, but can not do it without your help.
  • Shedding Suffixes brings together multiple art forms, an act that Votive Dance hopes to continue doing in future projects.
  • Let's celebrate art and dance together!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute, you can still help us!

Please spread the word about our campaign. Via Facebook, email, word of mouth, or the Indiegogo share tools- every mention of our project helps!

Thank you, and you'll see us on stage November 2 & 3!

story:
THE INSPIRATION: A passionate, indomitable leader, Dr. Pantoja (1922-2002) sought to empower Puerto Ricans and other Latinos through education, advocacy and the leadership development of its youth. 

THE VISION: To create a public art mosaic mural celebrating the life Dr. Pantoja and the vibrant community of El Barrio while enhancing the cultural awareness and civic participation of our youth. 

THE CREATOR: You. Donate today!


Here are some of the items we are offering for your donation.


For a $25 Donation: Monthly updates on the status of the mural project.




For a $50 Donation:  2 passes to El Museo Del Barrio.



For a $100 Donation:  A copy of Dr. Pantoja's book "Memoir Of A Visionary Antonia Pantoja".



For a $250 Donation: A copy of Lillian Jimenez's documentary on Dr. Pantoja "¡Presente!".



For a $500 Donation: An exclusive limited edition hand made etching of Dr. Pantoja created by renowned muralist and public work artist Manny Vega. 



For a $1000 Donation: A digital reproduction of a Juan Sanchez print done in honor of Dr. Pantoja.

Sanchez was awarded a John Guggenheim Foundation Fellowship in 1988.  His work has been exhibited at many places in New York, such as: The Metopolitan Museum of Art, the Musuem of Modern Art, The Whitney Museum of American Art, El Museo Del Barrio, and in the Caribbean at the Instutiue of Puerto Rican Culture in San Juan, and Casa de las Americas and El Centro Wilfredo Lam in Havana.

story:
Our Story

We have come together in honor of Chloe Dzubilo, we are asking our community to contribute to our fund to put on a event that will honor her activism, and life. Proceeds will be used to pay all expenses for this event, any proceeds left over will be donated to her favorite causes: Visual AIDS (Visual AIDS utilizes art to fight AIDS by provoking dialogue, supporting HIV+ artists, and preserving a legacy, because AIDS IS NOT OVER) and Return To Freedom ( Return To Freedom is dedicated to preserving the freedom, diversity and habitat of America's wild horses through sanctuary, education and conservation, while enriching the human spirit through direct experience with the natural world.)

.

Chloe Dzubilo  Trans-activist, equestrian, punk rock star, visual artist, recovering human, mother to many children, sister, lover, long-time survivor. Chloe advocated tirelessly for transpeople, addicts,  and people living with HIV locally and beyond. She lived her singular vision of equality for all with fierce kindness, humor and reverence.




photo credit: Michael Sharkey

story:
Poniéndole fotos a la música

Banda Sonora es un proyecto en el que he trabajado desde hace más de un año. La idea es que elijo una canción para usarla como concepto creativo en la producción de un ensayo fotográfico.
Hasta ahora he hecho dos canciones, una de las cuales produje en forma de revista.

Ultimamente he investigado sobre la fotografía estereoscópica y pensé que una buena forma de hacer la tercera entrega de la banda sonora sería llevarla al formato de viewmaster. De eso se trata este proyecto, de poder producir un reel de viewmaster con mis fotos. 

Por supuesto todo lo acompañaré de una página web donde pueda mostrar material inédito y subir videos del detrás de cámaras que muestren cómo trabajo y cuáles son mis motivaciones personales frente al proyecto.
También pienso hacer impresiones limitadas de algunas fotos inéditas para entregar a las personas que hagan donaciones.


Garantía


Prometo llevar a cabo este proyecto como sea.
Prometo usar todo tipo de cámaras durante el proyecto.
Prometo mostrar qué equipos uso y cómo los uso.
Prometo responder todas las preguntas que tengan que ver con fotografía.
Prometo divertirme.
Prometo enviarle lo pactado a cada patrocinador.


Cómo usaré el dinero

El dinero recaudado se usará para cubrir los siguientes costos: modelo, alquiler de locación, maquillaje, producción de un video del "making of", dominio de internet, hosting, impresión de 100 copias sorpresa, producción de 25 reels de viewmaster, compra de 25 visores negros de viewmaster, gastos de envío. 
Esta es la única forma de financiación que tengo contemplada. De no llegar a la meta, enfocaré todo mi esfuerzo primero a enviar los productos prometidos a mis patrocinadores y segundo a producir el reel para viewmaster.


Cómo más ayudar 

Rieguen la noticia. Entre más gente sepa y se interese, más posibilidades tendré de llevarlo a cabo.

Spread the word, the most people finding out and getting involved, the more chances the project will see the light.

Quién es el creador de Banda Sonora

Mi nombre es Juan Felipe Rubio, soy un reportero gráfico y fotógrafo de matrimonios colombiano. También me gusta mucho hacer fotos de música en vivo. Prefiero trabajar con luz natural o disponible y me gusta ser reservado cuando trabajo, casi invisible. Colecciono cámaras de diferentes formatos y soy abierto a usarlas todas dependiendo de lo que exija cada ocasión. Los temas que más me interesan son los sociales.

story:
Hi.  I'm Jaclyn Spencer, but please, call me Jacki.  I'm an artist, herbalist and writer.  I've been an artist pretty much since my parents let me begin playing with crayons and paper as a toddler, and truly it is what I am even more than what I do.  I began studying herbs as a young woman, first for culinary purposes, and it quickly became a lifelong love affair in all ways, from growing herbs from seed to using them for every possible purpose.  

I began writing in the mid-1990s, first for parenting sites, then for gardening sites.  My work is all over the spectrum, though I keep returning to herbs.

Over the past decade a number of friends have encouraged me to write a book about herbs, but how to best achieve this eluded me until this February when I sat down to draw and decided to draw an herb for every letter of the alphabet.  Now I'm driven to write the text and create a masterpiece of herbal art and knowledge.

With decades of experience in both art and herbalism, and a number of successful articles under my belt, I am ready to take this project to completion, with a little help from my friends.

What We Need & What You Get

To work on the project effectively, I need materials- paper, ink, etc., for both the digital draft and the hand-crafted finished work, plus the postage for shopping the finished work around to publishers. 
The perks are all related to the work- prints of the art from the book, right up to a first pull copy!  Any amount will help keep the ball rolling until the work is ready to be published, so toss your coppers in the pot if you can- $1, $10, $100- it all matters.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Spread the word!  Share us on Facebook and whereever else you hang out!
  • Use the share tools here on Indiegogo!

story:
ChingonX Fire Exhibition Catalog

We seek your help in securing funds to create an exhibition catalog for ChingonX Fire Exhibit. To present and showcase the elevated talent and artwork of the exhibiting artists.

Short Summary:

ChingonX Fire is a group exhibition curated by April Garcia. The exhibit features womxn-identifying and non-gender specific artists whose artwork is tied to activism, feminism, cultural and gender identity storytelling, environmental protection, and socioeconomic parity.

April Garcia has been working on the curation of ChingonX Fire exhibit for 2.5 years. Now she is asking for your help to produce a professional-quality catalog that will accompany the exhibit and showcase the elevated talent and artwork of the featured artists of ChingonX Fire Exhibit.

The catalog will include statements and exhibiting art images from each of the artists in the exhibition. 

Take a look at the exemplary artwork of the featured artists by viewing their websites of past and ongoing artistic exploration.

Featured Artists:

  • Dominique Indigleaux Cunningham - http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/dominique-i...
  • Valerie Chaussonnet -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/valerie-cha...
  • April Garcia -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/april-garcia/
  • Chia Guillory -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/chia-guillory/
  • Tsz Kam -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/tsz-kam/
  • Rosemary Meza-DesPlas -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/rosemary-me...
  • Rurru Mipanochia -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/rurru-mipan...
  • NIZ -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/niz/
  • Bonnie Ramsey -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/bonn-ramsey/
  • Miki Rodriguez -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/miki-rodrig...
  • Lys Santamaria -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/lys-santama...
  • Megan Solis -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/megan-solis/
  • Katelena Hernandez Cowles - http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/katelena-he...
  • Suzy Gonzalez -  http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/suzy-gonzalez/
  • Marie Montalvo - http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/marie-monta...
  • Mirabella Chauvin - http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/mirabella-c...
  • Jessica Gritton - http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/jessica-gri...
  • Delilah Rose Knuckley - http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/delilah-ros...
  • Abi Mallick - http://www.chingonxfire.com/artists/abi-mallick/

We need to raise $5,000 to cover the costs for

  • Professional Photographer
  • Professional Graphic Designer
  • Printing and Distribution of Exhibition Catalog
  • Artist Honorariums
  • Exhibition Costs

What you get when you contribute to our project

Mas Chingon Package $1,000 - You are a badass for helping us out!

  • (3) Exhibition Catalogs
  • (3) T-Shirts
  • (2) Enamel Pins
  • (2) Vinyl Stickers of Exhibition Logo
  • Your name listed on the Donor page in the catalog (anonymous donor option available)
  • Thank You card from the curator.

Mas Chingon Package $500 - You are a badass for helping us out! 

  • (3) Exhibition Catalogs
  • (3) T-Shirts
  • (2) Enamel Pins
  • (2) Vinyl Stickers of Exhibition Logo
  • Your name listed on the Donor page in the catalog (anonymous donor option available)
  • Thank You card from the curator.

Chingon Package  $250 - You are a badass for helping us out!

  • (2) Exhibition Catalogs
  • (2) T-Shirts
  • (2) Enamel Pins
  • (2) Vinyl Stickers of Exhibition Logo

ChingonX Fire Exhibition CatalogWe seek your help in securing funds to create an exhibition catalog for ChingonX Fire Exhibit. To present and showcase the elevated talent and artwork of the exhibiting artists.Short Summary:ChingonX Fire is a group exhibition curated by April Garcia. The exhibit features womxn-identifying and non-gender specific artists whose artwork is tied to activism, feminism, cultural and gender identity storytelling, environmental protection, and socioeconomic parity.April Garcia has been working on the curation of ChingonX Fire exhibit for 2.5 years. Now she is asking for your help to produce a professional-quality catalog that will accompany the exhibit and showcase the elevated talent and artwork of the featured artists of ChingonX Fire Exhibit.The catalog will include statements and exhibiting art images from each of the artists in the exhibition. Take a look at the exemplary artwork of the featured artists by viewing their websites of past and ongoing artistic exploration.Featured Artists:

story:
UPDATE: EXCITING NEWS! We have a FINAL milestone for our online fundraising effort!  We only need $8000! Our team is applying for grants and we are hopeful that we can be awarded the remaining amount through other foundations and local organizations. Let's work together to reach our new goal! 

FINAL UPDATE: Our campaign has ended at $8000! Combined with the over $6500 here added to the $1500 that an offline partner plans to contribute to the project at the local level -- the mural is truly off to a strong start! Next step is to continue the grant writing! If anyone would like to make an offline contribution please message us on our Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/molokainuiahinamural

Mahalo nui loa!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Short Summary

Eo Molokaʻi.  Knowing that we have talent here on Molokai - our hui set out to brainstorm about how to build on this largely untapped, extraordinary resource of people and history of this beloved island. An invitation was made and kokua is coming! In the form of a seasoned, committed caring hui of professional artists who have created permanent, world class murals at the Sheraton Helumoa, Waikiki; Hawaiʻi Convention Center; Kaupa, Kalihi Stream; Camp Mokuleia; and the Bishop Museumʻs Pacific Hall. 

We on Molokaʻi, will all be working together to create a mural to showcase the talents in the Molokai community. Our work is slated to begin in January 2016 and will be painted in March. You are invited to join in our process affirming this Islandʻs rich stories and the creativity of a generation of folks - it's kupuna-elders, makua-parents, and opio-youth.  

(Enjoy the short video trailer above of our first small project!)

Mural Project Description

Starting in 2016 a Hawaiian-inspired community mural project and educational initiative incorporating island stories, indigenous themes and cultural symbolism will be created through a gathering of artists and creatives from the Molokai community — along with invited mural artists from Oʻahu. The mural will be painted by a team of kanaka maoli artists and a hui of young art students and assistants. Education is an integral component of this effort.

A precursor to the painting of this innovative mural project involved outreach and interface with the local school community on Molokai through the efforts of artist/educator Maile Naehu and Hanohano of Hui o Kuapā - the Loko iʻa of Keawanui Fishpond.  The intention was to build a grassroots arts community of resident and local talent. 

As native culture will be highlighted throughout the work done for this important project, kanaka maoli aesthetics and iconography will unify elements that will weave Hawaiian moʻolelo (stories) of reverence and aloha for land, sea and sky, and respect for others. 

The goal of this mural is to provide an opportunity to experience, first hand, true community and intergenerational collaboration through the visual arts. This project will offer visitors and residents alike a clear visual voice of the people of Molokai.  The hope is that every one who views the mural will feel, in some way, included in it— we must find ourselves in each other, recognizing one another as family and not strangers.

There are four supportive cultural ideologies that will feed into a larger mural theme. They include:

Ho’oko - To set and achieve goals and aspirations. To be a well-rounded community member.

Ho’omana - To elevate energies and activate the mana which connects all living things.

Ho’ola - To give the energy of life to. To heal or live a healthy lifestyle.

Ho’opono - To do what is necessary to be righteous. To behave in a respectable manner.

When you contribute to this campaign, your dollars will:

  • Provide for the necessary tools, art supplies and drafting/construction materials needed to complete the panels/banners;
  • Support the continuation of traditional Native Hawaiian stories, language, and practices in a contemporary arts environment;
  • During outreach, inter-generational workshop activities and mural making week provide for transportation (work trucks and vans) food (fresh and locally sourced), and basic accommodations needs for 36 artists, their parent/guardian, and kupuna (they will stay where the mural is being painted);
  • Support the further development of these newly nurtured youth artists from Moloka'i through a gift of art supplies, a series of follow-up visits, co-created educational initiatives, and community service projects at the grassroots;
  • Provide for master artist honorariums in collaboration with our local hui to mahalo their creative and intellectual contribution to the process over the course of a year which includes historical research, preparations, sketches, art workshops on Moloka'i, open to the public art classes, onsite mentoring, painting, and mural exhibition.

When completed, the mural will consist of (8) 5X8 ft. panels/banners and will measure 40 ft. long by 8ft. tall.  They will present a Hawaiian worldview richly layered and grounded in the lore of this beloved island. 

Ours is a vision of collaboration and shared wisdom as we collectively look at the opportunities and challenges presented by living in an interdependent world today.

Mural Project Timeline

From October through December 2015 arts integration community classes will be offered for free to public on Molokai. These classes will teach art through media, cultural graphic design and visual arts. This space also serves as a recruitment tool for the mural project. We have just been given the green light to expand from 8 students to 24 who aspire to bringing their creative gifts to the project.

On December 12, 2015 an full day field trip with all the artists on the mural team will take place. Artists will visit sites that are significant to Molokai’s people and learn the mo’olelo (stories) of these places. Aloha ‘Aina will be the theme of many of the stories shared. This will serve as an important piece in the process and allow for further planning and collaboration. 

In January 2016 master artists will visit Molokai once again to experience the annual Makahiki ceremonies and festivals. This will serve as a time to better learn and immerse themselves in the people, culture and traditions of Moloka’i. Preparations and conceptual designs will be consulted upon based on what is learned.

The mural project week is from March 19-25, 2016. In order to complete a project of this magnitude 7 days and nights at Keawanui, a fishpond on the East end of Moloka’i, have been scheduled. A totally immersive mural making process will occur during this time. Shared creative space will guide the group. The panels/banners will be constructed, painted, and displayed for viewing with the cooperation of 36 artists.

Collaborators

Meleanna Meyer

Meleanna has garnered praise and awards for her work as a Native Hawaiian artist, filmmaker, and arts educator. Ms. Meyer is committed to social justice issues by helping those she works with find their voice through the visual arts. She has also lived & studied in Italy & France, receiving her Bachelor of Arts in Design-Photography(Honors) from Stanford University and her Masters of Arts in Education from the College of Education at University of Hawai’i -Mānoa. An East-West Center, APAWLI and Salzburg fellow she is cognizant of the need to honor all cultures and wisdom traditions, yet her grounding is deeply Hawaiian.

As a community champion and builder who believes in the power of the arts and culture to transform lives, she values the talents each person has and strives to bring out these gifts with everyone she works with. Meleanna is a published writer and illustrator whose commitment to underserved groups in her native Hawaiʻi is well recognized. A gifted teacher, she was recently awarded the Kumu Kukui award, 2014 for her excellence as a master teacher. A recent publication of her work as an educator in the visual arts is forthcoming. As a committed community artist she is well known for leading and orchestrating large mural works with a talented and remarkable team of professional artist colleagues, (Al Lagunero, Harinani Orme, Carl Pao, Kahi Ching and Solomon Enos) apprentices and students. The majority of this artist hui will be working on Molokaʻi during the mural project with the community. 

Maile Naehu

My name is Maile and I am a designer/artist/teacher from Lahaina and now live on Molokai. I have been a hula practitioner for over 30 years and a speaker and educator of 'Olelo Hawai'i, the Hawaiian language for 20 years. I was raised in a family of artists and I raise my children surrounded by the arts coupled with the Hawaiian language and practices as well. My husband, Hanohano is a kia'i loko (fishpond guardian), a paniolo and a hunter. We have 3 beautiful keiki together and Aloha 'Aina is our way of life.

As a fashion designer and owner or Leialoha By Maile. I wish to inspire the lifestyle of simplicity and sustainability as this is our lifestyle. In light of this,  I only use recycled and upcycled t-shirts to fashion each piece. Each shirt is dyed in the stream water that feeds into my home workshop, and dried on the line in my backyard. I especially enjoy gathering and dyeing with Traditional Hawaiian dyes. I also use other non-native plants dyes, alaea(medicinal red dirt), and teas. 

I am a Kumu for 'Olelo Hawai'i, Creative writing, Performing Arts, Slam Poetry and Visual Arts. In all of my instruction I embed the Hawaiian language and value system. I am also a graduate of UH-Manoa, Kamakakuokalani, with a B.A in Hawaiian studies. Due to my 6 years in Punana Leo and Kula Kaiapuni, followed by 6 years with Kamehameha schools, both as a Kumu I have become well trained in various teaching philosophies and learning practices. Some of my favorites teaching strategies are founded in native intelligence and traditional learning. Moenaha, Na Honua Maoli Ola, and tribes are my constant influences in curriculum planning. I also write original scripts and some of the hula, oli and mele are composed by myself. I emphasize the great importance in holding on to traditions but understanding that our language and culture are living and always growing.

story:
I am launching a campaign to try and fund a month long art residency located in upstate New York located in Wassaic, NY. I was invited by the amazing curator, Emma Katz, the founder of Recession Art Gallery. However, I will not be working during my time there. So, I need your help getting supplies, paying for travel, and covering any sort of debt that will accrue during my time in April.
 As a performance artist who has a passion for creating installation based work, one of my biggest struggles has been finding the time and space while living in New York to create my visions. With your help, I will be able to solely focus on generating work for myself, for the sake of furthering my artistic career while creating a new body of material that I feel is not currently represented in the Art world the way it should be. I refuse to back down in life and bring forth that same energy in the work I create. 
 Please help me reach my goal! 


Here is a link of Emma Katz
http://emmabkatz.com/
Link of the art residency
http://wassaicartistresidency.org/info/

story:
Short Summary

This current film is being developed and produced by undergraduate seniors and graduates from The University of New Orleans. We’ve worked in various short films with happy results, always with a huge passion for our job.

This new film is a story about hope, how it can be lost and found in certain parts of life, and how love can be a huge factor in regaining hope. This film is important to us because we have a strong desire to tell the story and show our visions as filmmakers. 

Contributors will help us achieve the final look we want for our film, either with set decorations or extra equipment. Also, to have a safe and conformable environment for our crew. With the help of contributors, this film can be made as good as we dream of it.

What We Need 

Our current budget is of $800. This money is going to be use for the design of the set, the different props we will be using, getting extra equipment, the feeding of our crew, reimbursing gas, expendables for the different departments, and for any different factor in order to portray our vision.

The Impact

This is a valuable campaign because it helps young filmmakers grow and tell a beautiful story. We want our story to conscious people of a problem that can be unspoken or misunderstood. Show people that in different ways a solution can always be found. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are different ways people can help. Donating is not the only option. If you enjoy our campaign, please get the word out and share it to you friends, Indiegogo has the necessary sharing tools. And most importantly, enjoy the video and wait for the film.

story:
A bit about us...

Hello! We are textile design students studying at Cardiff Metropolitan University. After 3 years of intense work and inspirational projects, we would now love to exhibit our final projects and designs at New Designers 2015 in London, so we can hopefully find contacts and gain experience to make us ready to face life in this scary industry!

As poor students scraping by with little money after spending ridiculous amounts on materials, printing and coffee... we desperately need some help to fund the exhibition, transport and accommodation! 

Where you come in...

We will be grateful for any donations, however big or small and are willing to reward generous donations with postcards of some of our designs!

Altogether New designers is costing over £3000, so we are fundraising in anyway possible to raise some of this money.

Other ways you can help...

If you can't spare any cash, please spread the word out for our campaign and share this link on any media sites!


Thank you so much! Every little helps and we will be so grateful. See you at New Designers 2015 in London if you can make it!

http://www.newdesigners.com/
story_txt:
A bit about us...
Hello! We are textile design students studying at Cardiff Metropolitan University. After 3 years of intense work and inspirational projects, we would now love to exhibit our final projects and designs at New Designers 2015 in London, so we can hopefully find contacts and gain experience to make us ready to face life in this scary industry!
As poor students scraping by with little money after spending ridiculous amounts on materials, printing and coffee... we desperately need some help to fund the exhibition, transport and accommodation! 
Where you come in...
We will be grateful for any donations, however big or small and are willing to reward generous donations with postcards of some of our designs!
Altogether New designers is costing over £3000, so we are fundraising in anyway possible to raise some of this money.
Other ways you can help...
If you can't spare any cash, please spread the word out for our campaign and share this link on any media sites!

Thank you so much! Every little helps and we will be so grateful. See you at New Designers 2015 in London if you can make it!
http://www.newdesigners.com/

story:
About campaign



Gifty is something that you’ll see on the faces of your nearest and dearest. It’s their emotions. Admiration, tenderness, pleasure, and the joyful moments they get. Beaming smile of your mom, encouragement of your dad, delight of your loved one. Gifty for everybody. With no exceptions!!!




Gifty is not just a hobby for us . We’re inspired with the idea of making something really extraordinary. Making Gifty we add warmth of our hands and love of our hearts and pay exceptional attention to details. And the result is really gorgeous and perfectly handcrafted greeting cards.


see more on Behance




 








 




 



  



 


 


Every single detail is scrupulously selected by us, so you may find a greeting card for any celebration. Few hours of meticulous work – and the hearts of your nearest and dearest are filled with flutter of pleasure.






- To extend the project
- To make the project available and easy-to-use for you
- To help you making each of your greetings unique, special and unforgettable.
We guarantee to do as follows:
- Comprehensively care about every detail of the Gifty and implement interesting ideas of our handcrafters
- Assess delivery time and accordingly manage the deliveries within the dates agreed upon with you
- Keep you informed at every phase of your order execution





The Gifty Team is grateful to everyone funding our project!

story:
LE PROJET

La résidence de Sébastien Gaudette a pour objectif de questionner le syndrome de la feuille blanche, tout en amenant le public à découvrir son processus créatif. Durant son séjour d’exploration, l’artiste va créer au sein de l’Espace Cercle Carré à Montréal (maquette, prototype d’installation, dessins, sketch, sculpture) pour aboutir à une exposition, ainsi qu’à une journée de présentation, et de conférence. Venez découvrir le processus créatif de l’artiste et assister à la métamorphose d’une galerie en véritable laboratoire expérimentale.

La résidence aura lieu à l’Espace Cercle Carré, situé dans le Vieux-Montréal, du 9 au 15 avril 2016. Ce projet est une invitation à la découverte du travail de l’artiste mais aussi à la réussite de la résidence et de son atelier public. Le financement commence à 5$, jusqu’à 500$ mais n’oubliez pas que vous pouvez participer également en partageant le projet sur les réseaux sociaux !


Suivez les actualités sur :

Facebook https://goo.gl/3VOvL6

Instagram https://instagram.com/sebastien_gaudette/

Visitez le site web www.sebastiengaudette.com


CE DONT NOUS AVONS BESOIN

Le financement permettra la mise en œuvre de la résidence de l’artiste Sebastien Gaudette à l’Espace Cercle Carré de Montréal. 

Pour la réussite du projet de résidence nous avons besoin :

- budget matériel (plaques d'aluminium, rouleaux de papier)

- budget communication (vidéo, flyers, affiches)

- budget recherche (conférence, exposition)

- budget atelier (ouvert au public)


CE QUE VOUS OBTENEZ

De 5 à 500$, choisissez votre contrepartie :



LE PROJET

Dans le cadre d’une résidence à l’Espace Cercle Carré, l’artiste Sébastien Gaudette tentera de réaliser des essais explorant le papier sous plusieurs formes. Sa pratique artistique tourne essentiellement autour du papier froissé et de ses propriétés plastiques. Ses pistes de réflexion puisent leur inspiration dans le thème du syndrome de la page blanche. Les œuvres seront travaillées par le froissement, le pli, le déchirement, le chiffonnement et l’affaissement. Des dessins, des sculptures ainsi qu’une installation seront réalisés dans l’espace de la galerie qui sera changé en un véritable laboratoire. Le public sera convié à venir découvrir cette recherche lors d’un vernissage. Une conférence sous forme de discussion animé par l’artiste ainsi qu’un atelier de création pour le public, conclura la résidence. La résidence aura lieu à Montréal du 9 au 15 avril 2016 à L’espace Cercle Carré.


BIOGRAPHIE

Depuis quelques années, on a pu voir régulièrement le travail de Sébastien Gaudette. Ses œuvres ont été sélectionnées pour plusieurs projets d’expositions dans de grands établissements québécois, notamment au Musée des beaux-arts de Mont-Saint-Hilaire, au Centre national d'exposition de Jonquière, au Musée du Bas-Saint-Laurent de Rivière-du-Loup ainsi qu’au siège social du Cirque du Soleil de Montréal. De plus, en 2012, son travail a été présenté lors d’une grande exposition solo à la galerie de l’École d’Art d’Ottawa (ÉAO). L'artiste a reçu plusieurs mentions honorifiques et plusieurs de ses œuvres font maintenant partie de diverses collections publiques et privées. En 2014, il fonde le projet LAB/Dessin qui est un laboratoire de recherche où l’exploration des notions hybrides du dessin et les différentes formes de créations en collectivités sont mises de l’avant. Ce collectif de quatre artistes met surtout l’accent sur des projets où le dessin tente de s’émanciper vers de nouvelles avenues, tout en profitant à chacun dans sa pratique personnelle. Sébastien détient un Baccalauréat en arts visuels et médiatiques de l'Université du Québec à Montréal. L'artiste vit et travaille à Montréal.


ESPACE CERCLE CARRÉ

Espace Cercle Carré est un organisme sans but lucratif constituée le 10 mars 2010. Lieu de rencontre, d’échange et de création, Espace Cercle Carré est situé dans le quartier Griffintown, aux limites du Vieux-Montréal. Il offre un lieu de création et de diffusion artistique pluridisciplinaire inspirant, convivial, inclusif, dynamique et ouvert sur son quartier et sur sa ville. Cet espace contribue à l’éclosion artistique de la relève, et participe à l’élan de réhabilitation de l’espace urbain et de revitalisation culturelle du Vieux-Montréal.


Espace Cercle Carré 
36, rue Queen, espace 101
Montréal (Québec)  H3C 2N5

Espace Cercle Carré 36, rue Queen, espace 101Montréal (Québec)  H3C 2N5

story:
Greetings!

We are an artist/author team working on a blog called HistoriaVivensArtis. We offer colorable illustrations accompanied by story, poetry, or information on the topic. You can check it out at Vivens Historia Artis.

We would like to take this idea to the next level and produce some printed volumes- Legends of The Isles Vol. I is the first in a series of books inspired by history, lore, and literature.

The final product will be a ~30 page 8.5x11 paperback book. An ebook version will also be available, as well as some fun items like notecard sets, colorable stickers, and premium loose leaf versions of the books.

We have some fantastic rewards for our contributors, everything from pre-orders of the ebook up to a custom piece on the subject of your choosing. We appreciate your help in our efforts to bring a little more beauty into the world. Let's make art together!

Stay tuned for more updates as the project progresses, here or at our site:

VivensHistoriaArtis

story:
- - English Version (Spanish below) - -

CADEART – art as a statement for solidarity, integrity, cultural diversity and tolerance 

In times where right populism, racism and national isolation is advancing once again, not only in the United States, but also across Europe, we want to take a stand and set a visible example of the exact opposite – cultural diversity and open minds without prejudices will help us unite.

Therefore we, el Cartel del Arte, are organizing an international Mexican street art festival with representative Mexican artists in collaboration with German mural artists, who are going to create murals in Hamburg and Berlin. From the 17/06/19 – 17/06/25 we will organize paintings all over the city, photo and art exhibitions by our protagonists, traditional markets and a memorable open air. Additionally we will hook up with another art festival in Berlin to paint parts of the old Berlin Wall, that we try to transfer to Hamburg and maybe afterwards to Mexico City as a memorial. 

We were able to win some of the best mural artists from Mexico and Germany for our mission.

Golden Green


 

DXTR


 

Seher


 

Smithe


 

Stohead


 

...will leave a massive footstep in Hamburgs city centre.

There is so much more then the stereotyped portrayals about Mexico. We want to show the real face of the Mexican culture through all its urban and contemporary disciplines. 

We team up with local influencers in Mexico like Mercadorama and TonyDelfino to build strong relationships to build bridges and fight borders.

 

Why should you...? 

We know there are plenty ways, next to our project, that could make this a better world. But with your donation you will help us to create a message for cultural diversity, tolerance and solidarity, that is as unique as important! Displayed at the heart of Hamburg and visualized for the public.

If we reach the goal we will be able to

  • buy the flight tickets for the artists from Mexico
  • cover costs for accommodations and travel of all artists
  • cover costs for stuff, paint and walls

But beside helping us to realize the festival every act of donation will get back an awesome reward as we really appreciate your support. You are going to love them, if you are an art lover and appreciate their works.

 

We <3 projects in Mexico

With the money we raise during the festival we are going to support charities in Mexico. One of the projects is by the FUNDACIÓN PRO NIÑOS DE LA CALLE who cares about kids from the street.

 

 

Spread the word. Stop the hate!

Share with you friends and family to make our project happen for one of the best causes there might be: TOLERANCE.

 

Who we are

We are members of Mercadorama Europe and Urbanskills. Sons of urban contemporary art who believe in the mind changing power of art. We bring together our networks and forces to build a peaceful protest and counterbalance towards intolerance and disparagement.
 
 

We say THANK YOU and Mexico is the shit!

 

- - Spanish Version - -

CADEART - El arte como una declaración de solidaridad, integridad, diversidad cultural y tolerancia 

En tiempos en los que el populismo, el racismo y el aislamiento nacional avanzan una vez más, no sólo en Estados Unidos, sino también en toda Europa, queremos tomar una posición y dar un ejemplo visible de lo opuesto exactamente: la diversidad cultural y la mente abierta sin prejuicios nos ayudará a unirnos.

Por lo tanto, el Cartel del Arte, organiza un festival internacional de street art mexicano, con artistas mexicanos representativos y en colaboración con artistas alemanes, donde crearan murales en Hamburgo y Berlín. Del 17/06/19 al 17/06/25 se esta planeando realizar pinturas en toda la ciudad, exposiciones fotográficas y artísticas de nuestros protagonistas, mercados tradicionales y un memorable open air con buena música. Además nos juntamos con otro festival de arte en Berlín para pintar partes del antiguo Muro de Berlín, que tratamos de trasladar a Hamburgo y quizás después a la Ciudad de México como un monumento conmemorativo.

Tuvimos la oportunidad de adquirir algunos de los mejores artistas del street art de México y Alemania para nuestra misión.

Golden Green


 

DXTR


 

Seher


 

Smithe


 

Stohead


 

... donde dejaran un pedazo masivo en el centro de la ciudad de Hamburgo.

Hay mucho más que las representaciones estereotipadas sobre México en Alemania y queremos mostrar otra parte del verdadero rostro de la cultura mexicana a través de todas sus disciplinas urbanas y contemporáneas. Y claro lo chingon que es México! 

 

 

Nos unimos a influenciadores locales en México como Mercadorama y TonyDelfino para construir relaciones fuertes y luchar fronteras.

 

Por qué deberías apoyar…? 

Sabemos que hay muchas maneras junto a nuestro proyecto, que podría hacer de este un mundo mejor. Pero con su donativo nos ayudará a crear un mensaje para la diversidad cultural, la tolerancia y la solidaridad, que es tan único como importante! Que se mostrara en el corazón de Hamburgo y se visualizará para el público.

 

Si alcanzamos el objetivo, podremos

  •      Comprar los tickets para los artistas mexicanos
  •      Cubrir los costos de alojamiento y viajes de todos los artistas
  •      Cubrir los gastos de material, pintura y paredes

Pero además de ayudarnos a realizar el festival, cada donativo recibirá una recompensa impresionante y única, ya que realmente apreciamos su apoyo. Vas a amarlos, si eres un amante del arte y apreciar sus obras.

 

Tenemos <3 proyectos en México

Con el dinero que recaudamos durante el festival vamos a apoyar a las organizaciones benéficas en México. Uno de los proyectos es la  FUNDACIÓN PRO NIÑOS DE LA CALLE que se preocupa por los niños que viven en la calle.

 

 

Difundamos la palabra. ¡Detengamos el odio!

Comparta esto con sus amigos y familia, para hacer posible este proyecto  y apoyar una de las mejores causas que puede suceder hoy en día: TOLERANCIA.

 

Quiénes somos

Somos miembros de Mercadorama Europe y Urbanskills. Personas que aman y apoyan  el arte contemporáneo y urbano. Reunimos nuestras redes y fuerzas para construir una protesta pacífica y contrapesar hacia la intolerancia y el menosprecio.

 

Les agradecemos de antemano y todo corazón y enseñemos lo chingon que es México!

story:
In the most powerful combination to date, Android Jones and his team are creating an art installation at Burning Man in 2017 that includes his latest Microdose VR  Interactive Virtual Reality Technology plus the 360 Fully Immersive Film, Samskara.

 

Microdose VR Interactive Art Installation

 

Microdose VR is defining a new medium of artistic expression never before possible.  It combines art, music, and dance into a real-time virtual reality gaming experience.  This project combines custom built software, android's artwork, and several HTC Vive stations  which allows participants to control the world inside the dome.  We’re excited to bring a personal VR experience into a collective experience that everyone can enjoy

 

 

 

Samskara 360 Immersive Film

SAMSKARA is a stunning, fully immersive, full dome film of specially designed 360-animations and soundscapes produced in collaboration with Fulldome Lab.  A unique approach combining  digital technology and modern design.  It penetrates the viewer’s entire experience, pushing the boundaries of imagination through specially designed animations and soundscapes.  

 

 

Working with his team, Android was able to transpose his art into the 3D world, and you’re able to experience this world inside a state of the art dome staring up into an unending universe that fills your senses to get a visceral experience of not just viewing art but having art explore itself through you.  

Samskara is based on ancient Vedic tales and Sanskrit mantras. A journey through consciousness, beyond the mind, to discover the inner self, Samskara takes the audience from creation, through evolution, corruption, conflict and destruction, to eventual rebirth and a path to enlightenment.  It is easily the most visually and auditorially stunning piece of art we've ever seen to date.

 

 

Samskara creates a radical ritual experience which provides you the opportunity of viscerally stepping inside these incredible visionary art pieces - a vast array of  powerful images and symbols with messages built in but in a world so expansive that you can interpret the art in ways that connect uniquely to your subconscious mind.
 

 

Help Us Bringing it to Burning Man in 2017!

The project is complete but requires rental and transport of cutting edge projection and sound equipment and a Full Dome Pro Dome rental which will require $15k - $20k.

If you love art, and you enjoy gifting people with an experience they will never forget, your contribution big or small will help bring this to all of our Black Rock Citizens.  Think of it like buying a ticket to a film that has the ability to delight and enlighten your heart and mind and giving that gift of a ticket to as many black rock citizens as you can!   Art needs our support culturally! Donate to make it a reality.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

This project is complete - the artwork, the virtual reality Vive stations, the projection mapped animations that create a 30 minute immersive film, a soundtrack featuring Phuturprimitive's musical soundscapes and Nimitae's sound design, the calibrated projection mapped software and projectors to place you in a 360 immersive environment....all we need are the funds to help pay for rent and transport of the delicate state-of-the-art equipment and dome to build and set it up on the playa at burning man for everyone to enjoy.

Our biggest challenge is time.  We need to raise these funds by August 23rd which is just under 30 days.

A few larger patrons at the $1k, $2k, $5k level will get us most of the way there! Plus the rest of us art aficionados at smaller contributions to help us reach out target.   Think of what you spend to see an IMax 3D movie? Or to enter into a conference to experience Virtual Reality that you can interact with? Gift yourself a 'ticket to the show' and others you know who you'd want to have that experience at burning man.

We now have the funds to bring Microdose VR to the playa in 2017, help us get the rest of the way there so that we have the full integrated installation that contains both.   Find us in Black Rock City from August 29th - September 3rd at 2 O'Clock & G at Camp Mystic.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are some create ways to help bring this project to the burn in 2017 in addition to your donations.

  • HELP US BUILD IT: If you are at the burn before gates open on Wednesday or Thursday August 23rd/24th our crew will be assembling to build and set up this incredible project.  Watch and learn what it takes to create this experience and come be a part of gifting it to black rock citizens by helping the crew.  We'll be located at Camp Mystic at 2 O'Clock & Genuflect and we'll put you to good use!
     
  • JOIN OUR CREW: We will need a crew of 24 people to help run it on playa from 9am - 9pm Tuesday - Sunday.  If you want to come be on the crew to help manage the crowds letting people into each showing and being the master of ceremonies who starts the show using our simple to use Ipad controller, we'd LOVE your help.   Reach out to us at wild@androidjones.com
     
  • GET THE WORD OUT: Share this campaign far and wide to the people you know and love! Connect us with patrons, connect us with Black Rock Citizens who would want to donate, connect us to art aficionados who know how important it is for our soul to support art.
     
  • COME EXPERIENCE IT: Come to the playa at 2 O Clock & Genuflect across from Camp Mystic in Black Rock City at Burning Man August 29th - September 3rd to experience it for yourself.  If we reach our goal, we'll be running Samskara and Microdose VR from 9am - 9pm Tuesday - Sunday.

 

Our Larger Mission

The advent of a new technology as profound as Virtual Reality demands entirely new ways of creating art. We see VR has the power to merge visual art, music, and dance into a visceral experience, never before possible, and in the process engage the minds of players into a more creative future.

Our mission is to explore the limitless possibilities of Virtual Reality, while creating a real time multiplayer gameplay platform which simultaneously unleashes an artistic movement and allows for unique expression, competition and collaboration.

We want to enable participants to alter their own minds co-creatively and intuitively, while expanding the limits of human cognition, audio and visual perception.

Microdose can become a transformative tool where participants can break through personal creative limitations, using physical movement, art and music to create a unique, interactive and cutting edge VR experience.

Find out more about Microdose and the places where it will be showcased here:

http://microdosevr.com/

 

Use of Funds: $15k - $22k

We are looking to raise $15k with a $22k stretch goal to help us assemble the crew, rent the state of the art equipment and dome, pay for transportation, build, setup, and strike of the project on the playa in 2017.

Your contributions allow us to bring the entire project to life.

  • $15,000 - Microdose VR Dome + Art Installation
  • $7,500 - Additional funds for Samskara VR Dome
  • TOTAL: $22,500 to bring all 3 Domes to life at Burning Man

 

About Android Jones

Andrew “Android” Jones is one of the world’s leading digital fantasy artists. His style is self described as “electro-mineralism” and his subjects are often on a spiritual or shamanistic in nature.

Andrew was born and raised in Boulder, Colorado. His artist parents encouraged him to pursue his own art. He attended the Ringling School of Art and Design, graduating with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Computer Animation. 

After his studies, Andrew worked at George Lucas’ Industrial Light and Magic and then as a Concept Artist at Nintendo. He was Creative Director of Massive Black, an outsourcing studio for the entertainment and advertising industry and co-founded ConceprtArt.org, a non-profit on-line community where artists meet, learn and critique each other.

“I have seen things in this life that I am incapable of translating into words. In my practice I have visited realms where the imagination ends, and the terrifying beauty of infinity unfolds over and over again.” Android Jones

story:
Short Summary

The South Bay Art Collective is a group of Burning Man enthusiasts in the Silicon Valley area who are dedicated to a year-round experience of building art for the Burning Man event.  Prior burned art pieces include:

  • 2017 - Deus Ex Machina
  • 2015 - Hare Today, Gone Tomorrow
  • 2014 - Occidental Oasis (Souk marketplace around the Man)
  • 2013 - Mission Umbrae (CORE)
  • 2012 - Valley of Heart's Delight (CORE)
  • 2011 - Laptop Man (CORE)

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise over $15,000 this year, and if we raise that we can add Burning pyrotechnic special effects!  This Worm is being designed with the burn in mind, and we promise to make it the most spectacular burn we've ever put on!  Although we have about half of our funding secured, we are really going to need help for the pyrotechnics, kinetics, and interactivity that we envision to become a reality.  Since we're kicking up the expenses a notch, the perks this year are getting kicked up a notch, too!  

With everything from exclusive custom-stitched hoodies to a participatory experience on Burn Night, we want to make sure that you feel a part of this amazing project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing on Facebook, Twitter, email and your social networks.
  • Point people to our new web page, www.southbay-artcollective.org
  • Watch for updates on www.southbayburners.org
  • Please keep checking back on this Indigogo page as we add more perks and donation levels that might be of interest to you!
