story:
How it works (simple version)

Because of the persistence of vision effect, anything which comes into our vision remains there for about 1/10th to 1/15th of a second. It is this effect that allows us to write words with sparklers in the air, perform the "bendy pencil" trick and allowed CRT TVs and monitors to function.

Globe uses a circular disk with 256 RGB LEDs around the edge which is then spun about the Z axis. By changing the colour of each LED 1920 times every rotation, and rotating 15 times a second we can create a spherical display of 491,520 pixels.

 

 

By doing a bit of processing with the electronics in the middle we are able to display any content of our choosing. An HDMI source generates the image data, an FPGA then buffers each image and distributes it to the appropriate LED driver.

For the in depth explanation as to how Globe works head on over to the blog.

How can it be controlled and what can it be used for?

Globe will come with an Android and IOS app along with a straightforward web interface. You can then upload your own media or select from a range of prebuilt content to display; simply select the desired content and add it to the sequence.

Globe’s pre-built content will allow you to display solar bodies such as Mars, Jupiter or even Ganymede, with their real time day & night cycles.  

It will also be possible to overlay a range of meteorological and environmental data onto the earth, such as cloud cover, wind speed, air pressure, temperature, lightning strikes and earthquakes, as well as human influences like air and marine traffic, national borders, rocket launches and satellite positions.

As a particularly eye catching display coupled with the fact that it can be seen from all angles, Globe is perfect for advertising and artistic displays; by placing it in the center of a room you can be sure it will draw everyone’s gaze.

 

 

 

Rewards & shipping

The exact specification of Globe may change slightly over the course of the project but its approximate specifications are:

  • Display diameter: 310mm
  • Overall housing dimensions: 400x400x700mm
  • Resolution: 1920x256
  • Weight: 15kg
  • Housing material: Anodised aluminium, wood veneer (multiple options)
  • Display case: Perspex
  • Power: 100 - 240V AC 50/60 Hz (cable provided)

The power supply will be set to correct voltage for the shipping destination. If you would like it to be set otherwise please add a note to your order.

Progress so far and work remaining

So far a proof of concept prototype has been built, clearing a large number of the hurdles in bringing Globe to life. This includes the vast bulk of the firmware coding, the majority of the PCB design and general mechanical design.

The next revision of the PCB design has been completed and is ready to be submitted for manufacture. 

The remaining development work lies mostly in software - developing the smartphone apps to allow easy control of the display and developing additional pre-built content. 

  • October - November: Kickstarter Campaign (complete!)
  • November - March: Contract software development. Hardware development.
  • March - April: Build pre-production prototype and finalise designs
  • April: Order all components
  • May: Assemble all Globes
  • June: Quality control and safety testing
  • July: Ship!

story:
The Basics

We are ready to take the next step in offering new services to our existing customers, such as an ability to offer Auto Pilot (computerized software/hardware) on our longarm machine. We are also excited about the opportunity to work with fellow quilt pattern designers to bring their patterns to market.

Each of these opportunities requires a financial investment to see them to fruition. We have personally put in approximately $75,000 to launch and grow Vector Quilts.  With your help, through this campaign, we can reach the remaining goals . 

What We Need 

Initial Goal - $24,000

  • Purchase AutoPilot computerized software for the longarm
  • Website Re-Design for Vector Quilts Publishing and Vector Quilts 
  • Technical Editors, Graphic Artists, Printing 
  • Marketing and Materials 
  • Video tutorial productions for new patterns/designers

Stretch Goal #1 - $28,000 - Additional Perks will be added when we reach the initial goal

  • Fall Market Booth
  • Enclosed Trailer
  • Booth setup materials - stands, decor, brochures

Stretch Goal #2 - $37,000- Additional Perks will be added when we reach the 1st stretch goal

  • Launch Thread pack in collaboration with Wonderfil

What You Get

We are offering some exciting perks. Each perk includes special items and deals not available elsewhere as a token of our appreciation. No matter what level you can help at we truly appreciate each and every one of you. 

The Impact

How does your support and contribution help?

  • Adding AutoPilot to the longarm allows not only pattern samples to be completed faster, thus allowing us to bring more patterns to life, it also allows us to offer more quilting services. AutoPilot will also allow us to help the Georgia chapter of Quilts of Valor with more quilting.
  • Helps us secure our booth at Fall Market, along with brochures and marketing materials to share all the designs with more shop owners
  • Helps us help more designers and quilters with some amazing designs bring those designs to life for more quilters to enjoy. 
  • Helps us to continue educating and inspiring more individuals to try new techniques

Risks & Challenges

With the perks we are offering the risks are minimal:

  • Time would be our biggest obstacle. There is the potential with teaching and travel the perks could be delayed
  • To overcome this, we are setting aside specific dates to ship out all the perks in the month they are due.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute. Here are some ways you can still help:

  • Tell your friends and family about the campaign.
  • Share it on Social Media (Facebook, Twitter and Instagram)
  • Follow us on Facebook http://www.facebook.com/vectorquilts
  • Follow us on Instagram http://www.instagram.com/vectorquilts
  • Join our Facebook group https://www.facebook.com/groups/quiltingwithdavid/

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for taking the time to learn about our campaign. 

I am excited about these next steps and the ability to continue to help, inspire and support the quilting community.

story:
PRE-ORDER ENDING SOON!

GET MAX BOOST VOLUME 2 WHILE YOU CAN!

YOU CHOOSE:  When you pre-order your books, you can select from Volume 1 or Volume 2 (either the Original or "Influencers and Friends" cover variant) or any combination therof!

 * To get your Name or Super Fan Square Printed in the book, you MUST fill out your order survey before the deadline. Details will be sent t you.  Date TBD. 

 

MAX BOOST, VOLUME 2:  Filled with 167 pages, and Issues 40-98 which is the the second half of comics (Volume 1 was Issue 1-39) plus never-before-seen art in a gorgeous, collectible hardcover, exclusively ONLY AVAILABLE for pre-order HERE!

 

 

Max Boost is a story about Max and Otto, and their adventures in Motorville as they dream of one day becoming racing legends - but first, their stock civic needs more horsepower! :sad trombone:

 

 

And, before the dream of going PRO and have their names grace the Motorville Hall of Fame, they may want to be able to defeat their arch nemesis Todd in a quartermile drag race first.

 

 

In Volume 2, the story continues with Max and Otto in their stock pea-green civic, as they drag race at IDRC in a hopeless attempt to beat Todd’s V8. When all hope seems lost, Magically, a boost button appears on their dashboard- and of course they decide to push it… and the transformation begins.


 

And from there, the story picks up quick - leading into more races, even more mayhem in Motorville.


 

You’ll have fun meeting a new cast of characters, with new tuner cars, and some more high speed hijinks along the way.

 

 

Do you remember the Super Dupra?

 

 

The AWD Twins Zig and Zag?

 

 

BUT, the world of MAX BOOST is in danger.  Cars are starting to randomly disappear- and mysterious villains from a distant world are out to destroy MOTORVILLE.

 

 

The mystical Papa Wheely is the only one who knows the secret to saving Motorville, and why Max Boost has been chosen to become a unlikely hero.

 

 

This Volume 2 is full of surprises - and heck - we even have special guest appearances - like this dude you might recognize!

 

So treat yourself to a great story, and a chance to own a rare collectible that is a part of original 90’s Tuner Culture!

 

 

And from there, close to 200 total pages of Max Boost have been published to date (Volume 1 and Volume 2 will be the complete story, up to date) about the misadventures  - from tuning upgrades, to police, drag racing, drifting, burnouts and torgue the story takes many twists and turns.

Max Boost, Volume 2 is a joy ride for all car enthusiasts and comic book fans!

 

Behind the Scenes and Additional Art Added to the Book!

ALSO IN THE BOOK: BEHIND-THE-SCENES AND ART NEVER SHARED BEFORE! 

Max Boost Volume 1 has 100 Pages of the original comic, plus 50 pages of EXTRAS and never before seen art, original sketches, and more that is only available here on Indiegogo.  And exclusively for this campaign launch, you can get add-ons and exclusive Gifts never offered before (see below)!

 

Max Boost - He is the underdog, and our unlikely hero.  Max is absolutely passionate about cars and racing, and will do anything it takes to find, build, and race the car of his dreams.  His number one enemy is Todd, and he is committed to bringing street-justice to Motorville by having Todd pay for all of the horrible things he does to those who have less horsepower than him.

And, as the story develops, we find out what roles these characters play, as the very existence of Motorville may actually depend on this young group of street-rascals...  

 

 

Otto - is Max's best friend and voice of reason.  Otto is basically the opposite of Max, as he is calm, collected, and is always thinking wisely.  However, he also knows it's almost impossible to stop Max when he has a "great idea", and knows it's better just get out of his way (and sometimes more entertaining!).  As a master tactician, Otto, has the skill of gently guiding Max along so he doesn't hurt himself... too much.

 

 

Todd -  Big V8, BIG Pistons, and even BIGGER EGO.  Todd is the town jock that you love to hate, and he makes it a "sport" to harass Max and Otto, and anyone else under 500 horsepower.  Maybe one day, Max and Otto will be able to teach him a lesson in humility, but they will need to find some horsepower and torque first!

 

 

Papa Wheely and his henchmen, Yin, Yan and Wok - He has the Horsepower and Torque!  Papa Wheely is the Proprietor of Papa Wheely's Performance Pagoda.  He's the one to see if you want you tuner car, tuned - but for a PRICE!

AND, if you don't make your payments on time, you may end up meeting the his "Wu Tang Wack!"

 

 

Ese and 'Efe - The leaders of the Low Rider crew from Low Co., Ese and Efe' patrol the streets of Lotting Park - with 3 wheel motion, on chrome & white walls.  Don't get caught by them at the wrong time, in the wrong place, or you might find yourself getting "hit by switches".

 

 

Rip, Slug, Torch- Three mysterious bad dudes from a mysterious place have come to Motorville with suspicious motives.  Are they just looters? Or are the part of a bigger plan leading to the distruction of Motorville?  Let's find out...

And, that's not all, there are many, many more characters in Max Boost for you to meet!

My name is Dennis Caco and I am passionate about cars, racing, and making comic books and in 1998 I helped design Import Tuner Magazine, and combined my love for cars and comics to create Max Boost which was a monthly feature in the magazine.

 

So, after we launched Import Tuner, we realized that Max Boost was a ABSOLUTE HIT with the readers, and MANY people subscribed to the magazine because of Max Boost.  And over the years, the magazine grew, and the Max Boost Fanbase grew with it.

Now, 22 years later, this car culture has established itself and is as vibrant as ever.  Which is why I decided it was time to bring back Max Boost for the original generation of readers, as well as new fans alike.

In 2019, we lauched a Volume 1 on another platform to bring Max Boost back!  We put the first 4 years (of 8 years) of Max Boost into a collectible volume and it was a success with over $54,000+ in pre-orders made and over 1000 books sold!

So now we're back with Volume 2, continuing the story as it was first printed in Import Tuner Magazine!

So I would hope that you would take a look, and "back this project", and help us make this Max Boost, Volume 2 a reality!

 

 

THANK GOD FOR THE FANS AND FRIENDS! -

Despite that all those years I was in hibernation, I received a lot of love.  One of my greatest joys is meeting Max Boost Fans in real life, and / or getting Fan messages.

In particular, I love getting  messages from those who were too young to drive when they first read Max Boost and now have tuner cars of their own. These stories kept reminding me that I should never have stopped drawing Max Boost- and if Max Boost, Volume 1 is successful -  I can bring Max Boost back for the next generation of tuner fans!

Even though I took a mental break for over 10 years, inspiration came in an unlikely event.  My younger brother (he's 18 years younger than me) got into the tuner scene (on his own, I had no influence I swear!) and eventually asked me to bring him to the racetrack for the first time.

And little did he know, combined with support from one of our original Max Boost + Autocannon crew Memo Quibrera, and jumping into Sam Rothschilds Honda Challenge Series championship winning CRX race car for the first time in YEARS - they reignited my need for speed, and my itch to bring Max Boost back!

 

 

So why am I on Indiegogo?

I put over a decade of my life and sweat into Max Boost.  I invested everything I could to continue to make Max Boost for the people, and pursued the dream furiously.

8 years into it, in 2006, Everything was going perfect and Max Boost was on a roll.  We got some serious momentum when we partnered with Playmates Toys (the Ninja Turtle Company) to make Max Boost Toys and we were even on our way to landing video games, and a deal for Saturday Morning Cartoons with Warner Bros.

And then suddenly, the WB contract was cancelled -I hit rock bottom [Lost almost everything, and stopped drawing Max Boost to take a mental break.  I was devastated, as everything seemed to have fallen apart, and the hard work from so many was not actualized.

And, well, my “short" mental break ended up being more than 10 years.

I never stopped believing in Max Boost.  I never stopped loving cars, comics, and this culture.

So I'm here, to put the control back in my hands - and build a MAX BOOST TEAM with YOU (yes YOU) - to launch more products that YOU WANT TO SEE without needing the studios or big names.  I realized with the power of community, we can actually do this independently.

 

 

So Max Boost Volume 2 is the SECOND step of MANY.  So, if this campaign is successful, it will allow us to continue with our NEXT STEPS:

  • Max Boost Volume 3
  • Animation
  • Toys
  • Netflix Show? :)
  • AND MORE....

Like my own life, Max Boost is a true Underdog story, where you're put up against all odds and still have to find a way to succeed.  Max Boost was simply a dream, and though hard work, long nights sleeping under drawing tables, and being a starving artist (literally), I was able to create something that fans worldwide loved.

 


Max Boost is perfect for all gear heads, tuners, and comicbook fans looking for something that has deep roots and history in the Car Culture Or anyone who just love anime, cars, high speed hijinx, and a good ol' underdog story about a little hatch back “that could".

So this is where YOU come in...Max Boost is ONLY available here, at a discount, with Bonuses in hopes you will become part of the Max Boost Fam reserve your very own limited first edition copies, today,

Simply click below to "Back this Project" to keep this dream alive!

Please contribute today, share with your friends, and become part of Team Max Boost!

Drive Fast. Race Hard.

Dennis Caco & Memo Quibrera, Marat Zabelinskiy, Dan Wilson, and the Max Boost Crew

The Back Story . . . .

I am a father of two wonderful little kids.

They are growing up well, kind, and joyful (and some times just a little too much energy – but that's good, right?). I'm married to a wonderful lady who is as smart as she is beautiful. I've dedicated my professional life to ministry, non-profits, and providing care for others. In many ways, I had a really good life. And I still do.

 

But I became sick.

 

It started with a little fall. Easy to pass off at the time as a little too much work and not enough sleep. But I kept falling. I also have started to bump into things. At times, it feels like my feet are stuck to the floor and it's hard to move. And finally the hand shaking started.

Then there are the sweats. The agitation. At times its hard to put words to my thoughts. I have started to find it harder and harder to be in groups of people or out in public. Especially where I have to speak. Many times now, I have my wife order for me at restaurants, bless her.

 

A pair of referrals to two different specialists finally pinpointed what's been going on. I have Parkinson's Disease compounded by Panic Disorder. The combination has made functioning as a minister impossible. While it was clear that I was becoming sicker, what wasn't clear was how I would care for my family.

 

Through some blessed souls in my denomination, I've been granted disability and released me from ministry. When I heard those words, a huge weight was lifted off my heart. The denomination (Board of Pensions, PCUSA) has agreed to take care of me in my sickness and they give us a stipend for living expenses. It's not a lot but it's enough for daily needs for my family.

 

First off, thank you for everyone who has brought me this far. Family, friends, co-workers, doctors, clinicians, and church leadership. I am very grateful for you walking through this with me.

 

However, I now have a new problem – what in God's great name do I do with all my free time?

I am used to working 50+ hrs a week.

Now I have to stay at home for the lion's share of the time.

My wife has a career (bless her). My kids go to school. The rest of my family works.

My illnesses – between physical limitations and social – makes it hard for me to travel by myself.

 

Now, I find great personal value in creating. So, I need something I can do at home that allows me to create that I hope will have a positive benefit to others as well as my family. I already turn wood, combined with other skills, the thought came to me.

 

So, I'm making a wood shop: "For Every Season Crafting".

 

I don't expect to make a full time job of this. I just want something to keep me busy at the house, and I can put away a little extra money for my children's college funds.

 

What do I need?

I already have a fairly well outfitted workshop. But to go in this new direction, I need to add an expensive tool to my collection: I need to purchase a CNC Router. And there just isn't extra in the budget with what I receive for disability.

 

Ideal System:

Extended-Bed CNC                                   $6,500 .00   A nice work space.

Software (3D, 2D, & photo engraver)  $1,000.00   Allows me to draw more on the pc.

Shop Computer                                           $1,000.00   A dedicated computer for the CNC.

Water Cooled Spindle System                $1,000.00  Allows a longer cutting time (& quieter!)

Laser Engraver Head                                  $1,000.00  Allows for engraving photos & shading.

Wood Allotment                                           $1,000.00  Wood Stock for crafting.

Dust Collection                                                $500.00  Helps keep sawdust out of my lungs

Ideal Project Total:                                    $13,000.00

This would take just a little over 500 people giving $25! It's possible!

 

Fall Back System

Bench Sized CNC                                         $3,000.00     A smaller work space.

Software (2D desktop only)                         $500.00    Only able to make flat work.

                                                                                                      (I would be limited to signs)

Wood Allotment:                                              $500.00    A smaller amount of wood.

Fall Back Project Total:                              $4,000.00

This takes only 160 people giving $25. Still a great fall back.

 

Every little bit helps! Even $1 is a $1 closer to my goal.

Thank you for considering sharing your hard earned money with this project.

Accountability:

I will have a blog along with the shop that will chronicle my progress through the start up. On the blog I will be very upfront with each cost and where funds are going.

Anyone will be able to see exactly the running total.

What do I expect out of the project:

Like any good business plan or investment, return on investment is important. This helps to maintain focus and help people to understand the scale of the project. I expect that it will take six to twelve months to come up to full production and demand.

 

I am expecting, after a tool up / establishment period, to make approximately $9,000 a year ($850 a month in sales). This will allow me to invest about $3,500 to each child's college 529 plan ($7,000 total). My eldest is in 2nd grade. So after ten years, she will have at least $35,000 to help with college.

 

I expect about $1,000 to $1,500 being dedicated to maintenance and consumables per year. The remainder I will place in my HSA. Any amount made above plans will be balanced in the 529's, shop investment, and donations to local needs (e.g. food pantries, housing assistance programs, faith-based initiatives).

 

Shop products will be sold via online Etsy shop (For Every Season Co), Cleveland area craft shows, word of mouth, and direct commission pieces. With my years in ministry, I have numerous connections who I might be able to serve through my shop.

 

What do I hope to make?

Signs, Plaques, and Housing Markers. ($50-200)

Personalized Urns ($50-150) for people & pets. I would be able to make an urn for a family with a beloved person / pet's image, name, and date for a reasonable price. If you have ever been in a place to purchase such a thing, you know how much they can cost!

Replacement Parts for Churches, Synagogues, & Temples. ($ various) Places of worship receive a lot of wear (things break!) and need one piece of wood, or one spindle for the rail, little jobs that can normally be cost prohibitive for a large production shop to tool up for just one piece.

Christmas Ornaments ($5-25) and other seasonal items.

Computer Cases ($150-300) Aren't you sick of everything being metal? We live with the things every day; lets make them look nice.

 

What are my credentials?

Anyone who knows me, knows I am a geek.

 

I was less than 8 years old when I started on my first computer – and that was something in the early 80's. I've been working on, fixing, and building computers since then. I've also been drawing on computers off and on since then. I know Autocad, Illustrator, Photoshop, and now learning 3D modeling for the CNC machine.

 

On the other side, I'm the third generation wood worker in my family. My grandfather was a finish carpenter. My father makes custom furniture in his shop as does my brother. Together as a family, we have refurbished about six houses.

 

So the chance to combine my geeky-ness and my wood-crafting into one avenue is a perfect match!

 

I've been using a small knife CNC (Silhouette) to make paper and vinyl items for ministry for almost 8 years now. Going to a CNC-Router is just larger and change in medium (wood). I've served people in my career as an ordained minister for nearly eighteen years, trying my best to be welcoming and affirming to all in the name of God.

 

Why “For Every Season”?

 

 For everything there is a season, and a time for every matter under heaven:

a time to be born, and a time to die;
a time to plant, and a time to pluck up what is planted;
 a time to kill, and a time to heal;
a time to break down, and a time to build up;
a time to weep, and a time to laugh;
a time to mourn, and a time to dance;
a time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together;
a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;
a time to seek, and a time to lose;
a time to keep, and a time to cast away;
a time to tear, and a time to sew;
a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;
 a time to love, and a time to hate;
a time for war, and a time for peace.

 What gain has the worker from his toil?  I have seen the business that God has given to the children of man to be busy with.  He has made everything beautiful in its time. Also, he has put eternity into man's heart, yet so that he cannot find out what God has done from the beginning to the end. I perceived that there is nothing better for them than to be joyful and to do good as long as they live; also that everyone should eat and drink and take pleasure in all his toil—this is God's gift to man.

 

For Every Season references Ecclesiastes 3 from the Hebrew Bible / Old Testament. That is where the Byrds found it for their 1965 hit “Turn, Turn, Turn” (see the link below). Ecclesiastes is a special book from what is called wisdom literature. Job, Psalms, Proverbs, Song of Songs are the other wisdom books - add Wisdom and Sirach if you have the Apocrypha. Wisdom Books try to help the reader to understand and reach for wisdom in life.

 

Ecclesiastes (and chapter 3 specifically) teach that there is a time for everything. Our lives are going to experience change. And that is ok. Change isn't the enemy. If we keep the right focus in our life, no matter what the change is, it will be fine. So, as I am facing a new change in my life, it has resonated with me. Also, going forward, the woodworker's role is to change milled wood into a piece. In so many ways, it is particularly fitting.

 

If you now have the Byrds' song in your head! : www.youtube.com/watch?v=eiprqeaydik

 

Perks!

So, what's in it for you? Well, other than supporting a disabled father / minister AND help me raise money for my children's college, I have some awesome perks available to donors including:


A personal thank you card featuring original artwork

Christmas / Holiday Ornament → Artwork coming soon!

Baltic Birch Cross with Ecclesiastes 3:1 (opt other religious symbol / verse – just ask!)

Custom Wedding / Anniversary Memento

Custom family plaque (contact for details – like coat of arms / family tree, etc) 

Custom Urn

Lunch or Dinner (might even do Breakfast!) & Shop Tour with introduction to CNC Router

And more perks to be announced!  

 

Can't donate?

Thank you for taking the time to read about our campaign and read my story. I'm excited to start making sawdust in my shop and having something to get me dreaming again. If you feel compelled to donate, any amount is appreciated. If you cannot donate at this time, but would still like to support this project, please share this campaign with friends and family. We will keep this campaign updated about our progress and any updates.


 

For more information, contact ForEverySeasonCo@gmail.com.

Please understand that typing can be hard depending on how I'm doing that day. I endeavor to answer all emails within two (2) business days. Thank you for your understanding.


 

Know someone with Parkinson's Disease?

Visit the National Parkinson's Foundation (www.parkinson.org)

 

Know someone with an Anxiety Disorder?

Visit the Anxiety & Depression Assoc. of America (www.adaa.org)


 

Please do not suffer alone. There are good people out there to help & care for you.

Thank you.

Matthew Z. “For Every Season Crafting”
story_txt:
UPDATE!!I really need your help! Revised budget & fund needs! So, a friend at a local tool vendor who knows of the project (Thanks Mike!) let me know of a promotion of a medium sized CNC-Router that includes a laser module! That's like a $850 value and free included shipping (with the CNC). It also includes some basic software that can be upgraded at reduced cost which will cut my requirement in half! This saves the cost of the laser & software and quite a bit in shipping! But I need to get an order in soon – actually before the end of the campaign. Here's the new system: Revised System:HD4 Medium bed CNC                      $4,500.00 Can be upgraded in the futureV-Carve Software                                   $500.00 Upgrade to V-Carve Pro & Photo CarveLaser Engraver Head                              $0.00! Included! (an over $850 value!)Wood Allotment:                                  $500.00 Still need stuff to cut!Ideal Project Total:                          $5,500.00 (under 1/2 of “ideal” system) We have less than 18 days  left! And to make make this revised system possible, we need to raise a bit over $2,600. Basically we need to double what we've received so far. So to help get this in gear in the home coming stretch – Michelle and I have agreed to add a new perk at the $50 mark – a custom coffee cup, featuring our new logo! The Back Story . . . .I am a father of two wonderful little kids.They are growing up well, kind, and joyful (and some times just a little too much energy – but that's good, right?). I'm married to a wonderful lady who is as smart as she is beautiful. I've dedicated my professional life to ministry, non-profits, and providing care for others. In many ways, I had a really good life. And I still do. But I became sick. It started with a little fall. Easy to pass off at the time as a little too much work and not enough sleep. But I kept falling. I also have started to bump into things. At times, it feels like my feet are stuck to the floor and it's hard to move. And finally the hand shaking started.Then there are the sweats. The agitation. At times its hard to put words to my thoughts. I have started to find it harder and harder to be in groups of people or out in public. Especially where I have to speak. Many times now, I have my wife order for me at restaurants, bless her. A pair of referrals to two different specialists finally pinpointed what's been going on. I have Parkinson's Disease compounded by Panic Disorder. The combination has made functioning as a minister impossible. While it was clear that I was becoming sicker, what wasn't clear was how I would care for my family. Through some blessed souls in my denomination, I've been granted disability and released me from ministry. When I heard those words, a huge weight was lifted off my heart. The denomination (Board of Pensions, PCUSA) has agreed to take care of me in my sickness and they give us a stipend for living expenses. It's not a lot but it's enough for daily needs for my family. First off, thank you for everyone who has brought me this far. Family, friends, co-workers, doctors, clinicians, and church leadership. I am very grateful for you walking through this with me. However, I now have a new problem – what in God's great name do I do with all my free time?I am used to working 50+ hrs a week.Now I have to stay at home for the lion's share of the time.My wife has a career (bless her). My kids go to school. The rest of my family works.My illnesses – between physical limitations and social – makes it hard for me to travel by myself. Now, I find great personal value in creating. So, I need something I can do at home that allows me to create that I hope will have a positive benefit to others as well as my family. I already turn wood, combined with other skills, the thought came to me. So, I'm making a wood shop: "For Every Season Crafting". I don't expect to make a full time job of this. I just want something to keep me busy at the house, and I can put away a little extra money for my children's college funds. What do I need?I already have a fairly well outfitted workshop. But to go in this new direction, I need to add an expensive tool to my collection: I need to purchase a CNC Router. And there just isn't extra in the budget with what I receive for disability. Ideal System:Extended-Bed CNC                                   $6,500 .00   A nice work space.Software (3D, 2D, & photo engraver)  $1,000.00   Allows me to draw more on the pc.Shop Computer                                           $1,000.00   A dedicated computer for the CNC.Water Cooled Spindle System                $1,000.00  Allows a longer cutting time (& quieter!)Laser Engraver Head                                  $1,000.00  Allows for engraving photos & shading.Wood Allotment                                           $1,000.00  Wood Stock for crafting.Dust Collection                                                $500.00  Helps keep sawdust out of my lungsIdeal Project Total:                                    $13,000.00This would take just a little over 500 people giving $25! It's possible! Fall Back SystemBench Sized CNC                                         $3,000.00     A smaller work space.Software (2D desktop only)                         $500.00    Only able to make flat work.                                                                                                      (I would be limited to signs)Wood Allotment:                                              $500.00    A smaller amount of wood.Fall Back Project Total:                              $4,000.00This takes only 160 people giving $25. Still a great fall back. Every little bit helps! Even $1 is a $1 closer to my goal.Thank you for considering sharing your hard earned money with this project. Timeline:
Expected opening of campaign August 28th
Examples posted – beginning work September 1st
Examples posted – Christmas Ornaments September 8th
Examples posted – example of family crest September 15th
Examples posted – example of an urn September 22nd
Final push – watch for last minute surprises September 29th
End of campaign October 4th 2017
Ordering CNC & Equipment October 6th 2017
Arrival (expected) of CNC October 22nd -26th
Build Time October 26th – November 3rd
Production Start November 10th
Shipment of Perk Items no later than November 30th
 Accountability:I will have a blog along with the shop that will chronicle my progress through the start up. On the blog I will be very upfront with each cost and where funds are going.Anyone will be able to see exactly the running total.What do I expect out of the project:Like any good business plan or investment, return on investment is important. This helps to maintain focus and help people to understand the scale of the project. I expect that it will take six to twelve months to come up to full production and demand. I am expecting, after a tool up / establishment period, to make approximately $9,000 a year ($850 a month in sales). This will allow me to invest about $3,500 to each child's college 529 plan ($7,000 total). My eldest is in 2nd grade. So after ten years, she will have at least $35,000 to help with college. I expect about $1,000 to $1,500 being dedicated to maintenance and consumables per year. The remainder I will place in my HSA. Any amount made above plans will be balanced in the 529's, shop investment, and donations to local needs (e.g. food pantries, housing assistance programs, faith-based initiatives). Shop products will be sold via online Etsy shop (For Every Season Co), Cleveland area craft shows, word of mouth, and direct commission pieces. With my years in ministry, I have numerous connections who I might be able to serve through my shop. What do I hope to make?Signs, Plaques, and Housing Markers. ($50-200)Personalized Urns ($50-150) for people & pets. I would be able to make an urn for a family with a beloved person / pet's image, name, and date for a reasonable price. If you have ever been in a place to purchase such a thing, you know how much they can cost!Replacement Parts for Churches, Synagogues, & Temples. ($ various) Places of worship receive a lot of wear (things break!) and need one piece of wood, or one spindle for the rail, little jobs that can normally be cost prohibitive for a large production shop to tool up for just one piece.Christmas Ornaments ($5-25) and other seasonal items.Computer Cases ($150-300) Aren't you sick of everything being metal? We live with the things every day; lets make them look nice. What are my credentials?Anyone who knows me, knows I am a geek. I was less than 8 years old when I started on my first computer – and that was something in the early 80's. I've been working on, fixing, and building computers since then. I've also been drawing on computers off and on since then. I know Autocad, Illustrator, Photoshop, and now learning 3D modeling for the CNC machine. On the other side, I'm the third generation wood worker in my family. My grandfather was a finish carpenter. My father makes custom furniture in his shop as does my brother. Together as a family, we have refurbished about six houses. So the chance to combine my geeky-ness and my wood-crafting into one avenue is a perfect match! I've been using a small knife CNC (Silhouette) to make paper and vinyl items for ministry for almost 8 years now. Going to a CNC-Router is just larger and change in medium (wood). I've served people in my career as an ordained minister for nearly eighteen years, trying my best to be welcoming and affirming to all in the name of God. Why “For Every Season”?  For everything there is a season, and a time for every matter under heaven:a time to be born, and a time to die;a time to plant, and a time to pluck up what is planted; a time to kill, and a time to heal;a time to break down, and a time to build up;a time to weep, and a time to laugh;a time to mourn, and a time to dance;a time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together;a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;a time to seek, and a time to lose;a time to keep, and a time to cast away;a time to tear, and a time to sew;a time to keep silence, and a time to speak; a time to love, and a time to hate;a time for war, and a time for peace. What gain has the worker from his toil?  I have seen the business that God has given to the children of man to be busy with.  He has made everything beautiful in its time. Also, he has put eternity into man's heart, yet so that he cannot find out what God has done from the beginning to the end. I perceived that there is nothing better for them than to be joyful and to do good as long as they live; also that everyone should eat and drink and take pleasure in all his toil—this is God's gift to man. For Every Season references Ecclesiastes 3 from the Hebrew Bible / Old Testament. That is where the Byrds found it for their 1965 hit “Turn, Turn, Turn” (see the link below). Ecclesiastes is a special book from what is called wisdom literature. Job, Psalms, Proverbs, Song of Songs are the other wisdom books - add Wisdom and Sirach if you have the Apocrypha. Wisdom Books try to help the reader to understand and reach for wisdom in life. Ecclesiastes (and chapter 3 specifically) teach that there is a time for everything. Our lives are going to experience change. And that is ok. Change isn't the enemy. If we keep the right focus in our life, no matter what the change is, it will be fine. So, as I am facing a new change in my life, it has resonated with me. Also, going forward, the woodworker's role is to change milled wood into a piece. In so many ways, it is particularly fitting. If you now have the Byrds' song in your head! : www.youtube.com/watch?v=eiprqeaydik Perks!So, what's in it for you? Well, other than supporting a disabled father / minister AND help me raise money for my children's college, I have some awesome perks available to donors including:A personal thank you card featuring original artworkChristmas / Holiday Ornament → Artwork coming soon!Baltic Birch Cross with Ecclesiastes 3:1 (opt other religious symbol / verse – just ask!)Custom Wedding / Anniversary MementoCustom family plaque (contact for details – like coat of arms / family tree, etc) Custom UrnLunch or Dinner (might even do Breakfast!) & Shop Tour with introduction to CNC RouterAnd more perks to be announced!   Can't donate?Thank you for taking the time to read about our campaign and read my story. I'm excited to start making sawdust in my shop and having something to get me dreaming again. If you feel compelled to donate, any amount is appreciated. If you cannot donate at this time, but would still like to support this project, please share this campaign with friends and family. We will keep this campaign updated about our progress and any updates. For more information, contact ForEverySeasonCo@gmail.com.Please understand that typing can be hard depending on how I'm doing that day. I endeavor to answer all emails within two (2) business days. Thank you for your understanding. Know someone with Parkinson's Disease?Visit the National Parkinson's Foundation (www.parkinson.org) Know someone with an Anxiety Disorder?Visit the Anxiety & Depression Assoc. of America (www.adaa.org) Please do not suffer alone. There are good people out there to help & care for you.Thank you.Matthew Z. “For Every Season Crafting”

story:
Short Summary

The Giving Tree is a weeping willow tree, to be a sanctuary from the hottest desert days. Where you can mingle with new friends, climb a tree, relax in the shade, maybe even catch a ride to a new destination. Leave your markings and symbols on the tree for others to be inspired along the way. We are here to share stories about our roots and where we've come from and where we are going. Throughout the week as citizens of BRC express their feelings around the trunk and roots of the trees fabric with permanent markers those symbols, words and stories will be told even when the creator has moved on. The week at BRC will bring life to The Giving Tree! Help us bring this dream HOME-)'(-for 2017 Thanks to all who are following/like us.

What We Need & What You Get

We have already invested. We bought the bus and have constructed our second level deck with safety railings all around. We have 3500 watts of continuous green energy to power all systems which has already been installed and has room to expand. To be able to finish our dream we need your help so we can bring The Giving Tree home to the playa in 2017. Your funding will go to the following.

~ $3000 will achieve our goal for our night lighting plan which consist of 40 RGB 18 watt fiber optics, 200 strands per light at 6 ft long which is going to hang from the branch for a glowing willow vine effect. We plan on 6 RGB 50 watt flood lights for a ground effect under the roots and 12 black lights to create a glow from inside the tree around the upper viewing deck. 

~$2000 Will achieve our goal for the day time effect of the willow vines. We will be stringing 40,000 ft of different shades of green parachute cord from the branches to hang like willow vines. These will incorporate with the fiber optic strands to look amazing day or night!

~$2000 Will achieve our goal for the metal we still need to complete the skeleton of the roots and the branches that will support all the willow vines and fiber optic lights. They will be fabricated out of 700 ft of 1 -1/4 inch and 1 inch electrical conduit. Then we will wrap the conduit with 400 ft of chicken wire to sculpt more shape to the branches/roots and to hide the metal skeleton of the branches/roots and light units. We will later wrap brownish fabric around the chicken wire to hide everything and bring the branches/roots to a realistic look.

~$1500 Will achieve our goal to cover all the branches/roots and the trunk of the tree. The tree trunk fabric will be fastened all around the bus to shape the trunk and hide the base vehicle. We will be needing  1500 square feet of brown fabric to cover everything.

~$1500 Will achieve our goal for estimated hardware such as cotter pins to hold all branches and roots in place. It will also cover welding gas, welding wire, metal cutting disc, nuts and bolts, extension cords and electrical wire to hook up lighting and sound. As well as expanding foam for sculpting a face for the front of the tree trunk, brown paint to paint the face and other miscellaneous hardware etc.

~ Check out our awesome perks they are all listed and described on this page.

~ If we don't reach our goal we will have to scale back the "WOW" factor by one of several ways... We hope to NOT have to do this with your HELP!!! We will scale back the amount of parachute cord by half. Also we can scale back the lighting as much as possible to still achieve our night license or worst case no lighting at all.... and just a day license. Regardless what happens I will work day and night to get my dream to the playa this year 2017! It's gonna happen even if I have to work 3 jobs! I know I will have the support of my friends, family, and wonderful community of Denver CO burners. All are ready to help get their hands dirty and enjoy a building experience of life! Together we can make any dream a reality. Help us water The Giving Tree Art Car.

The Impact

With the contributions from all of YOU beautiful people you can help us make one of the most visually stimulating, heart felt experiences the playa has been waiting for. As you walk and climb around The Giving Tree you will see the "WOW" factor in our extreme attention to detail. Along the way you will be able to read what others have carved into the fabric by permanent marker. Reading the trees Symbols, Stories, and  Radical Expressions to motivate you to leave your own mark for the future of Radical Rituals. We hope for The Giving Tree Art Car to travel the country and maybe even the world to share the power of GIVING!!!!

Our team has strong roots in building art cars. We have a combined effort with 4 years of mutant vehicles on the playa. In 2013, Jason/team member, crowd funded and build the SS Tittyhawk aircraft carrier art car and brought it to the Playa. We were successful in reaching our goals and the DMV approved us on playa for our day and night license showing that we have an outstanding track record building art cars and meeting our goal and most importantly impressing the community with the art. Without the community coming together we would not be able to achieve these goals and for that we thank you ahead of time.

Risks & Challenges 

My team and I have discussed many angles of this project. We have addressed any moop issue and solved it by deciding to use better art material Any weight concerns of the branches and art materials have been taken into consideration for safety and will be structurally sound and securely fastened to the base vehicle. My team and I have gone over our build plan several times to further make it more achievable. Without ever forgetting about the "WOW" factor! All successful projects have a plan and I must say my team and I plan to execute this build to the highest degree of excellence. We will approach any challenge knowing there is always a solution... for a better tomorrow. If any risks present themselves we will address them with a full heart to find a reasonable solution. The largest hurdle my team and I face is FINANCIALLY, that is why we are here to ask for your help and support along the way! My team and I have lots of fabricating, welding, sculpting, designing, engineering, and of course artistic backgrounds! Together we will solve any issues we have along the way to make sure the The Giving Tree Art Car makes it to playa for 2017 with all the bells and whistle the team and YOU can think of. We are always open to suggestions.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can support financially and that's okay. We plan on scheduling a couple fundraiser get-togethers and also some large build days in an airpot hangar near Denver International Airport. So if you can make it out or you are in the area around the months of June and July, (more info on exact dates will come soon), we would love to meet all of you and share our dream with the community as it brings us together. If the only way you can help is to spread the word of The Giving Tree to friends and family through Facebook and Indiegogo then by all means share it, we love you for any way you can help. If you've been here you know how much effort this takes. Help us set our dream free.
